original: 'di la mthar rab tu phyin pa yod pa'i phyir rab kyi mtha' pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la mthar rab tu phyin pa yod pa'i phyir rab kyi mtha' pa'o //
translated: It is the summit because it is the ultimate limit of the summit.

analyzed: mu bzhi pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na mu bzhi ba ni dri ma rnam pa bzhi yin pa de dang 'dra'o //

analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The domain of superknowledge is the object of the superknowledge of the domain of supernormal knowledge.

original: mngon par shes pa drug ni rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa mngon du bya ba dang / lha'i rna ba dang / sems kyi rnam grangs dang / sngon gyi gnas dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug ni rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa mngon du bya ba dang / lha'i rna ba dang / sems kyi rnam grangs dang / sngon gyi gnas dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'o //
translated: The six superknowledges are the superknowledge of the domain of supernormal knowledge, the divine ear, the knowledge of the minds of others, the recollection of former lives, the knowledge of the passing away and rebirth of beings, and the superknowledge of the destruction of the impurities.

original: 'dir mdo ni 'di na dge slong rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa rnam pa du ma nyams su myong bar byed de /🔽gcig tu gyur nas mang por 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dir mdo ni 'di na dge slong rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa rnam pa du ma nyams su myong bar byed de / gcig tu gyur nas mang por 'gyur //
translated: Here the sutra says, “Here a bhikṣu, having attained the superknowledge of the domain of supernormal knowledge, experiences various supernormal manifestations.🔽He becomes one and then many.

original: mang por gyur nas gcig tu 'gyur //
analyzed: mang por gyur nas gcig tu 'gyur //
translated: He becomes many and then one.

original: zhes bya ba nas 'di ni rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes bzhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar 'byung ba yin te /

original: gzhung rgyas par ni /🔽rdzu 'phrul rkang pa ting nge 'dzin //
analyzed: gzhung rgyas par ni / rdzu 'phrul rkang pa ting nge 'dzin //

analyzed: zhes bya ba der bris par blta bar bya'o //

original: de bzhin du 'di na dge slong lha'i rna ba rnam par dag @277b pa mi las 'das pas mi dang mi ma yin pa'i sgra thag ring po na yod pa gang dag yin pa 'am /🔽thag nye ba na yod pa gang dag yin pa yang rung gnyi ga thos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di na dge slong lha'i rna ba rnam par dag @277b pa mi las 'das pas mi dang mi ma yin pa'i sgra thag ring po na yod pa gang dag yin pa 'am / thag nye ba na yod pa gang dag yin pa yang rung gnyi ga thos te /
translated: Similarly, here a monk, with the purified divine ear, which surpasses the human ear, hears both kinds of sounds, divine and human, whether far or near.

original: 'di ni lha'i rna ba shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lha'i rna ba shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the superknowledge that is the knowledge of the divine ear.

original: 'di na dge slong lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi'i las 'das pas sems can rnams mthong ste zhes bya ba nas 'di ni lha'i mig shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gzhung mdo mang po las 'byung ba bzhin
analyzed: 'di na dge slong lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi'i las 'das pas sems can rnams mthong ste zhes bya ba nas 'di ni lha'i mig shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gzhung mdo mang po las 'byung ba bzhin
translated: Here a bhikṣu, with his mind that is purified and cleansed, free from defilements, supple, wieldy, steady, and unshakable, directs his mind to the knowledge of the passing away and rebirth of sentient beings.🔽He sees sentient beings passing away and being reborn, inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, in good and bad destinies.🔽He understands how sentient beings are reborn according to their karma.🔽This is called the superknowledge that is the direct knowledge of the divine eye.🔽Here a bhikṣu, with his mind that is purified and cleansed, free from defilements, supple, wieldy, steady, and unshakable, directs his mind to the knowledge of the passing away and rebirth of sentient beings.🔽He sees sentient beings passing away and being reborn, inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, in good and bad destinies.🔽He understands how sentient beings are reborn according to their karma.🔽This is called the superknowledge that is the direct knowledge of the divine eye.

original: no // 'di na dge slong sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rjes su dran te zhes bya ba nas 'di ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar dang / 'di na dge slong sems can gzhan dang gang zag gzhan dag ni yid kyi rtog pa dang dpyod pa yid kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes te /

translated: Here a bhikṣu, with his mind that is purified and cleansed, free from defilements, supple, wieldy, steady, and unshakable, directs his mind to the knowledge of the passing away and rebirth of sentient beings.🔽He sees sentient beings passing away and being reborn, inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, in good and bad destinies.🔽He understands how sentient beings are reborn according to their karma.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems la 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems so zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems la 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems so zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
translated: This is called the superknowledge that is the direct knowledge of the divine eye.🔽Here a bhikṣu, with his mind that is purified and cleansed, free from defilements, supple, wieldy, steady, and unshakable, directs his mind to the knowledge of the passing away and rebirth of sentient beings.🔽He sees sentient beings passing away and being reborn, inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, in good and bad destinies.🔽He understands how sentient beings are reborn according to their karma.🔽This is called the superknowledge that is the direct knowledge of the divine eye.🔽Here a bhikṣu, with his mind that is purified and cleansed, free

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems so zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //🔽zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba dang / rnam par g-yengs pa dang / kun du bsdus pa dang / zhum pa dang / rab tu 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems so zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so // zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba dang / rnam par g-yengs pa dang / kun du bsdus pa dang / zhum pa dang / rab tu 'dzin pa dang /
translated: He knows as it really is a mind free from passion as a mind free from passion.🔽He knows as it really is a mind with hatred, a mind free from hatred, a mind with ignorance, a mind free from ignorance, a distracted mind, a contracted mind, a depressed mind, an exalted mind,

original: rgod pa dang / rgod pa ma yin pa dang / rnam par ma zhi ba dang / rnam par zhi ba dang / mnyam par bzhag pa dang / rnam par bzhag pa ma yin pa dang / ma bsgoms pa dang / bsgoms pa dang / sems rnam par ma grol ba la sems rnam par ma grol ba'o zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
analyzed: rgod pa dang / rgod pa ma yin pa dang / rnam par ma zhi ba dang / rnam par zhi ba dang / mnyam par bzhag pa dang / rnam par bzhag pa ma yin pa dang / ma bsgoms pa dang / bsgoms pa dang / sems rnam par ma grol ba la sems rnam par ma grol ba'o zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
translated: a mind with conceptualization, a mind without conceptualization, a mind at peace, a mind not at peace, a concentrated mind, an unconcentrated mind, a liberated mind, and an unliberated mind as an unliberated mind.

original: sems rnam par grol ba la sems rnam par grol ba'o zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes te /
analyzed: sems rnam par grol ba la sems rnam par grol ba'o zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes te /
translated: He knows as it really is: “The mind is liberated.”

original: 'di ni sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is called the superknowledge that is the knowledge of the categories of the mind.

original: 'di na dge slong 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'di na dge slong 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
translated: Here, a monk knows as it really is: “This is the noble truth of suffering.”

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: This is the origin of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
translated: This is the cessation of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya @278a * //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya @278a * //
translated: This is the noble truth of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering.

original: bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
analyzed: bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows as it really is:

original: de ltar shes shing de ltar mthong ba de 'dod pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de ltar shes shing de ltar mthong ba de 'dod pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur //
translated: “When he knows and sees thus, his mind is liberated from the taint of sensual desire,

original: srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: from the taint of existence, and from the taint of ignorance.

original: rnam par grol na rnam par grol lo zhes bya bar ye shes mthong bar 'gyur zhing /🔽bdag gi zag pa zad do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rnam par grol na rnam par grol lo zhes bya bar ye shes mthong bar 'gyur zhing / bdag gi zag pa zad do zhes bya ba nas /

original: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes bya ba'i bar du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes te /
analyzed: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes bya ba'i bar du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes te /
translated: The knowledge that my contaminants are exhausted and the knowledge that I know I will not know another existence are also perfectly known just as they are.

original: 'di ni zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba gzhung mdo mang po las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ni zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba gzhung mdo mang po las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: This is the superknowledge that manifests the knowledge that the contaminants are exhausted.

original: rdzu 'phrul ni ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul ni ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: Miraculous power is concentration.

original: de'i yul ni sprul pa dang 'gro ba ste /🔽rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i yul ni sprul pa dang 'gro ba ste / rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa'o //
translated: Its object is emanation and going.🔽The knowledge of the object of miraculous power.

original: de mngon du bya ba ni mngon sum du 'gyur ba yin pas rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de mngon du bya ba ni mngon sum du 'gyur ba yin pas rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'o //
translated: The manifestation of that is the manifestation of the knowledge of the object of miraculous power.

original: lha'i rna ba de las byung ba'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: lha'i rna ba de las byung ba'i shes pa ste /
translated: The divine ear is the knowledge that arises from that.

original: de mngon du bya ba ni lha'i rna ba shes pa mngon du bya ba'i'o //
analyzed: de mngon du bya ba ni lha'i rna ba shes pa mngon du bya ba'i'o //
translated: The manifestation of that is the manifestation of the knowledge of the divine ear.

original: sems kyi rnam grangs ni khyad par te /
analyzed: sems kyi rnam grangs ni khyad par te /
translated: The different kinds of mind are the distinctions.

original: chags pa dang / sdang ba dang / rmongs pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: chags pa dang / sdang ba dang / rmongs pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: They are called attachment, hostility, and confusion.

analyzed: yang na rnam grangs ni go rims yin te / res 'ga' ni chags so //
translated: Or else, the different kinds are the order.🔽Sometimes there is attachment,

original: res 'ga' ni sdang ngo //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni sdang ngo //
translated: sometimes hostility,

original: rmongs so zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: rmongs so zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: and sometimes confusion.

original: de shes pa ste /
analyzed: de shes pa ste /
translated: That is the knowledge of that,

original: de mngon du bya ba'i'o //
analyzed: de mngon du bya ba'i'o //
translated: the direct realization of that.

original: sngon gyi gnas de rjes su dran pa ste /
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas de rjes su dran pa ste /
translated: The recollection of former abodes is the recollection of former abodes.

original: de shes pa de mngon du bya ba'i'o //
analyzed: de shes pa de mngon du bya ba'i'o //
translated: That is the knowledge of that, the direct realization of that.

original: 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba ni 'chi 'pho dang skye ba dag go //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba ni 'chi 'pho dang skye ba dag go //
translated: Death and birth are death and birth.

original: de dag shes pa ste /
analyzed: de dag shes pa ste /
translated: That is the knowledge of that,

original: de mngon du bya ba'i'o //🔽zag pa rnams zad pa de shes pa ste /
analyzed: de mngon du bya ba'i'o // zag pa rnams zad pa de shes pa ste /
translated: the direct realization of that.🔽The destruction of the contaminants is the knowledge of the destruction of the contaminants.

original: de mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes re re la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes re re la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: That is the knowledge of that, the direct realization of that.

original: de dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dper na dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu 'dus byas rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin yin pa dang 'dra'o //🔽sems la shes pa lnga yin no zhes bya ba la sems la zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rnam grangs mngon par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dper na dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu 'dus byas rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin yin pa dang 'dra'o // sems la shes pa lnga yin no zhes bya ba la sems la zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rnam grangs mngon par shes pa'o //
translated: means that it is like the fruits of the sramana, which are by nature the conditioned path of liberation.🔽The knowledge of the mind of another is five knowledges.

original: de ni shes pa lnga'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de ni shes pa lnga'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The knowledge of the mind of another is five knowledges means that the knowledge of the mind of another is by nature five knowledges.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa zag pa med pa ni chos dang / rjes dang lam dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa nyid srid la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa zag pa med pa ni chos dang / rjes dang lam dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa nyid srid la /
translated: The knowledge of the mind of another that is uncontaminated is possible as the knowledge of the dharmas, subsequent, path and the knowledge of the mind of another.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa ni kun rdzob dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa nyid srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa ni kun rdzob dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa nyid srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The knowledge of the mind of another that is contaminated is possible as conventional knowledge and the knowledge of the mind of another.

original: stobs bzhin no zhes bya ba ni zag pa thad pa'i stobs shes pa ji lta @278b ba bzhin no //
analyzed: stobs bzhin no zhes bya ba ni zag pa thad pa'i stobs shes pa ji lta @278b ba bzhin no //
translated: Like the powers means that it is like the power of the knowledge of the exhaustion of contaminants.

analyzed: gal te zag pa zad pa shes pa zag pa zad pa la dmigs pa yin na ni shes pa drug yin te /
translated: If the knowledge of the elimination of the contaminants focuses on the elimination of the contaminants, it is six knowledges:

original: 'gog pa shes pa ni chos dang rjes dang zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa zhes bya ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: 'gog pa shes pa ni chos dang rjes dang zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa zhes bya ba'i phyir la /
translated: the knowledge of elimination, the knowledge of nonarising, the knowledge of others' minds, the knowledge of suffering, the knowledge of origin and the knowledge of the path, because the knowledge of cessation is called the knowledge of cessation, the knowledge of the path, the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising.

original: kun rdzob shes pa yang 'gog pa la dmigs pa nyid srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa yang 'gog pa la dmigs pa nyid srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Conventional knowledge also focuses on cessation.

original: gal te zag pa zad pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de yin na ni shes pa bcu ste /
analyzed: gal te zag pa zad pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de yin na ni shes pa bcu ste /

analyzed: zag pa zad pa'i rgyud la shes pa bcu char yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the ten knowledges exist in the mindstream of one who has eliminated the contaminants.

original: de bzhin du gal te zag pa zad pa la dmigs par 'gyur ba mngon par shes pa gang yin pa de zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa yin na ni shes pa drug yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te zag pa zad pa la dmigs par 'gyur ba mngon par shes pa gang yin pa de zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa yin na ni shes pa drug yin te /
translated: Similarly, if the knowledge of elimination is the superknowledge that focuses on the elimination of the contaminants, it is six knowledges,

original: de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra'o //
translated: because it is similar to that.

original: gal te zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa gang yin pa de yin na ni shes pa bcu ste /
analyzed: gal te zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa gang yin pa de yin na ni shes pa bcu ste /
translated: If it is the superknowledge of the elimination of the contaminants, it is ten knowledges,

original: de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra'o //
translated: because it is similar to that.

original: 'di ni sa thams cad pa yin par yang shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni stobs bzhin no zhes smos pa 'di kho nas kyang don 'dir 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ni sa thams cad pa yin par yang shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni stobs bzhin no zhes smos pa 'di kho nas kyang don 'dir 'gyur la /
translated: This meaning is also understood from the mere statement, “It is like the powers.”

original: gang gi phyir lnga kho na bsam gtan bzhi dag na'o zhes nges par gzung ba de'i phyir yang mngon par shes pa drug pa 'di ni sa thams cad pa yin no zhes bya bar mngon no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir lnga kho na bsam gtan bzhi dag na'o zhes nges par gzung ba de'i phyir yang mngon par shes pa drug pa 'di ni sa thams cad pa yin no zhes bya bar mngon no //
translated: And because it is ascertained that only five exist in the four absorptions, it is evident that this sixth superknowledge exists on all stages.🔽Three do not exist there,

analyzed: re zhig gsum ni med de zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul dang / lha'i rna ba dang / mig gi mngon par shes pa dag go //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gzugs la dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs la dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams ni gzugs kyi 'du shes bshig pa'i phyir gzugs la mi dmigs so //

analyzed: gzugs la dmigs pa'i lam gyis bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: because it is established by the path that focuses on form.

original: gzugs 'di 'dra bas na sems 'di 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin na /
analyzed: gzugs 'di 'dra bas na sems 'di 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin na /
translated: If form is like this, then mind is like this.

original: gzugs med pa rnams ni gzugs la mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams ni gzugs la mi dmigs so //
translated: But formless states do not focus on form.

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa yang med de /
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa yang med de /
translated: Also recollection of past lives does not exist there.

original: mthar gyis sngon gyi gnas gzhan rjes su dran pas mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: mthar gyis sngon gyi gnas gzhan rjes su dran pas mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is established by recollecting other former abodes in sequence.

original: 'di ltar mthar gyis bdag nyid kyi gnas gzhan dag rjes su dran pas sgrub par byed na /🔽gzugs med dngos gzhi dge rnams kyi //
analyzed: 'di ltar mthar gyis bdag nyid kyi gnas gzhan dag rjes su dran pas sgrub par byed na / gzugs med dngos gzhi dge rnams kyi //
translated: Thus it is established by recollecting other former abodes of oneself in sequence.🔽The formless realm is not the domain of the contaminated

original: spyod yul zag bcas 'og ma min //🔽zhes 'chad par 'gyur bas gzugs med pa rnams kyang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i chos la @279a * //
analyzed: spyod yul zag bcas 'og ma min // zhes 'chad par 'gyur bas gzugs med pa rnams kyang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i chos la @279a * //
translated: lower levels.

original: mi dmigs la /
analyzed: mi dmigs la /
translated: Since it will be explained that the formless realm is not the domain of contaminated lower levels, formless states do not focus on phenomena of the desire realm.

original: bdag nyid kyi gnas gzhan 'dod pa na spyod pa de dag kyang mngon par bsgrub pa'i dus na de'i dmigs pa yin pas de'i phyir de'i sa pa med do //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi gnas gzhan 'dod pa na spyod pa de dag kyang mngon par bsgrub pa'i dus na de'i dmigs pa yin pas de'i phyir de'i sa pa med do //
translated: Also, when one manifests the divine eye, it is the object of that eye.

original: gnas dang rus la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de nas shi 'phos nas kyang che ge mo zhig tu skyes so zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: gnas dang rus la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de nas shi 'phos nas kyang che ge mo zhig tu skyes so zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: Because it focuses on the place, caste, and so on of the being who has died and been reborn elsewhere, it is said that it focuses on the place and so on.

original: 'di ltar mdo las /
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo las /
translated: A sutra states:

original: gang du bdag ming 'di zhes bya /🔽rigs ni 'di lta bu /
analyzed: gang du bdag ming 'di zhes bya / rigs ni 'di lta bu /
translated: I was born there with such a name,🔽such a caste,

original: rus ni 'di lta bu /
analyzed: rus ni 'di lta bu /
translated: such a lineage,

original: kha zas ni 'di lta bu za za /
analyzed: kha zas ni 'di lta bu za za /
translated: I ate such food,

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu zhig nyams su myong /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu zhig nyams su myong /
translated: I experienced such pleasure and pain,

original: tshe ni 'di tsam zhig thub /🔽yun ni 'di srid cig gnas gnas /
analyzed: tshe ni 'di tsam zhig thub / yun ni 'di srid cig gnas gnas /
translated: my lifespan was such,🔽I lived for such a time,

original: tshe'i mtha' na 'di srid cig yin par gyur na /
analyzed: tshe'i mtha' na 'di srid cig yin par gyur na /
translated: the end of my lifespan was such.

original: sems can ni de dag byung ngo //
analyzed: sems can ni de dag byung ngo //
translated: Such sentient beings arose.

original: bdag gnas de nas shi 'phos nas ni che ge mo zhig tu skyes so //
analyzed: bdag gnas de nas shi 'phos nas ni che ge mo zhig tu skyes so //
translated: I died from that place and was reborn there.

original: de nas kyang shi 'phos nas ni 'di skyes so zhes sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rnam pa dang bcas /
analyzed: de nas kyang shi 'phos nas ni 'di skyes so zhes sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rnam pa dang bcas /
translated: And then, having died and transmigrated from there, I was born here.🔽Thus, he recalls his former abodes with their aspects and particulars,

original: yul phyogs dang bcas /🔽gleng gzhi dang bcas par rjes su dran no zhes gsungs na /
analyzed: yul phyogs dang bcas / gleng gzhi dang bcas par rjes su dran no zhes gsungs na /
translated: with their locations and bases.

original: gzugs med pa rnams ni gnas dang rus la sogs pa la dmigs pa dang / sa 'og ma la dmigs pa ma yin pas 'di'i phyir yang gzugs med pa'i sa pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams ni gnas dang rus la sogs pa la dmigs pa dang / sa 'og ma la dmigs pa ma yin pas 'di'i phyir yang gzugs med pa'i sa pa ma yin no //
translated: Since formless states do not focus on location, caste, and so on, and do not focus on lower levels, they are not formless states.

original: ji ltar gzhan gyi sems shes pa gzugs la stegs bcas nas mngon par bsgrub par bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan gyi sems shes pa gzugs la stegs bcas nas mngon par bsgrub par bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is knowledge of others' minds established by taking form as its basis?

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyi sems shes par 'dod pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyi sems shes par 'dod pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, in detail: One who desires to know the minds of others.

original: gtod ces bya ba ni gtod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gtod ces bya ba ni gtod par byed pa'o //
translated: Focuses means causes to focus.

original: mtshan ma bzung nas zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rnam pa yongs su bcad nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mtshan ma bzung nas zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rnam pa yongs su bcad nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Having apprehended the sign means having ascertained the aspect of mind.

original: de'i lugs las bzlog ste zhes bya ba ni sems de'i lugs las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: de'i lugs las bzlog ste zhes bya ba ni sems de'i lugs las bzlog pa ste /
translated: The phrase “in reverse order” means in the reverse order of that mind.

original: 'gags ma thag pa'i gnas skabs gzhan rnams yid la byed do //
analyzed: 'gags ma thag pa'i gnas skabs gzhan rnams yid la byed do //
translated: One recalls the other states that immediately precede it.

original: thod rgal du yang dran no zhes bya ba tshe gcig gam gnyid thod rgal du rgal nas kyang dran no //🔽gnas gtsang ma rnams ji ltar dran zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te sngon nyams su myong ba kho na dran na'o //
analyzed: thod rgal du yang dran no zhes bya ba tshe gcig gam gnyid thod rgal du rgal nas kyang dran no // gnas gtsang ma rnams ji ltar dran zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te sngon nyams su myong ba kho na dran na'o //
translated: One also recalls in a skipping manner means that one recalls in a skipping manner after one or two lifetimes.🔽How does one recall the Pure Abodes?

original: gnas gtsang ma rnams 'dir 'ong ba ni med de phyir mi 'ong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma rnams 'dir 'ong ba ni med de phyir mi 'ong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One does not recall them because one has not experienced them here, because one is a non-returner who does not come here.

original: des na 'dir de dag nyams su myong ba med do //
analyzed: des na 'dir de dag nyams su myong ba med do //
translated: Therefore, one has not experienced them here.

original: der yang ma yin te so so'i skye bo rnams der mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der yang ma yin te so so'i skye bo rnams der mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor does one recall them there, because ordinary beings are not born there.

original: thos pas nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni des gnas gtsang ma pa'i lha rnams ni 'di lta bu yin no zhes thos pas so //
analyzed: thos pas nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni des gnas gtsang ma pa'i lha rnams ni 'di lta bu yin no zhes thos pas so //
translated: One recalls them through learning, because one has learned that the gods of the Pure Abodes are like this.

original: nyam su myong ba rnam @279b gnyis te //
analyzed: nyam su myong ba rnam @279b gnyis te //
translated: There are two kinds of experience:

original: mthong bas nyams su myong ba dang // thos pas nyams su myong ba'o //🔽pha rol po'i rgyud la brten nas bskyed do zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa ni bsam gtan gyis bsdus pa yin pas des gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sems mi 'dzin na ni ji ltar pha rol po'i rgyud la brten nas
analyzed: mthong bas nyams su myong ba dang // thos pas nyams su myong ba'o // pha rol po'i rgyud la brten nas bskyed do zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa ni bsam gtan gyis bsdus pa yin pas des gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sems mi 'dzin na ni ji ltar pha rol po'i rgyud la brten nas
translated: The knowledge of former abodes is of two kinds: that which is experienced through seeing and that which is experienced through hearing.🔽The knowledge of former abodes is generated in dependence on the continuum of another, but if the knowledge of former abodes subsumed by the absorptions does not apprehend the mind operating in the formless realm, how is it generated in dependence on the continuum of another?🔽The knowledge of former abodes is generated in dependence on the continuum of another because it is generated in dependence on the mind of another.🔽The knowledge of former abodes of others is generated in dependence on the mind of another because it is generated in dependence on the mind of another.

original: skyed ce na /🔽pha rol po'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'gags ma thag pa'i mtshan ma bzung nas zhes bya ba rgyas par sbyar ro //
analyzed: skyed ce na / pha rol po'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'gags ma thag pa'i mtshan ma bzung nas zhes bya ba rgyas par sbyar ro //
translated: The knowledge of former abodes of others is generated in dependence on the mind of another because it is generated in dependence on the mind of another.🔽The knowledge of former abodes of others is generated in dependence on the mind of another because it is generated in dependence on the mind of another.🔽The knowledge of former abodes of others is generated in dependence on the mind of another because it is generated in dependence on the mind of another.🔽The knowledge of former abodes of others is generated in dependence on the mind of another because it is generated in dependence on the mind of another.🔽The knowledge of former abodes of others is generated in dependence on the mind of another because it is generated in dependence on the mind of another.🔽The knowledge of former abodes of others is generated in dependence on the mind of another because it is generated in dependence on the mind of another.

original: gzhan dag ces bya ba ni gang dag gzugs med pa nas shi 'phos pa ma yin pa de dag gi sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa ni rang gi rgyud la brten nas skyed de sla ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ces bya ba ni gang dag gzugs med pa nas shi 'phos pa ma yin pa de dag gi sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa ni rang gi rgyud la brten nas skyed de sla ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The knowledge of former abodes of others is generated in dependence on the mind of another because it is generated in dependence on the mind of another.

original: rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul dang / lha'i rna ba dang / lha'i mig gi mngon par shes pa gsum po dag gi ste /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul dang / lha'i rna ba dang / lha'i mig gi mngon par shes pa gsum po dag gi ste /
translated: The three higher perceptions of supernatural power, the divine ear, and the divine eye.

original: go rims bzhin du rdzu 'phrul gyi sbyor ba ni yang ba yid la byed pa yin no //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du rdzu 'phrul gyi sbyor ba ni yang ba yid la byed pa yin no //
translated: The application of supernatural power is the mental attention of lightness.

original: lha'i rna ba'i sbyar ba ni sgra yid la byed pa yin no //
analyzed: lha'i rna ba'i sbyar ba ni sgra yid la byed pa yin no //
translated: The application of the divine ear is the mental attention of sound.

original: lha'i mig gi ni snang ba yid la byed pa yin no //
analyzed: lha'i mig gi ni snang ba yid la byed pa yin no //
translated: The application of the divine eye is the mental attention of light.

original: 'di dag ji ltar 'thob ce na zhes bya ba ni 'thob pa'i dbang du byas nas 'dri ba ste /
analyzed: 'di dag ji ltar 'thob ce na zhes bya ba ni 'thob pa'i dbang du byas nas 'dri ba ste /
translated: How are they obtained? This question is asked from the point of view of acquisition.

original: mngon sum du 'gyur ba ni 'dris pa dang ma 'dris pa gnyi ga yang sbyor ba kho nas yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum du 'gyur ba ni 'dris pa dang ma 'dris pa gnyi ga yang sbyor ba kho nas yin no //
translated: The acquisition of both the familiar and unfamiliar is by means of practice alone.

original: ma 'dris pa rnams ni sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni bye brag can te sngon ma bskyed pa thams cad do //
analyzed: ma 'dris pa rnams ni sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni bye brag can te sngon ma bskyed pa thams cad do //
translated: The unfamiliar are obtained by practice. This is a specific statement, because all that has not been previously generated is unfamiliar.

original: thams cad kyang sbyor bas bskyed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bral bas 'thob ba gang dag yin pa dang / sbyor bas 'thob pa gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad kyang ngo //
analyzed: thams cad kyang sbyor bas bskyed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bral bas 'thob ba gang dag yin pa dang / sbyor bas 'thob pa gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad kyang ngo //
translated: This means that those obtained by freedom from attachment and those obtained by preparation are all generated by preparation.🔽The exception is sound.

original: sgra ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni sgra ni rgyun chad pa'i phyir sprul par mi byed de /
analyzed: sgra ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni sgra ni rgyun chad pa'i phyir sprul par mi byed de /
translated: Sound is not emanated because it is interrupted.

original: 'dod par gtogs pa'i sprul pa ni phyi'i skye mched bzhi zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod par gtogs pa'i sprul pa ni phyi'i skye mched bzhi zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Emanation belonging to the desire realm is the four external bases, as will be explained.

original: 'o na ci zhe na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te mig gi mngon par shes pa'i dmigs pa gzugs kyi skye mched yin na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te mig gi mngon par shes pa'i dmigs pa gzugs kyi skye mched yin na /
translated: If the object field of the eye’s superknowledge is the form base,

original: 'o na ji ltar shi 'phos pa dang skye ba shes pas sems can 'di dag ni lus kyis nyes par spyod pa dang ldan no zhes bya ba de lta bur shes te /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar shi 'phos pa dang skye ba shes pas sems can 'di dag ni lus kyis nyes par spyod pa dang ldan no zhes bya ba de lta bur shes te /
translated: then how does the knowledge of death and rebirth know that these sentient beings possess physical negative action?

original: mig gi rnam par shes pas ni ngag dang yid kyi las dang ldan par mi 'dzin no //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pas ni ngag dang yid kyi las dang ldan par mi 'dzin no //
translated: The eye consciousness does not apprehend verbal and mental karma.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni log par lta ba bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni log par lta ba bsdu'o //
translated: The term “etc.” includes wrong view.

original: de ni des mi shes so zhes bya ba ni ngag dang yid kyi las dang ldan pa la sogs pa de ni mig gi rnam par shes pa des mi shes so //
analyzed: de ni des mi shes so zhes bya ba ni ngag dang yid kyi las dang ldan pa la sogs pa de ni mig gi rnam par shes pa des mi shes so //
translated: That is not known by that means of knowledge, i.e., that which is associated with verbal and mental action is not known by that eye consciousness.

original: 'o na gang gis shes she na /🔽de las @280a * //
analyzed: 'o na gang gis shes she na / de las @280a * //
translated: By what is it known?

original: gzhan pa mngon par shes pa'i 'khor du gyur pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzhan pa mngon par shes pa'i 'khor du gyur pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is known by another means of knowledge that is a higher knowledge.🔽The term “higher knowledge” is stated because it is a higher knowledge that is a higher knowledge.

original: de ni yid kyi yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni yid kyi yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is mental means it is the nature of mind.

original: lhag ma zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi gnas dang zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa dag ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi char gyi rang bzhin dag yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi gnas dang zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa dag ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi char gyi rang bzhin dag yin no //
translated: The remaining two means of knowledge are the higher knowledge of former lives and the higher knowledge of the extinction of contaminants.

original: ji ltar zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi'i rang bzhin yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi'i rang bzhin yin zhe na /
translated: How is the higher knowledge of the extinction of contaminants the nature of the four establishments of mindfulness?

original: shes pa bcu'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa bcu'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the nature of ten knowledges.

original: shes pa drug gi ngo bo nyid yin na yang lus dang tshor ba dang sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ma 'ongs pa dag 'thob bo //🔽'o na ji ltar de dag bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa par 'grub ces bya ba ni mig gi shes pa dang / rna ba'i shes pa dang bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i sa pa ni med de /
analyzed: shes pa drug gi ngo bo nyid yin na yang lus dang tshor ba dang sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ma 'ongs pa dag 'thob bo // 'o na ji ltar de dag bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa par 'grub ces bya ba ni mig gi shes pa dang / rna ba'i shes pa dang bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i sa pa ni med de /
translated: Even though they are the nature of the six consciousnesses, one obtains future mindfulness of body, feeling, and mind.🔽How are they established as the level of the fourth absorption?

original: mig dang rna ba'i shes pa dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba'i shes pa dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The eye consciousness and ear consciousness do not exist on the second absorption and so on because they are not concomitant with eye and ear consciousness.

original: de dag kyang gnyis pa la sogs pa na med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag kyang gnyis pa la sogs pa na med pa'i phyir te /
translated: They also do not exist on the second absorption and so on because:

original: gnyis pa sogs na lus mig dang // rna ba'i rnam shes rnam rig slong //
analyzed: gnyis pa sogs na lus mig dang // rna ba'i rnam shes rnam rig slong //
translated: The body, eye, and ear consciousnesses and the eye and ear faculties

original: gang yin de ni dang por gtogs //
analyzed: gang yin de ni dang por gtogs //
translated: that exist on the second absorption and so on belong to the first absorption.

original: zhes khyad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes khyad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the distinction.🔽The Autocommentary states:

original: rten gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni rten mig dang rna ba'i dbang gis de dag gi shes pa dag kyang bsam gtan bzhi ba'i sa pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: rten gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni rten mig dang rna ba'i dbang gis de dag gi shes pa dag kyang bsam gtan bzhi ba'i sa pa nyid yin te /
translated: The eye and ear consciousnesses are established as belonging to the level of the fourth absorption because they are supported by the eye and ear faculties of the fourth absorption.

original: mig dang rna ba dag ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba dag ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The eye and ear are established as belonging to the level of the fourth meditation.🔽This is the teaching of the principal or the most numerous.

original: de ni gtso bo'am phal che ba bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gtso bor gyur pas na gtso bo ste /
analyzed: de ni gtso bo'am phal che ba bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gtso bor gyur pas na gtso bo ste /
translated: The principal is that which is principal.

original: phal che ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: phal che ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The most numerous is similar to that.

original: mngon par shes pa dge ba ni gtso bor gyur pas de'i phyir de la ltos nas mngon par shes pa bcu ni shes rab dge ba'i zhes bstan par mdzad do //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa dge ba ni gtso bor gyur pas de'i phyir de la ltos nas mngon par shes pa bcu ni shes rab dge ba'i zhes bstan par mdzad do //
translated: The superknowledges are virtuous because they are principal. Therefore, in consideration of that, it is said that the ten superknowledges are virtuous wisdom.

original: yang na mngon par shes pa phal cher dge ba yin pas de'i phyir de skad du bstan te /
analyzed: yang na mngon par shes pa phal cher dge ba yin pas de'i phyir de skad du bstan te /
translated: Or, it is said that way because the superknowledges are mostly virtuous.

analyzed: mon sren sde'u la sogs pa yod bzhin du yang mon sran gre'u'i phung po zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa bzhin no //

analyzed: de kho na bzhin du rnam pa gnyis yin zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: It is just like that, for it is related to one’s own body and to the bodies of others.

translated: It is similar in the realm of form, for one born in the realm of desire emanates two types of emanations: those that belong to the realm of desire and those that belong to the realm of form.

translated: And each of those is related to one’s own body and to the bodies of others, so there are four types.

translated: They are not possessed in the manner of clothing and ornaments, for example, clothing and ornaments are related to one’s own body, but they are not counted as sentient beings.

analyzed: dri dang ro'i skye mched ni ma yin te /
translated: The smell and taste bases are not,

analyzed: gzhan dag na re bsnun pa las 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes zer te /

analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i 'bras bu ni gsum ste zhes bya ba ni sa 'og ma pa de gnyis dang rang gi sa pa'o //

analyzed: sa 'og ma pa gsum dang rang gi sa pa'o //

analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa kho nar 'gro bas /

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi 'bras bu la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'i sems la gnas pa'o //🔽sa gong ma pa zhes bya @282a * //
translated: Immediately after the emanating mind, the emanating mind is produced.🔽Immediately after the emanating mind, the pure

original: ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i sa pa ste /
analyzed: ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i sa pa ste /
translated: The mind of the second absorption and so on is the basis of the emanation of speech.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pas smrar 'jug go //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pas smrar 'jug go //
translated: Speech is emanated by the mind of the first absorption.

original: yan chad bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa na ni rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar byed pa rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sems med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan chad bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa na ni rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar byed pa rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sems med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Speech is not emanated by the mind of the second absorption and so on because the minds of those levels that motivate indicative form are not associated with investigation and analysis.

original: 'di ltar brtags shing dpyad nas tshig tu smra'o zhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar brtags shing dpyad nas tshig tu smra'o zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: It is said, “Speech is emanated by investigating and analyzing.”🔽If emanation does not exist because the mind of emanation does not exist, then how can emanation speak?🔽This is because if there is no reason, then that which arises from the reason does not exist.

original: sprul pa'i sems med pa'i phyir sprul pa med na zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshan med na rgyu mtshan las byung ba yang med pas yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sems med pa'i phyir sprul pa med na zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshan med na rgyu mtshan las byung ba yang med pas yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If the mind of emanation does not exist, then emanation does not exist.

original: ji ltar sprul pa 'di smrar 'jug snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sprul pa 'di smrar 'jug snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: If emanation does not exist, then how can emanation speak?

original: byin gyis brlabs nas gzhan 'jug phyir //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs nas gzhan 'jug phyir //
translated: Because it engages others through blessing.

original: zhes bya ba ni sprul pa po gnas par 'dod pas sprul pa'i sems kyis sprul pa sprul nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sprul pa po gnas par 'dod pas sprul pa'i sems kyis sprul pa sprul nas /
translated: The emanator who wishes to remain emanates emanations through the mind of emanation.

original: de yang 'di gnas par gyur cig ces byin gyis brlabs nas de'i 'og tu gzhan rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar byed pa rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyis smrar 'jug go //
analyzed: de yang 'di gnas par gyur cig ces byin gyis brlabs nas de'i 'og tu gzhan rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar byed pa rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyis smrar 'jug go //
translated: Having blessed it with the thought, “May this remain,” he then causes it to speak with a mind that is accompanied by investigation and examination, which is the motivating factor of the manifest action.

original: sngon gyi bsam pa'i rgyun rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: sngon gyi bsam pa'i rgyun rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because the continuum of the prior intention is followed.

original: des sngar sprul pa sprul par bya'o //
analyzed: des sngar sprul pa sprul par bya'o //
translated: He previously emanated the emanation,

original: des byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: des byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: he blessed it,

original: de smar gzhug go snyam du sems la rnam par gzhag pas so //
analyzed: de smar gzhug go snyam du sems la rnam par gzhag pas so //
translated: and he caused it to speak.

original: gnas skabs gnyis la byin gyi rlabs srid pa'i phyir ci gson po kho na la byin gyi rlabs yod dam zhes 'dri'o//
analyzed: gnas skabs gnyis la byin gyi rlabs srid pa'i phyir ci gson po kho na la byin gyi rlabs yod dam zhes 'dri'o//
translated: Since it is possible to bless it in two circumstances, the question is asked, “Is there blessing only in the living?”

original: 'phags pa 'od srungs chen po'i byin gyi rlabs kyis zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa 'od srungs chen po'i mos pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'od srungs chen po'i byin gyi rlabs kyis zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa 'od srungs chen po'i mos pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “through the blessing of the noble Mahākāśyapa” means “through the noble Mahākāśyapa’s intention.”

original: skye ba las skyes rnam gsum mo //
analyzed: skye ba las skyes rnam gsum mo //
translated: Three are born from birth.

original: zhes bya ba ni lha la sogs pa res 'ga' ni gzhan dag la phan gdags pa'i phyir sprul par byed la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lha la sogs pa res 'ga' ni gzhan dag la phan gdags pa'i phyir sprul par byed la /
translated: Sometimes gods and so on emanate for the purpose of benefiting others,

original: res 'ga' ni rnam par 'tshe ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni rnam par 'tshe ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: and sometimes for the purpose of harming others.

original: de dag gis byas pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni lha la sogs pas byas pa'i sprul pa'i bdag dang gzhan dang 'brel pa ni skye mched dgu pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis byas pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni lha la sogs pas byas pa'i sprul pa'i bdag dang gzhan dang 'brel pa ni skye mched dgu pa yin no //
translated: The nine bases are those created by gods and so on, which are related to self and other.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sgra med pa'i gzugs can gyi skye mched yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sgra med pa'i gzugs can gyi skye mched yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are form bases devoid of sound.

original: 'di ltar de la sgra med pa'i mig la sogs pa'i skye mched dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched yod pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar de la sgra med pa'i mig la sogs pa'i skye mched dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched yod pas so //
translated: Thus, the eye and so on are form bases devoid of sound, and form and so on exist there.

original: sgra ni rgyun med pa'i phyir sprul par mi byed do //
analyzed: sgra ni rgyun med pa'i phyir sprul par mi byed do //
translated: Sound is not emanated because it is not continuous.

original: sems med pa yin pa'i phyir yid dang chos kyi skye mched dag kyang sprul par mi byed do //
analyzed: sems med pa yin pa'i phyir yid dang chos kyi skye mched dag kyang sprul par mi byed do //
translated: The mental faculty and mental object bases are not emanated because they are nonphysical.

original: sprul pa sems med do zhes bya ba ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: sprul pa sems med do zhes bya ba ci mngon zhe na /
translated: Why is it known that emanations are devoid of mind?

original: bstan bcos @282b las te /🔽'di skad du sprul pa de 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa zhes brjod par bya'am /
analyzed: bstan bcos @282b las te / 'di skad du sprul pa de 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa zhes brjod par bya'am /
translated: The treatise Attainment of Knowledge states:🔽Is it said that emanations arise from the four great elements?

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa ma yin pa zhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa ma yin pa zhes brjod par bya /
translated: Or is it said that they do not arise from the four great elements?

original: smras pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa'o zhes brjod par bya'o //🔽rgyur byas pa'i gzugs can nam /
analyzed: smras pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa'o zhes brjod par bya'o // rgyur byas pa'i gzugs can nam /
translated: It is said that they arise from the four great elements.🔽Are they derivative form?

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs can ma yin pa zhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs can ma yin pa zhes brjod par bya /
translated: Or are they not derivative form?

original: smras pa rgyur byas pa'i 'bras bu gzugs can no zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: smras pa rgyur byas pa'i 'bras bu gzugs can no zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: It is said that they are derivative form,

original: sems med pa zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sems med pa zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: but it is also said that they are not mind.

original: gang gi sems kyi dbang gis 'jug ces brjod par bya /
analyzed: gang gi sems kyi dbang gis 'jug ces brjod par bya /
translated: By whose mind do they engage?

original: smras pa / sprul pa po'i sems kyi dbang gis 'jug go zhes brjod par bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: smras pa / sprul pa po'i sems kyi dbang gis 'jug go zhes brjod par bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is said that they engage by the power of the mind of the emanator.

original: gal te skye mched dgu pa sprul par byed na dbang po sprul pa'i phyir ji ltar sngon med pa'i sems can 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te skye mched dgu pa sprul par byed na dbang po sprul pa'i phyir ji ltar sngon med pa'i sems can 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If one emanates a nine sense sphere being, then since one emanates a sense faculty, how does it not become a sentient being that did not exist previously?

original: dbang po rnams ni sems can du ston pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni sems can du ston pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Because the sense faculties are indicative of sentient beings.

original: de'i phyir dbang po dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, because it is not different from the sense faculties.

original: 'di gang gi phyir mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga rang dang gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel pa'i sprul pa gzugs dang dri dang / ro dang reg bya'i ngo bo nyid dang tha mi dad par gnas pa de'i phyir skye mched dgu pa zhes bya ba'i dbang po ni sprul par mi byed de /
analyzed: 'di gang gi phyir mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga rang dang gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel pa'i sprul pa gzugs dang dri dang / ro dang reg bya'i ngo bo nyid dang tha mi dad par gnas pa de'i phyir skye mched dgu pa zhes bya ba'i dbang po ni sprul par mi byed de /
translated: Because emanations related to one’s own or another’s body exist undifferentiated from the five sense faculties such as the eyes, which have the nature of form, smell, taste and tactility, therefore the sense faculty called a nine sense sphere being is not emanated.

original: 'di ni grub pa'i mtha' yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni grub pa'i mtha' yin no //
translated: This is the philosophical principle.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi lus dang ma 'brel pa sprul par byed pa gang yin pa de ni skye mched bzhi pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi lus dang ma 'brel pa sprul par byed pa gang yin pa de ni skye mched bzhi pa kho na yin no //
translated: Emanation that is not related to one’s own or another’s body is only a four sense sphere being.

original: dper na nga las gzhon nu dang / srid pa bar ma rnams kyi lta bu'o zhes bya ba 'di gnyis ni las las skyes pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi dper brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na nga las gzhon nu dang / srid pa bar ma rnams kyi lta bu'o zhes bya ba 'di gnyis ni las las skyes pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi dper brjod pa yin no //
translated: These two are examples of supernatural power that arises from karma.🔽Are they only divine?

original: de dag ci lha'i kho na yin nam zhes bya ba ni lha'i zhes bya ba sgra 'di dngos shig yin nam /
analyzed: de dag ci lha'i kho na yin nam zhes bya ba ni lha'i zhes bya ba sgra 'di dngos shig yin nam /
translated: The term “divine” is a real word.

original: 'on te nye bar btags pa zhig yin snyam du sems pa ste /
analyzed: 'on te nye bar btags pa zhig yin snyam du sems pa ste /
translated: Or is it a metaphorical expression?

original: gal te de dag lha la yod pas na lha'i'o zhes bya ba'i don du gzung na ni sgra 'di dngos yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de dag lha la yod pas na lha'i'o zhes bya ba'i don du gzung na ni sgra 'di dngos yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one takes the meaning to be “divine” because it exists for the gods, then this term is real.

original: 'on te lha'i dang 'dra bas lha'i'o zhes bya ba ni nye bar btags pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te lha'i dang 'dra bas lha'i'o zhes bya ba ni nye bar btags pa yin no //
translated: But if it is “divine” because it is similar to that of the gods, then it is metaphorical.🔽For example, like those of a bodhisattva, a wheel-turning king, and a householder-jewel.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang / 'khor los sgyur ba dang / khyim bdag rin po che rnams kyi lta bu zhes bya ba ni nye bar btags pa nyid kyi dpe yin par ston to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang / 'khor los sgyur ba dang / khyim bdag rin po che rnams kyi lta bu zhes bya ba ni nye bar btags pa nyid kyi dpe yin par ston to //
translated: This shows that it is a metaphorical example.

original: rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzugs nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas bsgrub pa'i phyir rtag tu rnam par shes pa dang bcas pas brten pas mtshungs pa kho na yin no //🔽zhar ba dang nongs pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la zhar ba @283a * //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzugs nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas bsgrub pa'i phyir rtag tu rnam par shes pa dang bcas pas brten pas mtshungs pa kho na yin no // zhar ba dang nongs pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la zhar ba @283a * //
translated: Because it is associated with consciousness, it is always supported by consciousness, and thus it is similar to the sense faculty in that it is always associated with consciousness.🔽Because it is not defective or impaired.

original: ni gtan ma tshang ba'o //
analyzed: ni gtan ma tshang ba'o //
translated: Defective means incomplete.

original: nongs pa ni yo ba'o //
analyzed: nongs pa ni yo ba'o //
translated: Impaired means damaged.

original: thams cad mi mthong ba zhes bya ba ni don gyis ni 'di skad du lha'i mig gis ni rgyab logs su yang mthong la mdun du yang mthong gi / lha'i mig ma yin pas ni de lta ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mi mthong ba zhes bya ba ni don gyis ni 'di skad du lha'i mig gis ni rgyab logs su yang mthong la mdun du yang mthong gi / lha'i mig ma yin pas ni de lta ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Because it does not see all objects means that by implication it is explained that the divine eye sees behind and in front, but the non-divine eye does not see in that way.

original: lha'i rna ba la sogs pa bzhi yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni lha'i mig dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa bsdus te /
analyzed: lha'i rna ba la sogs pa bzhi yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni lha'i mig dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa bsdus te /
translated: The four beginning with the divine ear are also like that. The word “also” includes the divine eye, recollection of past lives, and knowledge of others’ minds.

original: lha'i rna ba la sogs pa bzhi po 'di yang skye bas 'thob pa yod do //
analyzed: lha'i rna ba la sogs pa bzhi po 'di yang skye bas 'thob pa yod do //
translated: The four superknowledges of divine ear, mind, and body, and of the destruction of fluxes are also obtained through birth.

original: gang dag gis lha'i mig skye bas 'thob pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag gis lha'i mig skye bas 'thob pa yin zhe na /
translated: What beings are capable of obtaining the divine eye through birth?

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams dang / klu rnams dang / gzugs na spyod pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams dang / klu rnams dang / gzugs na spyod pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The gods of the realm of desire, the nagas, and the gods of the realm of fine-materiality.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
translated: The beings of the realm of immateriality are not capable of it,

original: de na gzugs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na gzugs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no material form in this realm.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyis 'gro ba dang / sprul pa yang med do //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyis 'gro ba dang / sprul pa yang med do //
translated: There is no displacement by means of supernormal creations, nor any supernormal creations.

original: lha'i rna ba dang mig kyang 'thob ba med do //
analyzed: lha'i rna ba dang mig kyang 'thob ba med do //
translated: There is no divine ear or divine eye.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud du yongs su dpyod pa med pa'i phyir gzhan gyi sems shes pa yang med do //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud du yongs su dpyod pa med pa'i phyir gzhan gyi sems shes pa yang med do //
translated: There is no cognition of another's thoughts, because there is no investigation of the stream of another.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i sems can lta bur sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa yang med de /🔽de lta bu'i lus yang dag par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i sems can lta bur sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa yang med de /🔽de lta bu'i lus yang dag par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no recollection of former abodes, because there is no memory of a body similar to that of the realm of desire or the realm of fine-materiality.

original: yang na 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i sems can lta bur mngon par shes pa thams cad kyang med de /
analyzed: yang na 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i sems can lta bur mngon par shes pa thams cad kyang med de /
translated: Or, like sentient beings in the desire realm and form realm, they do not have any superknowledges.

original: de lta bu'i lus yang dag par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i lus yang dag par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because such a body is not actually accomplished.

original: ji ltar bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu dge ba kho na yin pa lta bu ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bzlog pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu dge ba kho na yin pa lta bu ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bzlog pa'i dpe'o //
translated: This is a counterexample to the assertion that the result of meditation is only virtuous.🔽Those abiding in other reincarnating beings always know it.

original: 'gro ba gzhan na gnas pas ni rtag tu shes so zhes bya ba ni lha la sogs pa'i 'gro ba na gnas pas ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa de dag gis de rtag tu shes te /
analyzed: 'gro ba gzhan na gnas pas ni rtag tu shes so zhes bya ba ni lha la sogs pa'i 'gro ba na gnas pas ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa de dag gis de rtag tu shes te /
translated: Those abiding in the reincarnating beings of gods and so on always know the minds of others and the prior lives of others through the superknowledges of knowing the minds of others and recalling past lives.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas mnyen pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas mnyen pa'i phyir /
translated: Because humans are pliable due to the feeling of pain.

original: mi la skye bas thob pa med /
analyzed: mi la skye bas thob pa med /
translated: Humans do not obtain birth.

original: ces bya ba ni mi rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa de ni 'dod chags dang bral ba thob pa dang / rtog ge dang / rig pa dang / sman gyi las kyis byas pa ni yod kyi //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni mi rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa de ni 'dod chags dang bral ba thob pa dang / rtog ge dang / rig pa dang / sman gyi las kyis byas pa ni yod kyi //
translated: This means that the supernormal powers, etc. of humans, as they have been explained, are produced by the attainment of freedom from passion, by logic, by knowledge, and by the practice of medicine.

original: skyes nas thob pa ni med do //
analyzed: skyes nas thob pa ni med do //
translated: But they are not innate.🔽But what about those who naturally remember their past lives?

original: 'o na rang bzhin gyis tshe rabs dran pa gang yin pa ji lta bu zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs dran pa nyid ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'o na rang bzhin gyis tshe rabs dran pa gang yin pa ji lta bu zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs dran pa nyid ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran par 'gyur la /
translated: The ability to remember past lives is the recollection of past abodes.🔽But that is innate.

original: de yang skyes nas 'byung bas ji ltar ro //
analyzed: de yang skyes nas 'byung bas ji ltar ro //
translated: So how is it?

original: 'di skyes nas thob pa ma yin snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skyes nas thob pa ma yin snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The meaning is that it is not innate.🔽They are produced by the power of karma.

original: @283b de dag gis ni las kyi khyad par las skyes pa yin zhes smos pa ni byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi ni las kyi khyad par gyis 'grub pa yin no //
analyzed: @283b de dag gis ni las kyi khyad par las skyes pa yin zhes smos pa ni byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi ni las kyi khyad par gyis 'grub pa yin no //
translated: This means that the supernormal powers of those bodhisattvas are produced by the power of karma.

original: skyes nas thob pa zhes bya ba ni gang thams cad kyi skyes pa'i dus nyid na rang bzhin gyis 'thob pa yin gyi dper na bya rnams nam mkha' la 'gro ba lta bu skyes pa'i dus kyi 'og tu yang gang yang rung ba'i ni ma yin pa nyid
analyzed: skyes nas thob pa zhes bya ba ni gang thams cad kyi skyes pa'i dus nyid na rang bzhin gyis 'thob pa yin gyi dper na bya rnams nam mkha' la 'gro ba lta bu skyes pa'i dus kyi 'og tu yang gang yang rung ba'i ni ma yin pa nyid
translated: It is not that of any other time after birth.

original: do // de lta bas na de dag gi de ni las kyi khyad par las skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: do // de lta bas na de dag gi de ni las kyi khyad par las skyes pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, that of those gods is generated from the special karma of those gods.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: It is said that it is of three types:

original: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu ni ji skad du bshad pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu ni ji skad du bshad pa lta bu yin no //
translated: The result of meditation is as explained.

original: skye bas thob pa ni lha la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: skye bas thob pa ni lha la sogs pa yin no //
translated: That obtained from birth is that of gods and so on.

original: las las skyes pa ni dper na byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi lta bu yin no //
analyzed: las las skyes pa ni dper na byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi lta bu yin no //
translated: That generated from karma is, for example, that of bodhisattvas.

original: chos mngon pa'i 'grel bshad slob dpon rgyal po'i sras grags pa'i bshes gnyen gyis mdzad pa don gsal ba zhes bya ba las ye shes bstan pa zhes bya ba ste mdzod kyi gnas bdun pa'o /🔽// / bdun pa'i 'og tu mdzod kyi gnas brgyad pa nye bar dgod pa'i 'grel pa bstan pa'i phyir /🔽shes pa'i skabs kyis zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /🔽shes pa'i skabs shes pa bcu'i skabs kyis shes pa'i rang bzhin shes pa'i ngo bo nyid smon nas shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa'i shes pa la sogs pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: chos mngon pa'i 'grel bshad slob dpon rgyal po'i sras grags pa'i bshes gnyen gyis mdzad pa don gsal ba zhes bya ba las ye shes bstan pa zhes bya ba ste mdzod kyi gnas bdun pa'o / // / bdun pa'i 'og tu mdzod kyi gnas brgyad pa nye bar dgod pa'i 'grel pa bstan pa'i phyir / shes pa'i skabs kyis zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te / shes pa'i skabs shes pa bcu'i skabs kyis shes pa'i rang bzhin shes pa'i ngo bo nyid smon nas shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa'i shes pa la sogs pa bshad zin to //

original: rang bzhin gzhan ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //🔽yon tan thams cad kyi rten yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa dag kyang yon tan gyi rten yin par ni 'dod mod kyi /
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //🔽yon tan thams cad kyi rten yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa dag kyang yon tan gyi rten yin par ni 'dod mod kyi /
translated: This completes the seventh section of the treatise, Elucidating the Abhidharma, called “The Explanation of Wisdom.”

original: yon tan thams cad kyi rten ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yon tan thams cad kyi rten ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the basis of all virtues.

original: bsam gtan rnams ni yon tan rnams kyi rten yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams ni yon tan rnams kyi rten yin no //
translated: The meditative absorptions are the basis of all virtues.

original: bsam gtan rnams ni rnam pa gnyis so zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i bsam gtan dang 'bras bu'i bsam gtan rnams so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams ni rnam pa gnyis so zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i bsam gtan dang 'bras bu'i bsam gtan rnams so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meditative absorptions are twofold: causal meditative absorptions and resultant meditative absorptions.

original: dge ba rtse gcig pa zhes bya ba ni sems dge ba rnams kyi rtse gcig pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba rtse gcig pa zhes bya ba ni sems dge ba rnams kyi rtse gcig pa'o //
translated: One-pointedness of virtuous mind means the one-pointedness of virtuous minds.

original: bye brag med par zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan thams cad kyi mtshan nyid kyang 'di yin no //
analyzed: bye brag med par zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan thams cad kyi mtshan nyid kyang 'di yin no //
translated: Without distinction means that this is the characteristic of all meditative absorptions.

original: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “because they are the nature of meditative absorption.”

original: bsam gtan rnams ni zhes bya ba tshig lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams ni zhes bya ba tshig lhag ma yin no //
translated: The meditative absorptions are the remainder of the sentence.

original: yang na bye brag med par zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin tsam smos pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na bye brag med par zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin tsam smos pa yin no //
translated: Alternatively, without distinction means that it is said to be merely meditative absorption.

original: dbye na ni /🔽rjes 'brang bcas na @284a * //
analyzed: dbye na ni / rjes 'brang bcas na @284a * //
translated: If it is classified,

original: phung po lnga //🔽zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: phung po lnga //🔽zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: it is five aggregates when accompanied by its following.🔽The meditative absorptions are the remainder of the sentence.

original: 'dir gzugs kyi phung po ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: 'dir gzugs kyi phung po ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs so //
translated: Here, the form aggregate is non-informative form.

original: dmigs pa gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni sems rnams kyi dmigs pa gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: dmigs pa gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni sems rnams kyi dmigs pa gcig pa nyid do //
translated: They have the same cognitive object means that the minds have the same cognitive object.

original: yang sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad kyang dmigs pa gcig pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: yang sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad kyang dmigs pa gcig pa nyid yin na /
translated: But all minds and mental factors have the same cognitive object.

original: ci'i phyir sems rnams kyi dmigs pa gcig pa nyid ces bya'i /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sems rnams kyi dmigs pa gcig pa nyid ces bya'i /
translated: Why is it said that the minds have the same cognitive object?🔽Why is it not said that the minds and mental factors have the same cognitive object?

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi zhes ni mi bya zhe na gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi zhes ni mi bya zhe na gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the minds are primary.

original: sems dmigs pa gcig pa dag kho na ting nge 'dzin yin zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs kyi khyad par yin pa'i phyir sems kyi yon tan dang ngo bo bzhin no //
analyzed: sems dmigs pa gcig pa dag kho na ting nge 'dzin yin zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs kyi khyad par yin pa'i phyir sems kyi yon tan dang ngo bo bzhin no //
translated: Only minds that have the same cognitive object are concentration, because it is a special state, like the nature and qualities of the mind.

original: bye brag tu smra ba na re /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba na re /
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say:

original: sems rnams kho na ting nge 'dzin ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sems rnams kho na ting nge 'dzin ma yin gyi /
translated: The minds themselves are not concentration.

original: gang gis de dag rtse gcig cing mnyam par gzhag par byed pa'i chos de ting nge 'dzin yin te /
analyzed: gang gis de dag rtse gcig cing mnyam par gzhag par byed pa'i chos de ting nge 'dzin yin te /
translated: The factor that causes those minds to be one-pointed and to be in equipoise is concentration.

original: dper na bye brag pa'i lugs kyis dkar po'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ras yug dkar po yin la /
analyzed: dper na bye brag pa'i lugs kyis dkar po'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ras yug dkar po yin la /
translated: For example, in the Vaibhāṣika system, a white cloth is white because it possesses the quality of whiteness.

original: yon tan de nyid 'di la yod pas ni dkar po can zhes bya ba de dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yon tan de nyid 'di la yod pas ni dkar po can zhes bya ba de dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
translated: And because that very quality exists in it, it is called “having whiteness.”

original: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir sems thams cad rtse gcig pa ni ma yin nam /
analyzed: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir sems thams cad rtse gcig pa ni ma yin nam /
translated: But since all minds are one-pointed because they are momentary,🔽why is it said that “the dharma by which they are one-pointed is samādhi?”

original: ci na 'di skad du gang gis de dag rtse gcig par byed pa'i chos de ting nge 'dzin yin zhes brjod gal te gnyis pa de las rnam par mi g-yeng ba yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ci na 'di skad du gang gis de dag rtse gcig par byed pa'i chos de ting nge 'dzin yin zhes brjod gal te gnyis pa de las rnam par mi g-yeng ba yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If you say that it is non-distraction from that second dharma,

original: gal te 'di snyam du sems gnyis pa ting nge 'dzin de'i sgo nas dmigs pa de las rnam par mi g-yeng ba yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du sems gnyis pa ting nge 'dzin de'i sgo nas dmigs pa de las rnam par mi g-yeng ba yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: if you think that the second mind is non-distraction from that object through the door of samādhi,

original: mtshungs par ldan pa la ting nge 'dzin don med pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa la ting nge 'dzin don med pa yin no //
translated: then samādhi is meaningless with regard to its concomitant .

original: sems dang po ting nge 'dzin dang mtshungs par ldan pa gang yin pa'i mtshungs par ldan pa de las ting nge 'dzin don med pa yin te /
analyzed: sems dang po ting nge 'dzin dang mtshungs par ldan pa gang yin pa'i mtshungs par ldan pa de las ting nge 'dzin don med pa yin te /
translated: The concentration concomitant with the first moment of mind is not the concentration concomitant with the second moment of mind.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyis de la bya ba ni mi byed kyi /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyis de la bya ba ni mi byed kyi /
translated: Concentration does not function in the first moment of mind,

original: gnyis pa la bya ba byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽gzhan yang rgyu gang kho na las ting nge 'dzin rtse gcig pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid du 'dod pa'i rgyu de kho na las sems rnams kyi dmigs pa gcig pa nyid du yang ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
analyzed: gnyis pa la bya ba byed pa'i phyir ro // gzhan yang rgyu gang kho na las ting nge 'dzin rtse gcig pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid du 'dod pa'i rgyu de kho na las sems rnams kyi dmigs pa gcig pa nyid du yang ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
translated: but it does function in the second moment of mind.🔽Moreover, why don’t you assert that the very cause from which the characteristic of one-pointed concentration is accepted is the very cause from which the focal object of the mind is accepted?

original: ting nge 'dzin don gzhan du gyur pas ci zhig bya snyam du bsams pa yin no //🔽ma yin te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin don gzhan du gyur pas ci zhig bya snyam du bsams pa yin no // ma yin te /
translated: What need is there for a separate concentration?🔽No, because concentration is weak.

original: ting nge 'dzin stobs chung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin sa mang po pa yod pa'i phyir sems thams cad rtse gcig pa nyid du ni thal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin stobs chung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin sa mang po pa yod pa'i phyir sems thams cad rtse gcig pa nyid du ni thal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Since concentration is a universal mental state, it is not the case that all minds are one-pointed, because concentration is weak.

original: @284b sems gang zhig ting nge 'dzin stobs chung ba de dang mtshungs par ldan pa de ni rtse gcig pa ma yin la sems gang zhig stobs can dang mtshungs par ldan pa de ni rtse gcig pa yin pas ting nge 'dzin sa mang po pa nyid yin yang🔽sems thams cad rtse gcig pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @284b sems gang zhig ting nge 'dzin stobs chung ba de dang mtshungs par ldan pa de ni rtse gcig pa ma yin la sems gang zhig stobs can dang mtshungs par ldan pa de ni rtse gcig pa yin pas ting nge 'dzin sa mang po pa nyid yin yang sems thams cad rtse gcig pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Any mind concomitant with weak concentration is not singlepointed, but any mind concomitant with strong concentration is singlepointed.🔽Therefore, even though concentration is a universal mental state, it does not follow that all minds are singlepointed.

original: sems rtse gcig pa dag kho na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni sems rtse gcig pa dag kho na ting nge 'dzin yin gyi //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa dag kho na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni sems rtse gcig pa dag kho na ting nge 'dzin yin gyi //
translated: Only those minds that are singlepointed are concentration.

original: don gzhan du gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don gzhan du gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Concentration is not a separate object.🔽Thus a sutra states:

original: 'di ltar mdo las lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo las lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the higher training of mind?🔽It is the four meditative states.

original: bsam gtan bzhi'o zhes bya ba thams cad dang / de bzhin du sems yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo ni bsam gtan bzhi kho na yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi'o zhes bya ba thams cad dang / de bzhin du sems yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo ni bsam gtan bzhi kho na yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: And it explains that the four meditative states are the principal means of purifying the mind.

original: mdo 'di ni /
analyzed: mdo 'di ni /
translated: This sutra states:

original: rdzu 'phrul rkang pa ting nge 'dzin //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul rkang pa ting nge 'dzin //
translated: The bases of psychic power are concentrations.

original: ces bya ba der bris so /
analyzed: ces bya ba der bris so /
translated: This is written in the Abhidharma.

original: ji ltar lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa tshul khrims kho na yin gyi de las gzhan pa ma yin la /
