analyzed: ji ltar lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa tshul khrims kho na yin gyi de las gzhan pa ma yin la /
translated: Just as the training in superior morality is morality alone and nothing other than that,

original: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa yang shes rab kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa yang shes rab kho na yin gyi /
translated: and the training in superior wisdom is wisdom alone and nothing other than that,🔽so too the training in superior mind is mind alone and nothing other than that.

original: de las gzhan pa ma yin pa de bzhin du lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa yang sems kho na yin gyi de las gzhan pa ni ma yin pas sems las ma gtogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ma yin pa de bzhin du lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa yang sems kho na yin gyi de las gzhan pa ni ma yin pas sems las ma gtogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The meaning of this is that there is no concentration that is not mind.

original: lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa ni ting nge 'dzin min par 'dod do //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa ni ting nge 'dzin min par 'dod do //
translated: The training in superior mind is not asserted to be concentration.

original: yang ji ltar mdo de nyid las tshul khrims yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo dang / lta ba yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo dang / rnam par grol ba yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo zhes bshad pa'i tshul khrims yongs su dag pa ni tshul khrims las gzhan pa ma yin la /
analyzed: yang ji ltar mdo de nyid las tshul khrims yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo dang / lta ba yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo dang / rnam par grol ba yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo zhes bshad pa'i tshul khrims yongs su dag pa ni tshul khrims las gzhan pa ma yin la /
translated: Moreover, just as that same sutra explains the purity of ethics, the purity of view, and the purity of liberation, the purity of ethics is not other than ethics.

original: de bzhin du lta ba yongs su dag pa dang / rnam par grol ba yongs su dag pa yang de dag las gzhan pa ma yin pa de kho na dang 'dra bar sems yongs su dag pa yang sems las gzhan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du lta ba yongs su dag pa dang / rnam par grol ba yongs su dag pa yang de dag las gzhan pa ma yin pa de kho na dang 'dra bar sems yongs su dag pa yang sems las gzhan pa ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, the purity of view and the purity of liberation are not other than those.

original: sems yongs su dag pa ni bsam gtan bzhi'i mtshan nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin yin pas so //
analyzed: sems yongs su dag pa ni bsam gtan bzhi'i mtshan nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin yin pas so //
translated: The purity of mind is not other than the mind, because the purity of mind is concentration that has the nature of the four absorptions.

original: de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba ni gal te bsam gtan rnams ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin yin na /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba ni gal te bsam gtan rnams ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin yin na /
translated: If that is so, then if the absorptions have the nature of concentration,

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad bsam gtan du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad bsam gtan du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it follows that all concentrations are absorptions.

original: ting nge 'dzin dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can dang lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyang bsam gtan du thal bar 'gyur te /🔽ting nge 'dzin ni @285a * //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can dang lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyang bsam gtan du thal bar 'gyur te / ting nge 'dzin ni @285a * //
translated: Also, virtuous, afflicted, and neutral concentrations would become the absorptions,🔽because concentration

original: sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is a universal mental factor.

original: ma yin te /🔽phul du phyin pa dang ldan pa la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te / phul du phyin pa dang ldan pa la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,🔽because it is said that they possess the highest meditative stabilization,

original: ting nge 'dzin phul du phyin pa dang ldan pa la bsam gtan gyi ming du btags pa'i phyir nyi ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin phul du phyin pa dang ldan pa la bsam gtan gyi ming du btags pa'i phyir nyi ma bzhin no //
translated: that is not so, because they are called absorptions when they possess the highest meditative stabilization, like the sun.

original: dper na gang zhig phul du phyin par snang bar byed pa de kho na nyi ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dper na gang zhig phul du phyin par snang bar byed pa de kho na nyi ma yin gyi /
translated: For example, only that which illuminates with the highest illumination is the sun,

original: srin bu me khyer la sogs pa ni ma yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: srin bu me khyer la sogs pa ni ma yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: but fireflies and so on are not.

original: de ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni yan lag dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin de ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong rta gnya' sbrel bas shing rta 'dren pa dang 'dra bas zung du 'brel bar ngang gis 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni yan lag dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin de ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong rta gnya' sbrel bas shing rta 'dren pa dang 'dra bas zung du 'brel bar ngang gis 'byung ba'o //
translated: That is the concentration possessing members, which is like a chariot drawn by two yoked horses, calm abiding and insight.

original: de'i phyir mdo las mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa zhes bshad do //🔽lam sla ba zhes bya ba ni yan lag dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin nyid lam sla ba zhes bshad do zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo las mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa zhes bshad do // lam sla ba zhes bya ba ni yan lag dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin nyid lam sla ba zhes bshad do zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Therefore, it is called “the pleasant abiding that is visible here and now” in the sutras.🔽The path that is easy is the concentration possessing members.

original: sla ba'i phyir des ni shin tu yang sems par byed do //
analyzed: sla ba'i phyir des ni shin tu yang sems par byed do //
translated: Because it is easy, it is also called “the concentration that is very easy to practice.”🔽How can a defiled state be a meditative absorption?

original: nyon mongs pa can ji ltar bsam gtan yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te dge ba'i yan lag dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsam gtan yin na //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ji ltar bsam gtan yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te dge ba'i yan lag dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsam gtan yin na //
translated: If a meditative absorption possessing virtuous members is a meditative absorption, then how can a defiled meditative absorption be a meditative absorption?

original: nyon mongs pa can ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ji ltar bsam gtan nyid du bshad ces bya ba tshig lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ji ltar bsam gtan nyid du bshad ces bya ba tshig lhag ma yin no //
translated: It is this: “How can afflicted meditative attainment that is concomitant with enjoyment be called meditative stabilization?”

original: bsam gtan ni rnam pa gsum ste ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / dag pa dang / zag pa med pa'o zhes pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan ni rnam pa gsum ste ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / dag pa dang / zag pa med pa'o zhes pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, “Meditative stabilization is threefold: that which is concomitant with enjoyment, that which is pure, and that which is uncontaminated.”

original: log par nges par sems pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni log par nges par rtog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: log par nges par sems pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni log par nges par rtog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it is wrongly ascertained, means because it is wrongly conceived.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa'i sems kyis kyang log par nges par sems pa'i phyir der thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa'i sems kyis kyang log par nges par sems pa'i phyir der thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: It would be absurd, means it would follow that it is wrongly ascertained by a mind that is completely bound by attachment to sense objects.

original: ma yin te de dang mthun pa kho na la zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te de ni de ltar thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te de dang mthun pa kho na la zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te de ni de ltar thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: That is not so, because it is said, “It is only that which is similar to it.”🔽It is not so that it would follow that it is wrongly ascertained by a mind that is completely bound by attachment to sense objects.

original: de dang mthun pa mtshar gcig mtshan nyid mang po mi mthun pa med pa'i nyon mongs pa can la bsam gtan zhes ming du btags pa ste sa bon rul ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de dang mthun pa mtshar gcig mtshan nyid mang po mi mthun pa med pa'i nyon mongs pa can la bsam gtan zhes ming du btags pa ste sa bon rul ba bzhin no //
translated: and the afflicted meditative stabilization that is not in accord with that, which is not associated with many characteristics, is called a meditative stabilization, like a rotten seed.

original: dper na rdo la sogs pa sa bon ma yin pa kha cig ni de'i rigs dang mtshan nyid shin tu mi 'dra ba'i phyir sa bon rul pa zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: dper na rdo la sogs pa sa bon ma yin pa kha cig ni de'i rigs dang mtshan nyid shin tu mi 'dra ba'i phyir sa bon rul pa zhes mi bya'o //
translated: For example, some things that are not seeds, such as stones, are not called rotten seeds because they are not similar in type and characteristics to seeds.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: sa bon gyi rigs nyid nyams pa gang yin pa de kho na la sa bon rul pa'o zhes ming du 'dogs pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: sa bon gyi rigs nyid nyams pa gang yin pa de kho na la sa bon rul pa'o zhes ming du 'dogs pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: That which is the degeneration of the seed lineage itself is designated as a rotten seed.🔽It is said that nonvirtuous meditative stabilizations also exist.

original: bsam gtan mi dge ba dag kyang gsungs so zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i 'dod @285b chags kyis kun nas dkris pa de 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa nang du byas nas sems par byed /
analyzed: bsam gtan mi dge ba dag kyang gsungs so zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i 'dod @285b chags kyis kun nas dkris pa de 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa nang du byas nas sems par byed /
translated: The afflicted entanglements of desire realm attachment are internalized as the afflicted entanglements of desire realm attachment and one thinks and fully thinks them.

original: rab tu sems par byed do zhes rgyas par 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: rab tu sems par byed do zhes rgyas par 'byung ba yin te /
translated: This is stated extensively.

original: 'dis ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pas kun nas dkris pa yang bsam gtan nyid yin pas nyes pa med do//🔽zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pas kun nas dkris pa yang bsam gtan nyid yin pas nyes pa med do// zhes ston par byed do //
translated: This shows that there is no fault, since the meditative development of the factors that contribute to enlightenment is also the envelopment of passion etc.

original: du ba dang me bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na 'di na du ba yod pas zhes du ba smos pas me yang smras pa yin te /
analyzed: du ba dang me bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na 'di na du ba yod pas zhes du ba smos pas me yang smras pa yin te /
translated: The phrase, “like smoke and fire,” is an example. For instance, when smoke is mentioned, fire is also mentioned,

original: me med na du ba mi 'byung bas lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me med na du ba mi 'byung bas lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because fire and smoke are concomitant, since smoke does not occur in the absence of fire.

original: med na mi 'byung ba 'di nyid kyis du ba gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba 'di nyid kyis du ba gtso bo yin no //
translated: It is precisely this non-occurrence in the absence of fire that is the principal factor in smoke.

original: gang na du ba yod pa de na me yod kyi gang na me yod pa de na du ba yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang na du ba yod pa de na me yod kyi gang na me yod pa de na du ba yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Where there is smoke, there is fire, but where there is fire, there is not necessarily smoke,

original: 'di ltar lcags bzhu ba dang mdag ma la sogs pa la me kho na 'dzin gyi du ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar lcags bzhu ba dang mdag ma la sogs pa la me kho na 'dzin gyi du ba ni ma yin no //
translated: because fire alone is apprehended in molten iron and embers, but not smoke.

original: de lta bas na du ba ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir sngar smos te /
analyzed: de lta bas na du ba ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir sngar smos te /
translated: Therefore, since smoke is the principal factor, it is mentioned first.

original: nor lha dang srid sgrub bzhin no //
analyzed: nor lha dang srid sgrub bzhin no //
translated: This is like the case of Kubera and prosperity.

original: de lta ma yin na ni me zhes bya ba'i sgra sngar smos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni me zhes bya ba'i sgra sngar smos par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, the word fire would be mentioned first.

original: yang lhan cig spyod pa ji lta bu rtog pa med par ni dga' ba dang bde ba dang ldan pa'i dpyod pa med do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yang lhan cig spyod pa ji lta bu rtog pa med par ni dga' ba dang bde ba dang ldan pa'i dpyod pa med do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Moreover, how can there be investigation associated with joy and pleasure in the absence of discursive thought?

original: ji ltar bsam gtan khyad par can gyi dpyod pa dga' ba dang bde ba dang ldan pa ma yin pas rtog pa med pa ltar dpyod pa 'di ni de lta bu ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar bsam gtan khyad par can gyi dpyod pa dga' ba dang bde ba dang ldan pa ma yin pas rtog pa med pa ltar dpyod pa 'di ni de lta bu ma yin no //
translated: The investigation of the special meditative absorption is not associated with joy and pleasure, and thus is without discursive thought. But this investigation is not like that.

original: de bas na dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba dang ldan zhes dga' ba dang bde ba dang bcas par ston pas dpyod pa 'di khyad par du byas pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba dang ldan zhes dga' ba dang bde ba dang bcas par ston pas dpyod pa 'di khyad par du byas pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, this investigation is distinguished by the statement that it is associated with joy and pleasure, since it is accompanied by joy and pleasure.

original: bsam gtan dang po ni dga' ba dang bde ba dang ldan pa'i dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po ni dga' ba dang bde ba dang ldan pa'i dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The first meditative absorption is accompanied by investigation associated with joy and pleasure, and is concomitant with joy and pleasure.

original: gal te rtog pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba dang ldan pa'o zhes mdor byas na nyes pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te rtog pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba dang ldan pa'o zhes mdor byas na nyes pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is wrong with the statement that the second meditation is associated with investigation, joy, pleasure, and samādhi?

original: de ltar bya bar ni mi nus te /🔽yan lag lnga lnga spangs pa yin //
analyzed: de ltar bya bar ni mi nus te / yan lag lnga lnga spangs pa yin //
translated: It cannot be said that way.🔽The second meditation is said to be the elimination of the five branches.

original: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba bsam gtan gnyis pa ni rtog pa spangs pa'o zhes byas na bsam gtan khyad par can yang bsam gtan gnyis par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba bsam gtan gnyis pa ni rtog pa spangs pa'o zhes byas na bsam gtan khyad par can yang bsam gtan gnyis par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the second meditation is said to be the elimination of investigation, then the special meditation would also be the second meditation.

original: gzhan yang bsam gtan dang po yan lag bzhi par bstan pa'i mjug nas go rims bzhin 'di skad du /🔽rtog pa dang bcas /
analyzed: gzhan yang bsam gtan dang po yan lag bzhi par bstan pa'i mjug nas go rims bzhin 'di skad du / rtog pa dang bcas /
translated: Moreover, the four branches of the first meditation are taught at the end of the sūtra in order, and it is said:

original: dpyod pa dang bcas dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: dpyod pa dang bcas dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes bshad do //
translated: Endowed with investigation and endowed with analysis, he abides having attained the first meditation that possesses the joy and pleasure born of seclusion.

original: de la bsam gtan dang po la dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba dang ting nge 'dzin dag @286a * //
analyzed: de la bsam gtan dang po la dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba dang ting nge 'dzin dag @286a * //
translated: In that passage, investigation, joy, pleasure, and samādhi are the four branches of the first meditation.

original: yod pas yan lag de bzhi dang thams cad kyi dang por bshad pa rtogs pa dang / yan lag lnga pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yod pas yan lag de bzhi dang thams cad kyi dang por bshad pa rtogs pa dang / yan lag lnga pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since it exists, it is the first of the four branches and all, and is called the fifth branch.🔽The second is the second concentration, which is complete with four branches, as it is said:

original: gnyis pa yang rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med la ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa yang rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med la ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes 'byung ste /
translated: He dwells having attained the second concentration which is without applied thought and sustained thought, and is filled with the joy and pleasure born of meditative stabilization.

original: yan lag bzhi po 'di dag las yan lag dang po dpyod pa'i mtshan nyid spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: yan lag bzhi po 'di dag las yan lag dang po dpyod pa'i mtshan nyid spangs pa yin no //
translated: From among these four branches, the first branch is abandoned, which has the characteristic of sustained thought.

original: gsum pa yang 'di skad du /
analyzed: gsum pa yang 'di skad du /
translated: The third is as follows:

original: dga' ba las 'dod chags dang bral nas btang snyoms su gnas shing zhes bya ba nas rgyas par bde bar gnas so zhes brjod pa bsam gtan gsum pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: dga' ba las 'dod chags dang bral nas btang snyoms su gnas shing zhes bya ba nas rgyas par bde bar gnas so zhes brjod pa bsam gtan gsum pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar 'byung ba yin te /
translated: Having become free from attachment to joy, he dwells in equanimity, and so on up to he dwells having attained the third concentration which is said to be blissful.

original: yan lag gzhan dga' ba'i mtshan nyid kyang spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: yan lag gzhan dga' ba'i mtshan nyid kyang spangs pa yin no //
translated: The other branch, which has the characteristic of joy, is also abandoned.

original: bzhi pa yang 'di skad du /
analyzed: bzhi pa yang 'di skad du /
translated: The fourth is as follows:

original: bde ba yang spangs shing zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa bde ba yang ma yin pa btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa can bsam gtan bzhi pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar 'byung ba yin te
analyzed: bde ba yang spangs shing zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa bde ba yang ma yin pa btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa can bsam gtan bzhi pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar 'byung ba yin te
translated: He has abandoned pleasure and also abandoned pain and so on, up to he has abandoned mental pleasure and mental displeasure, and he dwells having attained the fourth concentration, which is complete purity of equanimity and mindfulness.

original: / yan lag bde ba yang spangs pas de la ting nge 'dzin 'ba' zhig lus so //
analyzed: / yan lag bde ba yang spangs pas de la ting nge 'dzin 'ba' zhig lus so //
translated: Since he has abandoned the branch of pleasure, only meditative stabilization remains.

original: de'i phyir 'di skad du /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di skad du /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: dpyod dang dga' dang bde dang ldan //
analyzed: dpyod dang dga' dang bde dang ldan //
translated: Endowed with investigation, joy, and pleasure.

original: zhes mdor byas so //
analyzed: zhes mdor byas so //
translated: This is the summary.

original: de dag gi yang skye ba rnams ni bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag gi yang skye ba rnams ni bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Their births have already been explained.

original: gzugs med khams na gnas med de //
analyzed: gzugs med khams na gnas med de //
translated: There is no place in the formless realm.

original: skye ba las ni rnam pa bzhi //🔽zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba las ni rnam pa bzhi // zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Birth is of four types.🔽Because there is no form in the formless realm.

original: rjes su 'brang ba'i gzugs med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba'i gzugs med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because there is no form that is concomitant with it means because there is no concentration or uncontaminated vows.

original: dben pa zhes bya ba ni 'dis rnam par 'byed par byed pas dben pa'o //
analyzed: dben pa zhes bya ba ni 'dis rnam par 'byed par byed pas dben pa'o //
translated: The term discernment is derived from the verbal root vibhaj, which means to discern.

original: lam gang gis zhes bya ba ni bar chad med pa'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: lam gang gis zhes bya ba ni bar chad med pa'i lam gyis so //
translated: The term path refers to the uninterrupted path.

original: yang na rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis kyang yin te /
analyzed: yang na rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis kyang yin te /
translated: Alternatively, the term path can refer to the path of liberation,

original: de dang 'bras bu gcig pa'i phyir ro //🔽'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni des 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽gzugs kyi 'du shes bshig ces bya //🔽zhes bya ba ni 'di la gzugs kyi 'du shes bshig pa yod pas na gzugs kyi 'du shes bshig pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'bras bu gcig pa'i phyir ro // 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni des 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to // gzugs kyi 'du shes bshig ces bya // zhes bya ba ni 'di la gzugs kyi 'du shes bshig pa yod pas na gzugs kyi 'du shes bshig pa'o //
translated: because the path of liberation and the path of cultivation share the same result.🔽The phrase because they are free from attachment means that they are free from attachment to the form realm.🔽The term discernment is derived from the verbal root vijñā, which means to discern.

original: 'di dag la gzugs kyi 'du shes bshig pa zhes bya bas na gzugs kyi 'du @286b shes bshig ces bya'o //🔽re zhig 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes zer ba ni sde pa gzhan dag go //
analyzed: 'di dag la gzugs kyi 'du shes bshig pa zhes bya bas na gzugs kyi 'du @286b shes bshig ces bya'o //🔽re zhig 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes zer ba ni sde pa gzhan dag go //
translated: The term discernment is derived from the verbal root vijñā, which means to discern.🔽 The term discernment is derived from the verbal root vijñā, which means to discern.🔽 The term discernment is derived from the verbal root vijñā, which means to discern.🔽 The term discernment is derived from the verbal root vijñā, which means to discern.🔽 The term discernment is derived from the verbal root vijñā, which means to discern.🔽 The term discernment is derived from the verbal root vijñā, which means to discern.🔽 The term discernment is derived from the verbal root vijñā, which means to discern.🔽 The term discernment is derived from the verbal root vijñā, which means to discern.🔽 The term discernment is derived from the verbal root vijñā, which means to discern.🔽 The term discernment is derived from the verbal root vijñā, which means to discern.🔽 The term discernment is derived from the verbal root vijñā, which means to discern.🔽 The term discernment is derived from the verbal root vijñā, which means to discern.🔽 The term discernment is derived from the verbal root vijñā, which means to discern.🔽 The term discernment is derived from the verbal root vijñā, which means to discern.🔽 The term discernment is derived from the verbal root vijñā, which means to discern.

original: gal te yod na zhes zer ba ni bye brag tu smra ba'o //
analyzed: gal te yod na zhes zer ba ni bye brag tu smra ba'o //
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say: If it exists, it is like a small amount of yellow.

original: chung zad ser ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar chang chung tsam ser ba la cung zad ser ba zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: chung zad ser ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar chang chung tsam ser ba la cung zad ser ba zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as a small amount of yellow is called a little yellow,

original: gzugs cung zad cig yod pa la gzugs med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs cung zad cig yod pa la gzugs med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: so a small amount of form is called formless.

original: de dag med na de lus dang ngag med na ji ltar de dag gi sdom pa ste lus dang ngag gi sdom pa dag tu 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag med na de lus dang ngag med na ji ltar de dag gi sdom pa ste lus dang ngag gi sdom pa dag tu 'gyur /
translated: If they do not exist, how could there be vows of body and speech when they do not exist?

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i 'byung ba med par ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i 'byung ba las gyur pa mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i 'byung ba med par ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i 'byung ba las gyur pa mi rung ngo //
translated: Formless realm form cannot arise from formless realm primary elements, because there are no primary elements in the formless realm.🔽If you say it is like the uncontaminated vows,

original: gal te zag pa med pa'i sdom pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni de la 'di snyam du ji ltar zag pa med pa'i 'byung ba dag med bzhin du yang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs yod pa de bzhin du gzugs med
analyzed: gal te zag pa med pa'i sdom pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni de la 'di snyam du ji ltar zag pa med pa'i 'byung ba dag med bzhin du yang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs yod pa de bzhin du gzugs med
translated: then just as uncontaminated form arises from uncontaminated primary elements, even though there are no uncontaminated primary elements,🔽so too form arises from contaminated primary elements, even though there are no formless realm primary elements.

original: pa na spyod pa'i 'byung ba dag kyang med mod kyi /
analyzed: pa na spyod pa'i 'byung ba dag kyang med mod kyi /
translated: Even though the primary elements of the form realm do not exist,

original: 'on kyang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sdom pa 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs yod do snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'on kyang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sdom pa 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs yod do snyam du sems na /
translated: the formless realm meditative attainment that is form derived from the primary elements exists.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'byung ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'byung ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because contaminated primary elements exist.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'byung ba dag yod pas de dag gzugs med pa rnams na yod cing /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'byung ba dag yod pas de dag gzugs med pa rnams na yod cing /
translated: Since contaminated primary elements exist, they exist in the formless realm.

original: zag pa med pa'i 'byung ba dag ni med de /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i 'byung ba dag ni med de /
translated: Uncontaminated primary elements do not exist there.

original: de'i phyir zag pa med pa'i sdom pa ni gang du skyes pa de na yod pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa dag rgyur byas nas skyes pas mi 'dra ba'i phyir rtog pa 'di ni rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir zag pa med pa'i sdom pa ni gang du skyes pa de na yod pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa dag rgyur byas nas skyes pas mi 'dra ba'i phyir rtog pa 'di ni rung ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since uncontaminated vows arise in dependence on the primary elements that exist wherever they are born, this conception is not tenable because they are dissimilar.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa la yang de dgag pa bshad do zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i gzugs bkag pa 'di nyid kyis snyoms par 'jug pa la yang gzugs bkag par bshad pa yin pas 'di la 'bad pa gzhan ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa la yang de dgag pa bshad do zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i gzugs bkag pa 'di nyid kyis snyoms par 'jug pa la yang gzugs bkag par bshad pa yin pas 'di la 'bad pa gzhan ni mi bya'o //
translated: The refutation of form that arises is also the refutation of form in meditative attainment.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gal te lus dang ngag gi sdom pa tsam zhig go zhe na /
analyzed: gal te lus dang ngag gi sdom pa tsam zhig go zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is merely the vows of body and speech,

original: de dag med na ji ltar de dag gi sdom par 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag med na ji ltar de dag gi sdom par 'gyur /
translated: then how could they be vows if they do not exist?

original: 'byung ba med par ni 'byung ba las gyur pa mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'byung ba med par ni 'byung ba las gyur pa mi rung ngo //
translated: It is illogical for that derived from the elements to exist without the elements.

original: gal te zag pa med pa'i sdom pa bzhin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te zag pa med pa'i sdom pa bzhin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that it is like the uncontaminated vows, that is not so,

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'byung ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'byung ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because contaminated elements exist.

original: gzhan dag na re rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das nas zhes 'byung bas snyoms par 'jug pa la yang de dgag par bshad pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das nas zhes 'byung bas snyoms par 'jug pa la yang de dgag par bshad pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The refutation of form in meditative attainment is also explained here because it says, “Totally transcending the perception of form,” and so on.

original: de ltar na gzugs med pa'i snyoms par @287a * //
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs med pa'i snyoms par @287a * //
translated: Thus, the formless realm is the highest level of meditative attainment.🔽

original: 'jug pa la yang gzugs med la gzugs med par skye ba dag la yang med do zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa la yang gzugs med la gzugs med par skye ba dag la yang med do zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is explained that the formless meditative attainment also does not exist in the formless realm, and that it also does not exist for those born in the formless realm.🔽If you say that it is because their size is small,

original: gal te bong tshod chung ba'i phyir ro zhe na ni zhes bya ba ni 'on te rdul phra rab tsam gyi gzugs shig yod ba de'i phyir de dag la gzugs cung zad cig yod do zhes bya bar 'dod na ni phra ba'i phyir chu'i skye bo gzugs bltar
analyzed: gal te bong tshod chung ba'i phyir ro zhe na ni zhes bya ba ni 'on te rdul phra rab tsam gyi gzugs shig yod ba de'i phyir de dag la gzugs cung zad cig yod do zhes bya bar 'dod na ni phra ba'i phyir chu'i skye bo gzugs bltar
translated: if you assert that they have some form because they have form that is the size of a subtle particle, then it follows that the creatures of the water element, which are invisible because of their subtlety, would also have form.

original: mi snang ba dag la yang thal bar 'gyur te /🔽gzugs med bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi snang ba dag la yang thal bar 'gyur te / gzugs med bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It would also follow that they would be formless.🔽If you say that it is because they are clear,

original: gal te dang ba'i phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni de la 'di snyam du gzugs dang ba'i phyir gzugs med pa dag yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: gal te dang ba'i phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni de la 'di snyam du gzugs dang ba'i phyir gzugs med pa dag yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: if you think that the formless realm is formless because form is clear there,

original: srid pa bar ma dang / gzugs na spyod pa dag la yang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: srid pa bar ma dang / gzugs na spyod pa dag la yang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it would follow that the intermediate existence and the form realm would also be formless.

original: srid pa bar ma dang gzugs na spyod pa dag la yang thal ba ni dang ba'i phyir rdo rje'i ril yang thogs pa med par 'gro bas de dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma dang gzugs na spyod pa dag la yang thal ba ni dang ba'i phyir rdo rje'i ril yang thogs pa med par 'gro bas de dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The consequence that the intermediate existence and the form realm would also be formless is established because even a diamond is not obstructed by the clear light of the sun and moon.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa bzhin du skye ba khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ji ltar nam mkha' mtha' yas la sogs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag ches shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa de bzhin du dag gi skye ba'i khyad par yang
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa bzhin du skye ba khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ji ltar nam mkha' mtha' yas la sogs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag ches shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa de bzhin du dag gi skye ba'i khyad par yang
translated: Because birth is superior to meditative attainment,

original: dang ba dang ches dang ba dang ches shin tu dang ba'o zhes khas blang dgos so //
analyzed: dang ba dang ches dang ba dang ches shin tu dang ba'o zhes khas blang dgos so //
translated: you must accept that the clear light of the first absorption is clear, the clear light of the second absorption is clearer, and the clear light of the third absorption is clearest.

original: de'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa bzhin du skye ba ches shin tu dang bas zhes bya bar khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir de kho na gzugs med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa bzhin du skye ba ches shin tu dang bas zhes bya bar khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir de kho na gzugs med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because birth is superior to meditative attainment, it is the clearest, and thus it alone is formless.

original: gal te yang gzugs med par skye ba'i gzugs na dang ba'i phyir sa 'og ma pa'i dbang pos mi 'dzin pas gzugs med pa rnams zhes bya ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yang gzugs med par skye ba'i gzugs na dang ba'i phyir sa 'og ma pa'i dbang pos mi 'dzin pas gzugs med pa rnams zhes bya ba'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that formless states are not form because they are not apprehended by sense faculties of lower level,🔽then form generated in the absorptions would also not be form.

original: bsam gtan du skye ba'i gzugs kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //🔽'di ltar sbyar te /🔽bsam gtan du skye ba'i gzugs /🔽bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa yang sa 'og ma pa'i dbang po ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan du skye ba'i gzugs kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so // 'di ltar sbyar te / bsam gtan du skye ba'i gzugs / bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa yang sa 'og ma pa'i dbang po ste /
translated: This is because form generated in the absorptions🔽is not apprehended by sense faculties of lower level.🔽Form generated in the absorptions is not apprehended by sense faculties of lower level.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i dbang pos mi zin la /🔽de bzhin du sa gong ma pa'i ches shin tu dang ba'i phyir bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'i gzugs kyang bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa'i bar gyi dbang pos mi zin to //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i dbang pos mi zin la / de bzhin du sa gong ma pa'i ches shin tu dang ba'i phyir bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'i gzugs kyang bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa'i bar gyi dbang pos mi zin to //
translated: Form of the second absorption is not apprehended by sense faculties of the first absorption.🔽Similarly, form of the fourth absorption is not apprehended by sense faculties of the third absorption and so on.

original: de ltar na bsam gtan du skyes pa'i gzugs kyang sa 'og ma pa'i dbang pos mi zin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na bsam gtan du skyes pa'i gzugs kyang sa 'og ma pa'i dbang pos mi zin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because form generated in the absorptions is not apprehended by sense faculties of lower level,🔽it would not be form.

original: gzugs med pa de dang khyad par ci zhig yod na 'di ltar ches shin tu gsal ba'i @287b tshul 'dra ba yang de dag kho na gzugs med par 'dod kyi gzugs na spyod pa rnams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa de dang khyad par ci zhig yod na 'di ltar ches shin tu gsal ba'i @287b tshul 'dra ba yang de dag kho na gzugs med par 'dod kyi gzugs na spyod pa rnams ni ma yin te /
translated: They assert that only those realms are formless, not those that are form realms.

original: de lta bas na de na gzugs med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na de na gzugs med do //
translated: Therefore, form does not exist there.

original: 'on te khams gnyis kyi ming ni don dang mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te khams gnyis kyi ming ni don dang mthun pa yin te /
translated: But the names of the two realms are consistent with their meanings.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan gyis rab tu phye ba ni 'dod pa'i khams yin la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan gyis rab tu phye ba ni 'dod pa'i khams yin la /
translated: The desire realm is distinguished by the objects of desire.

original: gzugs kyis rab tu phye ba ni gzugs kyi khams yin gyi /
analyzed: gzugs kyis rab tu phye ba ni gzugs kyi khams yin gyi /
translated: The form realm is distinguished by form.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi ming ni don dang mthun pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi ming ni don dang mthun pa ma yin no //
translated: The name of the formless realm is not consistent with its meaning.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: If you ask, “Why is that?,”

original: 'dod rgyal ba yin no zhe na /🔽khams gnyis kyi ming ni don dang mthun pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dod rgyal ba yin no zhe na / khams gnyis kyi ming ni don dang mthun pa yin gyi /
translated: it is because it is arbitrary.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de la rigs pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de la rigs pa ci zhig yod /
translated: What reasoning is there to support the claim that the names of the two realms are consistent with their meanings, but the name of the formless realm is not?

original: de ltar rigs pas gzugs med pa'i khams na gzugs med do zhes bkag nas lung smos te dogs pa zlog par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar rigs pas gzugs med pa'i khams na gzugs med do zhes bkag nas lung smos te dogs pa zlog par byed do //
translated: Thus, having refuted the existence of form in the formless realm through reasoning, he cites scripture to eliminate doubts.

original: de la gzugs rab tu grub par bya ba'i phyir gal te tshe dang drod gnyis zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de la gzugs rab tu grub par bya ba'i phyir gal te tshe dang drod gnyis zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: To establish the existence of form, he says, “If life and heat are mixed,” and so on.🔽If you think that the existence of form in the formless realm is established,

original: gal te gzugs med pa dag na gzugs yod pa nyid grub bo zhe na zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di ni re re la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te gzugs med pa dag na gzugs yod pa nyid grub bo zhe na zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di ni re re la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: this statement should be applied to each of the formless realms.

original: ji lta zhe na /🔽gal te tshe dang drod gnyis 'dres par gsungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / gal te tshe dang drod gnyis 'dres par gsungs pa'i phyir /
translated: How so?

original: gzugs yod pa nyid du grub bo zhe na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs yod pa nyid du grub bo zhe na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If you think that the existence of form is established because it is said that life and heat are mixed,🔽then this is not so.

original: de la 'di snyam du mdo las /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du mdo las /
translated: In this regard, the sūtras say:

original: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che tshe gang yin pa dang drod gang yin pa'i chos 'di dag ni 'dres pa ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che tshe gang yin pa dang drod gang yin pa'i chos 'di dag ni 'dres pa ste /
translated: Venerable Mahākauṣṭhila, life and heat are mixed phenomena.🔽They are not unmixed.

original: ma 'dres pa ma yin no zhes rgyas par 'byung bas de'i phyir de na tshe yod na drod kyang yod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa ma yin no zhes rgyas par 'byung bas de'i phyir de na tshe yod na drod kyang yod par 'gyur la /
translated: This is stated extensively. Therefore, if life exists there, heat would also exist.

original: drod ni gzugs yin no zhes bya bar grub bo snyam du sems na'o //
analyzed: drod ni gzugs yin no zhes bya bar grub bo snyam du sems na'o //
translated: If you think that heat is form, then that is not so.

original: gal te 'dam bu'i shog gnyis bzhin du ming dang gzugs dag phan tshun bstan to zhes gsungs pa'i phyir gzugs med pa dag na gzugs yod pa nyid du 'grub bo zhe na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te 'dam bu'i shog gnyis bzhin du ming dang gzugs dag phan tshun bstan to zhes gsungs pa'i phyir gzugs med pa dag na gzugs yod pa nyid du 'grub bo zhe na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If you think that form exists in the formless realm because it is said that name and form are mutually supportive like two bundles of reeds, then that is not so.🔽The sutra states:

original: mdo las tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dper na 'dam bu'i shog gnyis gnam du bsgrengs te phan tshun bsten cing 'dug pa de la 'ga' zhig gis gcig bor na cig shos 'gyel bar 'gyur la cig shos bor na yang cig shos 'gyel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdo las tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dper na 'dam bu'i shog gnyis gnam du bsgrengs te phan tshun bsten cing 'dug pa de la 'ga' zhig gis gcig bor na cig shos 'gyel bar 'gyur la cig shos bor na yang cig shos 'gyel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Venerable Sariputra, for example, two bundles of reeds might stand leaning on each other. If one bundle is removed, the other falls down and if the other is removed, the first falls down.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de bzhin du ming dang gzugs kyang phan tshun brten cing gnas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de bzhin du ming dang gzugs kyang phan tshun brten cing gnas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Venerable Sariputra, name and form also exist in mutual dependence.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes gsungs pa'i phyir de lta @288a * //
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes gsungs pa'i phyir de lta @288a * //
translated: If you think that form exists in the formless realm because it is said that name and form arise in dependence on consciousness, then that is not so.

original: bas na gzugs med pa dag na gzugs yod pa nyid du 'grub bo zhe na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bas na gzugs med pa dag na gzugs yod pa nyid du 'grub bo zhe na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore form exists in the formless realm.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mdo las /
translated: The Sūtra on Dependent Origination states:🔽In the context of the characteristics of rebirth, consciousness is the condition of name and form.

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid kyi skabs su rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes gsungs pa'i phyir de lta bas na gzugs med pa dag na gzugs yod do zhes bya bar grub bo zhe na zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid kyi skabs su rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes gsungs pa'i phyir de lta bas na gzugs med pa dag na gzugs yod do zhes bya bar grub bo zhe na zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore form exists in the formless realm.

original: gzugs nas 'du byed kyi bar las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te mdo las dge slong dag rnam par shes pa gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba /🔽gzugs la dmigs pa /
analyzed: gzugs nas 'du byed kyi bar las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te mdo las dge slong dag rnam par shes pa gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba / gzugs la dmigs pa /
translated: Form exists in the formless realm because the Sūtra on Dependent Origination states:

original: gzugs la brten pa gnas so //
analyzed: gzugs la brten pa gnas so //
translated: Monks, consciousness is form, it approaches form, it focuses on form, it is supported by form.

original: dge slong dag gang la la zhig 'di skad du bdag ni gzugs dang tshor ba nas 'du byed kyi bar dag las gzhan du rnam par shes par 'gro ba'am 'ong bar smra'o zhes zer na /
analyzed: dge slong dag gang la la zhig 'di skad du bdag ni gzugs dang tshor ba nas 'du byed kyi bar dag las gzhan du rnam par shes par 'gro ba'am 'ong bar smra'o zhes zer na /
translated: Monks, if someone says, “I say consciousness approaches or comes from form, feeling, perception, or formation,”

original: de'i ngag de ni de'i tshig tsam du zad do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i ngag de ni de'i tshig tsam du zad do zhes gsungs te /
translated: His words are just words.

original: lung 'di dang sbyar na yang gzugs med pa dag na gzugs yod do zhes bya bar 'grub bo zhes de snyam du sems na ma yin te /
analyzed: lung 'di dang sbyar na yang gzugs med pa dag na gzugs yod do zhes bya bar 'grub bo zhes de snyam du sems na ma yin te /
translated: If you think that form exists in the formless realm because this passage proves it, you are wrong,

original: dpyad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpyad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is to be analyzed.

original: 'on te thams cad las zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa las so //
analyzed: 'on te thams cad las zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa las so //
translated: Or, if you think that the phrase “from all” refers to the realms of desire, form, and the formless,

original: 'dir dgongs pa'i don 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir dgongs pa'i don 'di yin te /
translated: the intended meaning is as follows.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i tshe kho na las dgongs nas de skad du gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i tshe kho na las dgongs nas de skad du gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The Buddha spoke with reference to the desire realm alone.🔽Thus it is said:

original: 'di ltar / tshe dang drod dang rnam shes kyis //🔽gang tshe lus 'di 'dor byed cing //
analyzed: 'di ltar / tshe dang drod dang rnam shes kyis // gang tshe lus 'di 'dor byed cing //
translated: Life, heat, and consciousness🔽when they leave this body

original: bor nas de tshe nyal ba ni //
analyzed: bor nas de tshe nyal ba ni //
translated: and it is cast aside,

original: ji ltar shing la sems med bzhin //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar shing la sems med bzhin // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: it lies like a log, devoid of mind.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni lus kyang med na lus 'jig pa lta ga la zhig yod /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni lus kyang med na lus 'jig pa lta ga la zhig yod /
translated: If the formless realm has no body, how could the destruction of the body exist there?

original: gzugs kyi khams na ni lus yod mod kyi lus 'jig par mngon pa ni med do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ni lus yod mod kyi lus 'jig par mngon pa ni med do //
translated: In the form realm, there is a body, but it is not evident that the body is destroyed.

original: gang yang ming dang gzugs dag phan tshun bsten pa nyid du gsungs pa de yang 'dod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa kho na las dgongs te gsungs so zhes bya bar mngon te /
analyzed: gang yang ming dang gzugs dag phan tshun bsten pa nyid du gsungs pa de yang 'dod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa kho na las dgongs te gsungs so zhes bya bar mngon te /
translated: The statement that name and form are mutually dependent is stated from the perspective of those who experience desire realm objects and form realm objects.

original: gnyi ga yod na phan tshun bsten pa nyid srid pas so//
analyzed: gnyi ga yod na phan tshun bsten pa nyid srid pas so//
translated: This is because mutual dependence is possible when both exist.

original: gang yang rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba ni 'di la rkyen rnam par shes pa yod pas rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs so zhes de skad du drug pa'i don du 'bru mang po par tshig bsdus pa yin no
analyzed: gang yang rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba ni 'di la rkyen rnam par shes pa yod pas rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs so zhes de skad du drug pa'i don du 'bru mang po par tshig bsdus pa yin no
translated: The statement in the sutra that name and form are conditioned by consciousness is a compound word in the sixth case, meaning that name and form are conditioned by consciousness because consciousness is a condition for name and form.

original: // 'dir ci rnam par shes pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'du byed kyi rkyen @288b can nas /
analyzed: // 'dir ci rnam par shes pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'du byed kyi rkyen @288b can nas /
translated: Here, does consciousness have the karma of the desire realm as its condition?

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i 'du byed kyi rkyen can gyi bar thams cad ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen yin nam /
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i 'du byed kyi rkyen can gyi bar thams cad ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen yin nam /
translated: Is all that is conditioned by the formative forces that operate in the formless realm a condition of name and form?

original: 'on te ming dang gzugs thams cad rnam par shes pa'i rkyen can yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te ming dang gzugs thams cad rnam par shes pa'i rkyen can yin zhe na /
translated: Or, is all name and form a condition of consciousness?

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba 'di la bdag ni ming dang gzugs thams cad kyi rkyen rnam par shes pa yin no zhes bya bar nges par gzung gi rnam par shes pa thams cad ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen yin no zhes bya🔽bar ni nges par mi bzung ngo zhes zer te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba 'di la bdag ni ming dang gzugs thams cad kyi rkyen rnam par shes pa yin no zhes bya bar nges par gzung gi rnam par shes pa thams cad ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen yin no zhes bya bar ni nges par mi bzung ngo zhes zer te /
translated: In this regard, the following is stated: “The statement, ‘name and form have consciousness as their causal condition,’ is ascertained as meaning that consciousness is the causal condition of all name and form, but it is not ascertained as meaning that all consciousness is a condition of name and form.

original: rnam par shes pa cung zad cig ni ming kho na'i rkyen yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa cung zad cig ni ming kho na'i rkyen yin te /
translated: Some consciousness is a condition of name alone.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i 'du byed kyi rkyen can gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i 'du byed kyi rkyen can gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which is conditioned by the formative forces that operate in the formless realm.

original: cung zad cig ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen yin te /
analyzed: cung zad cig ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen yin te /
translated: Some consciousness is a condition of name and form.

original: 'dod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i 'du byed kyi rkyen can gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i 'du byed kyi rkyen can gang yin pa'o //
translated: The condition of the formations is the desire realm and the form realm.

original: des na 'di skad du ming dang gzugs 'di'i rkyen ni rnam par shes pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: des na 'di skad du ming dang gzugs 'di'i rkyen ni rnam par shes pa kho na yin gyi /

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar du gong nas gong du gzugs rags pa las nges par 'byung ba yin pas gzugs med par thal bar 'gyur ro //🔽tshor ba la sogs pa las kyang nges par 'byung ba yin par ci'i phyir ma bshad ces bya ba ni gal te rang gi sa pa'i gzugs yod bzhin du yang sa 'og ma pa'i gzugs yod bzhin du rags pa las nges par 'byung ba'i phyir gzugs med pa
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar du gong nas gong du gzugs rags pa las nges par 'byung ba yin pas gzugs med par thal bar 'gyur ro // tshor ba la sogs pa las kyang nges par 'byung ba yin par ci'i phyir ma bshad ces bya ba ni gal te rang gi sa pa'i gzugs yod bzhin du yang sa 'og ma pa'i gzugs yod bzhin du rags pa las nges par 'byung ba'i phyir gzugs med pa
translated: So too, since the absorptions are progressively liberated from increasingly coarse form, it would follow that they are formless.🔽Why is it not said that they are liberated from feeling and so on?🔽If it is said that the formless states are formless because they are liberated from the form of lower levels even though form exists on their level,

original: dag ces bya ba ni rang gi sa pa'i tshor ba yod bzhin du yang gzugs med pa rnams ni tshor ba la sogs pa las nges par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir tshor ba med pa'o zhes kyang ci'i phyir ma bshad /
analyzed: dag ces bya ba ni rang gi sa pa'i tshor ba yod bzhin du yang gzugs med pa rnams ni tshor ba la sogs pa las nges par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir tshor ba med pa'o zhes kyang ci'i phyir ma bshad /
translated: then why is it not said that the formless states are without feeling and so on because they are liberated from feeling and so on even though feeling and so on exist on their level?

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rang gi @290b sa pa'i rnam par shes pa yod bzhin du rnam par shes pa med pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ci'i phyir ma bshad ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rang gi @290b sa pa'i rnam par shes pa yod bzhin du rnam par shes pa med pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ci'i phyir ma bshad ces bya ba yin no //
translated: The term “and so on” indicates that the phrase “while consciousness exists” should be applied to the remaining aggregates of feeling, etc., up to the phrase “while consciousness does not exist.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: sa 'og ma pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa las nges par 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: sa 'og ma pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa las nges par 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are the deliverance from the feeling, etc., of the lower stage.

original: sa 'og ma pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa rags pa las nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽gzugs kyi rnam pa zad pa las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa dag ni snyoms par 'jug pa dang / skye ba la gzugs kyi rnam pa gang ci yang rung rags pa'am /🔽phra ba'am / nang gi'am /
analyzed: sa 'og ma pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa rags pa las nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // gzugs kyi rnam pa zad pa las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa dag ni snyoms par 'jug pa dang / skye ba la gzugs kyi rnam pa gang ci yang rung rags pa'am / phra ba'am / nang gi'am /
translated: The meaning is that they are the deliverance from the coarse feeling, etc., of the lower stage.🔽The phrase “the transcendence of the sphere of form” means that the formless states transcend all the aspects of form, whether gross or subtle, internal or external.

original: phyi'i yang rung ste de thams cad las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi'i yang rung ste de thams cad las 'das pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “the transcendence of the sphere of form” means that the formless states transcend all the aspects of form, whether gross or subtle, internal or external.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa las ni ma yin te /
translated: They do not transcend the aspects of feeling, etc.

original: gzugs med pa dag ni snyoms par 'jug pa dang / skye ba la tshor ba thams cad las 'das pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa dag ni snyoms par 'jug pa dang / skye ba la tshor ba thams cad las 'das pa ma yin te /
translated: The formless states do not transcend all feelings in terms of meditative attainment and rebirth,

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is a feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rnam par shes pa'i bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rnam par shes pa'i bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: The word “etc.” should be understood to include the other aggregates up to consciousness.

original: de'i phyir gzugs rnams las nges par 'byung ba zhes gsungs kyi tshor ba la sogs pa las nges par 'byung ba zhes ni ma gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs rnams las nges par 'byung ba zhes gsungs kyi tshor ba la sogs pa las nges par 'byung ba zhes ni ma gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the Buddha said that the formless states transcend form, but he did not say that they transcend feeling, etc.🔽Therefore, the following reductio argument does not apply to our position:

original: de lta bas na kho bo cag de skad du smra ba la ni sa 'og ma pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa las nges par 'byung ba'i phyir tshor ba la sogs pa las kyang nges par 'byung ba yin par ci'i phyir ma bshad ces bya ba'i thal ba🔽'dir mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na kho bo cag de skad du smra ba la ni sa 'og ma pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa las nges par 'byung ba'i phyir tshor ba la sogs pa las kyang nges par 'byung ba yin par ci'i phyir ma bshad ces bya ba'i thal ba 'dir mi 'gyur ro //
translated: “If the formless states transcend form, then why did the Buddha not say that they also transcend feeling, etc., since they transcend the lower levels, such as feeling?”

original: smras pa / gal te gzugs med pa rnams gzugs rnams las nges par byung ba yin na /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te gzugs med pa rnams gzugs rnams las nges par byung ba yin na /
translated: Objection: If the formless states transcend form,

original: 'o na mdo las nga ni srid pas srid pa las 'byung bar mi smra'o zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de ji ltar na gzugs med pa'i srid pas gzugs kyi srid pa las nges par 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mdo las nga ni srid pas srid pa las 'byung bar mi smra'o zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de ji ltar na gzugs med pa'i srid pas gzugs kyi srid pa las nges par 'byung zhe na /
translated: But if it is said that the sūtra declares, “I do not say that existence is liberated from existence,” how is it that formless existence is liberated from form existence?

original: srid pas srid pa la nges par mi 'byung bar gsungs pa ni de nyid kyis de las nges par mi 'byung ba'i phyir de skad du bshad par zad do //
analyzed: srid pas srid pa la nges par mi 'byung bar gsungs pa ni de nyid kyis de las nges par mi 'byung ba'i phyir de skad du bshad par zad do //
translated: The sūtra declares that existence is not liberated from existence because it is not liberated from itself.

original: thams cad dang gtan du nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: thams cad dang gtan du nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not liberated from all and because it is not liberated eternally.

original: thams cad las nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa ni gzugs kyi srid pas 'dod pa'i srid pa las nges par 'byung mod kyi /
analyzed: thams cad las nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa ni gzugs kyi srid pas 'dod pa'i srid pa las nges par 'byung mod kyi /
translated: It is not liberated from all because form existence is liberated from desire realm existence,

original: des gzugs med pa'i srid pa las kyang nges par 'byung ba ni ma yin no //🔽des 'dod pa'i srid pa las gtan du nges par 'byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: des gzugs med pa'i srid pa las kyang nges par 'byung ba ni ma yin no // des 'dod pa'i srid pa las gtan du nges par 'byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: but it is not liberated from formless realm existence.

original: yang 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not liberated eternally from desire realm existence because it returns again.

original: de bzhin du gzugs med @291a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs med @291a * //
translated: Similarly, formless existence is not liberated from all and is not liberated eternally.

original: pa'i srid pas kyang gzugs kyi srid pa las nges par byung gi 'dod pa'i srid pa las ni ma yin la gzugs med pa'i srid pas gzugs kyi srid pa las gtan du nges par 'byung ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: pa'i srid pas kyang gzugs kyi srid pa las nges par byung gi 'dod pa'i srid pa las ni ma yin la gzugs med pa'i srid pas gzugs kyi srid pa las gtan du nges par 'byung ba yang ma yin no //
translated: and the existence of the formless realm is not a permanent deliverance from the existence of the form realm.

original: ji ltar gnas pa ni sngar bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni /🔽der ni ris dang srog la yang //🔽sems kyi rgyud ni brten pa yin //
analyzed: ji ltar gnas pa ni sngar bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni / der ni ris dang srog la yang // sems kyi rgyud ni brten pa yin //
translated: How they abide has already been explained.🔽There, the continuum of mind

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: is supported on the class and on life.

original: gsum po zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa zhes bya bar sbyar ba'i phyir pho'i rtags kyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gsum po zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa zhes bya bar sbyar ba'i phyir pho'i rtags kyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: The three is stated by the masculine ending in order to connect it with the formless.

original: de ltar sbyor phyir zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i dus na nam mkha' la sogs par 'gyur gyi gzhan na ni ci rigs par chos gzhan dag la yang dmigs so zhes ston to //
analyzed: de ltar sbyor phyir zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i dus na nam mkha' la sogs par 'gyur gyi gzhan na ni ci rigs par chos gzhan dag la yang dmigs so zhes ston to //
translated: Because they are connected in that way, at the time of connection, they become space, etc. Otherwise, they focus on other things as appropriate.

original: dman phyir 'du shes med 'du shes med pa'ang ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir gzugs med pa bzhi pa 'du shes can zhes kyang mi bya la 'du shes med pa zhes kyang mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: dman phyir 'du shes med 'du shes med pa'ang ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir gzugs med pa bzhi pa 'du shes can zhes kyang mi bya la 'du shes med pa zhes kyang mi bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the fourth formless state called neither perception nor nonperception?

original: dman pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dman pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is inferior.

original: dman phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang gis gzugs med pa bzhi pa de 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ces bya ba'i rgyu de nyid brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: dman phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang gis gzugs med pa bzhi pa de 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ces bya ba'i rgyu de nyid brjod pa yin no //
translated: Because it is inferior means that the reason why the fourth formless state is called the base of neither perception nor nonperception is the same reason why it is called inferior.

original: ming dang don dang mthun par btags pa'i phyir 'di'i sbyor ba yang de lta bu yin par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: ming dang don dang mthun par btags pa'i phyir 'di'i sbyor ba yang de lta bu yin par brjod pa yin no //
translated: The application of this term is also explained in accordance with the meaning of the name.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gal te de la yang 'di ltar sbyor mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gal te de la yang 'di ltar sbyor mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: For this very reason, it is said, “If one applies this term to it in this way, etc.”

original: 'du shes ni 'bras so zhes bya ba ni 'bras dang 'dra bas na 'bras te zug rngu'i bar du yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'du shes ni 'bras so zhes bya ba ni 'bras dang 'dra bas na 'bras te zug rngu'i bar du yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Perception is a boil means that it is like a boil, and the same applies up to thorn.

original: 'du shes med pa pa ni kun du rmongs pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'du shes med pa yang kun du rmongs pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya bar shes te /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa pa ni kun du rmongs pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'du shes med pa yang kun du rmongs pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya bar shes te /
translated: The state of composure without conception is a state of complete confusion.

original: 'du shes kun du chad pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'du shes kun du chad pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The state of composure without conception is also a cause of complete confusion, because it is a state in which conception is completely absent.

original: 'di ni zhi ba zhes bya ba gang yin zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ni zhi ba zhes bya ba gang yin zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: What is meant by “this is peace”?

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ces bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text states, “It is the sphere of neither conception nor non-conception.”

original: 'du shes dman pa la mngon par dag 'o /🔽// / bam po lnga bcu brgyad pa /
analyzed: 'du shes dman pa la mngon par dag 'o / // / bam po lnga bcu brgyad pa /
translated: Conception is weak in this sphere.

original: 'dir ci'i phyir de dag gis de la de ltar 'dzin zhes dri bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir ci'i phyir de dag gis de la de ltar 'dzin zhes dri bar bya ste /
translated: Here, one should ask, “Why do they apprehend it in that way?”

original: de dag gis zhes bya ba ni de la snyoms par 'jug ba dag gis so //🔽de la zhes bya ba ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la'o //
analyzed: de dag gis zhes bya ba ni de la snyoms par 'jug ba dag gis so // de la zhes bya ba ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la'o //
translated: The phrase “by them” refers to those who enter that state of composure.🔽The phrase “in that way” refers to the sphere of neither conception nor non-conception.

original: de ltar 'dzin zhes bya ba ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min zhes 'dzin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ltar 'dzin zhes bya ba ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min zhes 'dzin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “they apprehend it” means that they apprehend it as being “neither conception nor non-conception.”

original: de bas na de skad du yongs su 'dri bas brgal bas ni 'du shes rnams chung ba'i phyir @291b 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ces bya'o zhes bya ba 'di gdon mi za bar brjod dgos pas de nyid bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na de skad du yongs su 'dri bas brgal bas ni 'du shes rnams chung ba'i phyir @291b 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ces bya'o zhes bya ba 'di gdon mi za bar brjod dgos pas de nyid bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it must be said that this is the reason why the meditative attainment is called the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception: because the perceptions are weaker.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i dngos gzhi'i rdzas zhes bya ba ni de dag gi yan lag ni nye bar mi dgod do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i dngos gzhi'i rdzas zhes bya ba ni de dag gi yan lag ni nye bar mi dgod do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “the substance of the actual basis of meditative attainment” means that the branches of these meditative attainments are not posited as the basis.

original: ji ltar bdun ni rnam pa gsum yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bdun ni rnam pa gsum yin zhe na /
translated: How are the first seven types of meditative attainment threefold?

original: ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams dang dag pa pa rnams dang / zag pa med pa rnams so zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams dang dag pa pa rnams dang / zag pa med pa rnams so zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: They are associated with enjoyment, pure, and uncontaminated.

original: zag pa med pa ni med do zhes bya ba ni 'du shes dman pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni med do zhes bya ba ni 'du shes dman pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Uncontaminated meditative attainment does not exist because perception is weak.

original: ro myong par byed pa gang yin pa de las ni langs pa yin no zhes bya ba dag pa pa las so //
analyzed: ro myong par byed pa gang yin pa de las ni langs pa yin no zhes bya ba dag pa pa las so //
translated: One arises from meditative attainment that is associated with enjoyment, but not from the pure meditative attainment.

original: gang gis ro myong bar byed pa de la ni snyoms par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ro myong ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa la'o //
analyzed: gang gis ro myong bar byed pa de la ni snyoms par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ro myong ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa la'o //
translated: One who experiences it is said to “enter” it.

original: yan lag bzhi pa'i dmag yan lag las don gzhan du gyur pa ma yin pas ji lta bar yan lag lnga pa'i bsam gtan yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: yan lag bzhi pa'i dmag yan lag las don gzhan du gyur pa ma yin pas ji lta bar yan lag lnga pa'i bsam gtan yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Just as an army with four divisions is not different from its divisions, so too the fourth meditative absorption is not different from its five members.

original: don gzhan ma yin no zhes rang gi gzhung lugs ston par byed do //
analyzed: don gzhan ma yin no zhes rang gi gzhung lugs ston par byed do //
translated: This is how he presents his own position.

original: dga' ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa dga' ba dang bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid dang nang rab tu dang ba ste /
analyzed: dga' ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa dga' ba dang bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid dang nang rab tu dang ba ste /
translated: Joy and so on are joy, pleasure, mental one-pointedness, and internal clarity, as previously explained.

original: gnyis pa ni yan lag bzhi pa yin no //🔽gsum pa la lnga btang snyoms dang zhes bya ba ni 'di 'du byed kyi btang snyoms yin par bzung ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni yan lag bzhi pa yin no // gsum pa la lnga btang snyoms dang zhes bya ba ni 'di 'du byed kyi btang snyoms yin par bzung ste /
translated: The second has four members.🔽The third has five members, with equanimity added.

original: dga' ba la rtsol ba med pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba la rtsol ba med pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: This is the equanimity of formative factors, which is characterized by the absence of exertion toward joy.

original: dran pa ni btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan mi brjed pa yin no //
analyzed: dran pa ni btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan mi brjed pa yin no //
translated: Mindfulness is the cause of equanimity, because it is the non-forgetting of the sign of equanimity.

original: shes bzhin ni dran pa mi brjed pa yin no //
analyzed: shes bzhin ni dran pa mi brjed pa yin no //
translated: Awareness is the non-forgetting of mindfulness.

original: bzhi pa la btang snyoms yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni btang snyoms kyi yongs su dag pa ni btang snyoms yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa la btang snyoms yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni btang snyoms kyi yongs su dag pa ni btang snyoms yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: In the fourth, there is the purity of equanimity, because it is the purity of equanimity.

original: sa 'og ma pa'i skyon dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa 'og ma pa'i skyon dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is free from the faults of the lower stages.

original: skyon ni brgyad 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyon ni brgyad 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The faults are the eight that will be explained.

original: dran pa yongs su dag pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dran pa yongs su dag pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The purity of mindfulness is also like that.

original: bsam gtan dang po pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po na yod pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po na yod pa'o //
translated: The first absorption is that which exists in the first absorption.

original: de nyid kyi phyir smras pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gnyis pa la sogs pa na nang rab tu dang ba la sogs pa 'phel bas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir smras pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gnyis pa la sogs pa na nang rab tu dang ba la sogs pa 'phel bas so //
translated: For that very reason, it is said that in the second and so on, the increase of inner clarity and so on is due to the increase of inner clarity and so on.

original: ji lta zhe na /🔽mu bzhi ste bsam gtan dang po na yod la gnyis pa na ma yin pa yang yod /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / mu bzhi ste bsam gtan dang po na yod la gnyis pa na ma yin pa yang yod /
translated: How is that?🔽There are four possibilities: That which exists in the first absorption but not in the second,

original: gnyis pa na yod la dang po na ma yin pa yang yod /
analyzed: gnyis pa na yod la dang po na ma yin pa yang yod /
translated: that which exists in the second but not in the first,

original: gnyi ga na yod pa yang yod //
analyzed: gnyi ga na yod pa yang yod //
translated: There are also factors that are limbs of both.

original: gnyi ga na ma yin pa yang yod do //🔽de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi yan lag @292a * //
analyzed: gnyi ga na ma yin pa yang yod do // de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi yan lag @292a * //
translated: There are also factors that are not limbs of either.🔽In the same way, all the members of the absorptions should be mutually combined.

original: thams cad phan tshun sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad phan tshun sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: yan lag gang dag bsam gtan dang po na yod pa de dag gsum pa na yang yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag gang dag bsam gtan dang po na yod pa de dag gsum pa na yang yod dam zhe na /
translated: Are the members that exist in the first absorption also present in the third absorption?

original: mu bzhi ste /
analyzed: mu bzhi ste /
translated: There are four possibilities.

original: mu dang po ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba dag go //
analyzed: mu dang po ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba dag go //
translated: The first possibility is investigation, analysis, joy, and pleasure.

original: gnyis pa ni btang snyoms dang dran pa dang shes bzhin dang bde ba dag go //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni btang snyoms dang dran pa dang shes bzhin dang bde ba dag go //
translated: The second possibility is equanimity, mindfulness, introspection, and pleasure.

original: gsum pa ni ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: gsum pa ni ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The third possibility is concentration.

original: mu bzhi pa ni bshad pa la ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: mu bzhi pa ni bshad pa la ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: The fourth possibility is those factors not included in the explanation.

original: yan lag gang dag bsam gtan dang po na yod pa de dag bzhi pa na yang yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag gang dag bsam gtan dang po na yod pa de dag bzhi pa na yang yod dam zhe na /
translated: Are the members that exist in the first absorption also present in the fourth absorption?

original: mu bzhi ste /
analyzed: mu bzhi ste /
translated: There are four possibilities.

original: mu dang po ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba dag go //
analyzed: mu dang po ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba dag go //
