analyzed: zhes smos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is drawn with exertion.🔽Because it is drawn with exertion,🔽because it is drawn with exertion.🔽Because it is drawn with exertion,

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin te zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma med pa las byung bas na mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin te zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma med pa las byung bas na mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: because it is drawn with exertion.🔽Because it is drawn with exertion,🔽because it is drawn with exertion.🔽Because it is drawn with exertion,🔽because it is drawn with exertion.🔽Because it is drawn with exertion,

original: rnam pa bcu yin no zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa ste gnyis dang kun 'byung gi rnam pa bzhi dang / lam gyi rnam par bzhi ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu yin no zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa ste gnyis dang kun 'byung gi rnam pa bzhi dang / lam gyi rnam par bzhi ste /
translated: because it is drawn with exertion.🔽Because it is drawn with exertion,🔽because it is drawn with exertion.🔽Because it is drawn with exertion,🔽because it is drawn with exertion.🔽Because it is drawn with exertion,🔽because it is drawn with exertion.🔽Because it is drawn with exertion,🔽because it is drawn with exertion.🔽Because it is drawn with exertion,🔽because it is drawn with exertion.🔽Because it is drawn with exertion,🔽because it is drawn with exertion.🔽Because it is drawn with exertion,🔽because it is drawn with exertion.🔽Because it is drawn with exertion,🔽because it is drawn with exertion.🔽Because it is drawn with exertion,🔽because it is drawn with exertion.🔽Because it is drawn with exertion,🔽because it is drawn with exertion.🔽Because it is drawn with exertion,🔽because it is drawn with exertion.🔽Because it is drawn with exertion,🔽because it is drawn with exertion.🔽Because it is drawn with exertion,🔽because it is drawn with exertion.🔽Because it is drawn with exertion,🔽because it is drawn with exertion.🔽Because it is drawn with exertion,

original: de dag ni rnam pa bcu yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni rnam pa bcu yin no //
translated: because it is drawn with exertion.🔽Because it is drawn with

original: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang de'i rgyu dag gis yid 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang de'i rgyu ste sdug bsngal de'i rgyu kun 'byung bas yid 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang de'i rgyu dag gis yid 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang de'i rgyu ste sdug bsngal de'i rgyu kun 'byung bas yid 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one is disgusted with impermanence, suffering, and its cause.

original: ci zhe na smon pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: ci zhe na smon pa med pa yin te /
translated: What is that? It is wishlessness.

original: 'khor ba ma byas pa yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽lam yang gdon mi za bar gzings lta bur dor bar bya ba yin pa nyid kyi phyir de gzings zhes bya ba ni gzings so //
analyzed: 'khor ba ma byas pa yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // lam yang gdon mi za bar gzings lta bur dor bar bya ba yin pa nyid kyi phyir de gzings zhes bya ba ni gzings so //
translated: It is the non-performance of cyclic existence, that is, the non-performance of the cause of suffering.🔽The path is also definitely to be abandoned, like a raft.

original: 'di la de dang 'dra ba yin pas na lam ni gzings lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di la de dang 'dra ba yin pas na lam ni gzings lta bu'o //
translated: The word “like” is a simile.

original: de'i ngo bo ni nyid de /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni nyid de /
translated: The nature of that is just that.

original: lam ni gzings lta bu'i phyir gdon mi za bar dor bar @301b bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: lam ni gzings lta bu'i phyir gdon mi za bar dor bar @301b bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: The path is like a raft, because it is definitely to be abandoned.🔽Therefore, it is wishlessness.

original: de lta bas na smon pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas pa ste //
analyzed: de lta bas na smon pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas pa ste //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: dper na gzings la brten nas chu bo rgal ba ni de gdon mi za bar dor par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gzings la 'chel te mi 'dug pa de bzhin du lam la brten nas rgal ba yang de gdon mi za bar dor bar bya ba yin pa'i
analyzed: dper na gzings la brten nas chu bo rgal ba ni de gdon mi za bar dor par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gzings la 'chel te mi 'dug pa de bzhin du lam la brten nas rgal ba yang de gdon mi za bar dor bar bya ba yin pa'i
translated: For example, one who crosses a river by boat should not cling to the boat, because it is certain that he will abandon it.

original: phyir lam la 'chel te mi 'dug go //
analyzed: phyir lam la 'chel te mi 'dug go //
translated: Similarly, one who crosses over by the path should not cling to the path, because it is certain that he will abandon it.

original: de'i rnam pa can zhes bya ba ni de dag gi rnam pa bcu po ji skad du bshad pa can no //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa can zhes bya ba ni de dag gi rnam pa bcu po ji skad du bshad pa can no //
translated: Having the aspect of those means having the ten aspects of those, as they have been explained.

original: de las 'da' bar mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lam de las 'da' bar mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de las 'da' bar mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lam de las 'da' bar mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is directed to going beyond that means because it is directed to going beyond that path.

original: 'dis ni de gdon mi za bar spong bar bya ba nyid du ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni de gdon mi za bar spong bar bya ba nyid du ston to //
translated: This shows that it is certain that it is to be abandoned.

original: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang de'i rgyu las 'da' bar mngon du phyogs pa zhes bya ba de ni ma bshad kyang khong du chud pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang de'i rgyu las 'da' bar mngon du phyogs pa zhes bya ba de ni ma bshad kyang khong du chud pa nyid do //
translated: Although it is not stated, it is understood that it is directed to going beyond impermanence, suffering, and the cause of that.

original: stong pa dang bdag med pa dag gis ni yid mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa dag gis ni rnal 'byor pa yid 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong pa dang bdag med pa dag gis ni yid mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa dag gis ni rnal 'byor pa yid 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind of the yogi is not repelled by the aspects of emptiness and selflessness.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa dag tu dmigs mod kyi de dag gis sdug bsngal de las yid 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa dag tu dmigs mod kyi de dag gis sdug bsngal de las yid 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Although the yogi does perceive the truth of suffering as having the aspects of emptiness and selflessness, he is not repelled by that suffering.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is like nirvana.

original: stong pa dang bdag med pa dag ni chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid yin pas mya ngan las 'das pa yang stong pa dang bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid yin na /
analyzed: stong pa dang bdag med pa dag ni chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid yin pas mya ngan las 'das pa yang stong pa dang bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid yin na /
translated: Since emptiness and selflessness are the characteristics of all dharmas, nirvana also has the characteristics of emptiness and selflessness.

original: de dag gis mya ngan las 'das pa de las yid 'byung ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis mya ngan las 'das pa de las yid 'byung ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Since the yogi is not repelled by nirvana, he is not repelled by those two.

original: de lta bas na smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni de dag gi rnam pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni de dag gi rnam pa can ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the samadhi of wishlessness does not have those two as its aspects.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams ni sa bcu gcig na yod do zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams dang mi lcogs pa med pa dang bsam gtan khyad par can dang bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa dag na'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams ni sa bcu gcig na yod do zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams dang mi lcogs pa med pa dang bsam gtan khyad par can dang bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa dag na'o //
translated: The mundane ones exist on eleven levels, that is, in the desire realm, the unrestricted states, the special meditative development, the meditative development of the form realm, and the formless realm.

original: gang na lam yod pa na yod do zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams dang srid pa'i rtse mo dang bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i nyer bsngogs ma gtogs pa'i sa rnams na'o //
analyzed: gang na lam yod pa na yod do zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams dang srid pa'i rtse mo dang bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i nyer bsngogs ma gtogs pa'i sa rnams na'o //
translated: They exist wherever the path exists, that is, on the levels, with the exception of the desire realm, the summit of existence, and the special meditative development of the second meditative absorption, etc.

original: thar pa'i sgo yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sgo'i don ni sgo mo'i don to zhes ston to //
analyzed: thar pa'i sgo yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sgo'i don ni sgo mo'i don to zhes ston to //
translated: The phrase “because they are the door to liberation” indicates that the meaning of “door” is the meaning of “gate.”

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid dang smon pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa la dmigs pa'i phyir stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa smon pa med pa dang /🔽mtshan ma med @302a * //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid dang smon pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa la dmigs pa'i phyir stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa smon pa med pa dang /🔽mtshan ma med @302a * //
translated: The phrase “because they focus on emptiness, etc.” indicates that emptiness of emptiness, wishlessness of wishlessness, and signlessness of signlessness are so called because they focus on the emptiness, wishlessness, and signlessness, respectively.

original: med pa mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: med pa mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The absence of a real entity is called “signlessness.”🔽Emptiness and signlessness are the emptiness of emptiness and the signless, respectively.

original: stong pa dang mi rtag par zhes bya bar ni grangs bzhin du stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ni mi slob pa'i stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la 'di ni bdag gi ma yin no zhes stong pa nyid kyi rnam par dmigs kyi bdag med pa'i rnam
analyzed: stong pa dang mi rtag par zhes bya bar ni grangs bzhin du stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ni mi slob pa'i stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la 'di ni bdag gi ma yin no zhes stong pa nyid kyi rnam par dmigs kyi bdag med pa'i rnam
translated: The emptiness of emptiness is the concentration of emptiness of the nonlearner, which is the emptiness aspect that observes the emptiness of the emptiness of the first concentration, thinking, “This is not mine.”

original: par ni ma yin no//
analyzed: par ni ma yin no//
translated: It is not the aspect of selflessness.

original: smras pa 'dir stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin ni stong pa'i rnam pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: smras pa 'dir stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin ni stong pa'i rnam pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: The concentration of emptiness of emptiness is the aspect of emptiness alone.🔽It is not the aspect of selflessness, like the emptiness of the first concentration.

original: stong pa nyid ltar bdag med pa'i rnam pa yang yin pa ni ma yin pa gang yin pa de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ltar bdag med pa'i rnam pa yang yin pa ni ma yin pa gang yin pa de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dir smras pa stong pa nyid kyi rnam par zhugs pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rjes la bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa stong pa nyid kyi rnam par zhugs pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rjes la bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because it is generated after the emptiness of emptiness that has entered the aspect of emptiness.

original: smras pa ci'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi rnam par zhugs pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rjes las skye'i /
analyzed: smras pa ci'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi rnam par zhugs pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rjes las skye'i /
translated: Why is it generated after the emptiness of emptiness that has entered the aspect of emptiness?

original: bdag med pa'i rnam par zhugs pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rjes las ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i rnam par zhugs pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rjes las ma yin zhe na /
translated: If you think that it is not from the emptiness concentration that has the aspect of selflessness,🔽we say that it is because it is compatible with the arising of that concentration.

original: 'dir smras pa de skye ba dang mthun pa'i phyir te stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa can gyi stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin de kho na stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin de skye ba dang mthun par gnas kyi bdag med pa'i rnam🔽pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa de skye ba dang mthun pa'i phyir te stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa can gyi stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin de kho na stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin de skye ba dang mthun par gnas kyi bdag med pa'i rnam pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The emptiness concentration that has the aspect of emptiness is compatible with the arising of the emptiness of emptiness, but not the aspect of selflessness.

original: ji ltar stong par mthong ba de bzhin du bdag med par mthong ba ni skyo bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar stong par mthong ba de bzhin du bdag med par mthong ba ni skyo bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: When one sees things as empty, one does not become disgusted in the same way that one does when one sees them as selfless.

original: srid pa dag la bdag med par mthong bzhin du yang stong par ma mthong ba'i phyir 'khor ba la mngon par dga' ba yod de /
analyzed: srid pa dag la bdag med par mthong bzhin du yang stong par ma mthong ba'i phyir 'khor ba la mngon par dga' ba yod de /
translated: Even though one sees existence as selfless, one does not see it as empty, and so one delights in cyclic existence.

original: dper na lam du zhugs pa ni 'dron po ngo mi shes pa mthong bas kyang dga' la gcig pu ni des stong pa'i phyir mi dga' ba de dang 'dra'o //🔽bam po lnga bcu dgu pa /
analyzed: dper na lam du zhugs pa ni 'dron po ngo mi shes pa mthong bas kyang dga' la gcig pu ni des stong pa'i phyir mi dga' ba de dang 'dra'o //🔽bam po lnga bcu dgu pa /
translated: For example, when one is traveling with a caravan, one is happy to see other caravans, but not when one is alone, because one is afraid of being robbed.

original: mi rtag pa'i rnam par dmigs so zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bcu'i nang nas so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i rnam par dmigs so zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bcu'i nang nas so //
translated: It is observed in the aspect of impermanence, from among the ten aspects.🔽It is not observed in the aspect of suffering, etc.

original: sdug bsngal bar yang ma yin la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni zag pa med pa ni de'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal du mi dmigs te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bar yang ma yin la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni zag pa med pa ni de'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal du mi dmigs te /
translated: It is not observed as suffering because it is not characterized by that, i.e., suffering.

original: 'phags pa dang mi mthun pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal du 'dod do //🔽zag pa med pa ni de'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir rgyu dang kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang rkyen gyi rnam pa dag tu yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa dang mi mthun pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal du 'dod do // zag pa med pa ni de'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir rgyu dang kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang rkyen gyi rnam pa dag tu yang ma yin te /
translated: It is asserted to be suffering because it is contrary to the āryas.

original: zag pa med pa ni kun mi 'byung ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni kun mi 'byung ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not observed in the aspects of cause, origin, strong generation, and condition because it is not characterized by that, i.e., it is not characterized by cause, etc.

original: lam gyi rnam pa rnams su yang ma yin te /
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa rnams su yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not observed in the aspects of path,🔽because it is to be refuted.

original: sun dbyung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi slob pa'i ting nge 'dzin de ni sun dbyung bar bya ba yin na /
analyzed: sun dbyung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi slob pa'i ting nge 'dzin de ni sun dbyung bar bya ba yin na /
translated: The concentration of the nonlearner is to be refuted.

original: lam gyi rnam pa @302b dag kyang sun 'byin pa'i ngo bo ma yin pas de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin de la lam gyi rnam pa dag tu mi dmigs so //
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa @302b dag kyang sun 'byin pa'i ngo bo ma yin pas de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin de la lam gyi rnam pa dag tu mi dmigs so //
translated: The aspects of the path are not the nature of cessation, therefore, in that meditative concentration, the aspects of the path are not discerned.

original: 'gog pa'i rnam pa dag tu ni 'brel pa med pa nyid pas de dag tu ni mi bsam mo //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i rnam pa dag tu ni 'brel pa med pa nyid pas de dag tu ni mi bsam mo //
translated: The aspects of cessation are not discerned because they are not related to the meditative concentration of the absence of expectancy.

original: lhag ma ni mi rtag pa'i rnam pa kho nar ro //🔽ma brtags zad pa la zhes bya ba ni so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: lhag ma ni mi rtag pa'i rnam pa kho nar ro // ma brtags zad pa la zhes bya ba ni so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The remaining aspects are discerned as the aspect of impermanence.🔽The meditative concentration of the absence of expectancy is the meditative concentration of the absence of expectancy of those who are not learners.🔽The meditative concentration of the absence of expectancy of those who are not learners is the meditative concentration of the absence of expectancy of those who are not learners.🔽The meditative concentration of the absence of expectancy of those who are not learners is the meditative concentration of the absence of expectancy of those who are not learners.

original: mi slob pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa la 'di ni zhi ba'o zhes zhi bar dmigs so //🔽de'i so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa la 'di ni zhi ba'o zhes zhi bar dmigs so // de'i so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: The meditative concentration of the absence of expectancy of those who are not learners is the meditative concentration of the absence of expectancy of those who are not learners.🔽The meditative concentration of the absence of expectancy of those who are not learners is the meditative concentration of the absence of expectancy of those who are not learners.🔽The meditative concentration of the absence of expectancy of those who are not learners is the meditative concentration of the absence of expectancy of those who are not learners.🔽The meditative concentration of the absence of expectancy of those who are not learners is the meditative concentration of the absence of expectancy of those who are not learners.🔽The meditative concentration of the absence of expectancy of those who are not learners is the meditative concentration of the absence of expectancy of those who are not learners.🔽The meditative concentration of the absence of expectancy of those who are not learners is the meditative concentration of the absence of expectancy of those who are not learners.🔽The meditative concentration of the absence of expectancy of those who are not learners is the meditative concentration of the absence of expectancy of those who are not learners.🔽The meditative concentration of the absence of expectancy of those who are not learners is the meditative concentration of the absence of expectancy of those who are not learners.🔽The meditative concentration of the absence of expectancy of those who are not learners is the meditative concentration of the absence of expectancy of those who are not learners.🔽The meditative concentration of the absence of expectancy of those who are not learners is the meditative concentration of the absence of expectancy of those who are not learners.🔽The meditative concentration of the absence of expectancy of those who are not learners is the meditative concentration of the absence of expectancy of those who are not learners.

original: mi slob pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las langs pa la de'i rjes la zag pa dang bcas pa'i skad cig ma dang zag pa med pa gzhan 'da' ba gang dag yin pa ste /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las langs pa la de'i rjes la zag pa dang bcas pa'i skad cig ma dang zag pa med pa gzhan 'da' ba gang dag yin pa ste /
translated: The meditative concentration of the absence of expectancy of those who are not learners is the meditative concentration

original: gal te de dag byung bar ma gyur na mi slob pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i skad cig ma rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de dag byung bar ma gyur na mi slob pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i skad cig ma rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If they do not occur, then the moments of signlessness of the adept will occur.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa gzhan de dag skye ba'i dus na mi slob pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i skad cig ma de dag rkyen ma tshang bas so sor ma brtags pas 'gog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa gzhan de dag skye ba'i dus na mi slob pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i skad cig ma de dag rkyen ma tshang bas so sor ma brtags pas 'gog par 'gyur te /
translated: When those other moments of the contaminated and uncontaminated arise, the moments of signlessness of the adept are obstructed by the non-completion of conditions, and thus they are a nonanalytical cessation.

original: so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa de la zhi ba'i rnam par dmigs so //
analyzed: so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa de la zhi ba'i rnam par dmigs so //
translated: They are observed as peace in that nonanalytical cessation.

original: zag pa med pa la so sor brtags pas 'gog pa med pa'i phyir so sor brtags pas 'gog pa la mi dmigs so//
analyzed: zag pa med pa la so sor brtags pas 'gog pa med pa'i phyir so sor brtags pas 'gog pa la mi dmigs so//
translated: They are not observed in analytical cessation because there is no analytical cessation in the uncontaminated.

original: ci'i phyir zag pa med pa la so sor brtags pas 'gog pa med ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zag pa med pa la so sor brtags pas 'gog pa med ce na /
translated: Why is there no analytical cessation in the uncontaminated?

original: mi mthun pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no incompatibility.

original: gang zhig 'phags pa rnams dang mi mthun pa de ni ldan ba bral bar bya ba'i phyir de dag sgrim mo //
analyzed: gang zhig 'phags pa rnams dang mi mthun pa de ni ldan ba bral bar bya ba'i phyir de dag sgrim mo //
translated: That which is incompatible with the āryas is cultivated in order to be free from possession.

original: bral ba yang so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yin te /
analyzed: bral ba yang so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yin te /
translated: Freedom is also an analytical cessation.

original: de'i phyir zag pa med pa la so sor brtags pas 'gog pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir zag pa med pa la so sor brtags pas 'gog pa med do //
translated: Therefore, the uncontaminated does not have analytical cessation.

original: gzhan yang mi slob pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la so sor brtags pas 'gog pa med pa'i phyir dang so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa yang de'i phyir rgol bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de la dga' ba kho nas de rnam par sun 'byin par 'dod
analyzed: gzhan yang mi slob pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la so sor brtags pas 'gog pa med pa'i phyir dang so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa yang de'i phyir rgol bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de la dga' ba kho nas de rnam par sun 'byin par 'dod
translated: Moreover, because the uncontaminated formless meditative attainments do not have analytical cessation, and because the contaminated would be refuted, he wishes to refute the contaminated alone by taking delight in the uncontaminated.

original: pa na / de'i so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa kho na la dmigs te /
analyzed: pa na / de'i so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa kho na la dmigs te /
translated: Therefore, he focuses on the contaminated alone, which is nonanalytical cessation.

original: 'jig rten na yang dgra dang bsdongs nas gsad par bya ba gsod pa snang ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang dgra dang bsdongs nas gsad par bya ba gsod pa snang ngo //
translated: In the world, it is seen that one kills an enemy in league with an enemy.

original: 'gog pa dang gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rnam par ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar mi rtag pa nyid kyi 'gog pa dang thun mong yin te /🔽de'i ngo bo ni nyid de /🔽mi rtag pa nyid kyi 'gog pa @303a * //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rnam par ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar mi rtag pa nyid kyi 'gog pa dang thun mong yin te / de'i ngo bo ni nyid de / mi rtag pa nyid kyi 'gog pa @303a * //
translated: The phrase “but not in terms of cessation, excellence, and definite emergence” means that impermanence is common to both the contaminated and the uncontaminated because the nature of impermanence is the cessation of that which is impermanent.

original: dang thun mong yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: dang thun mong yin pa nyid de /
translated: The cessation of that which is impermanent is common to both the contaminated and the uncontaminated.

original: de'i phyir so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa 'di la 'gog pa'i rnam par mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa 'di la 'gog pa'i rnam par mi dmigs so //
translated: Therefore, one does not observe the aspect of cessation in this non-analytical cessation.

original: de lta ma yin na de la zhi ba'i rnam par khyad par du 'phags pa dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de la zhi ba'i rnam par khyad par du 'phags pa dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, one would not observe the aspect of peace as superior in it.

original: 'gog pa'i rnam pas ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi 'gog pa kho nas so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa de sun phyung ba nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i rnam pas ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi 'gog pa kho nas so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa de sun phyung ba nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: By the aspect of cessation, one refutes the cessation of impermanence itself, because that non-analytical cessation is refuted.

original: de sun phyung na yang mi slob pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin sun phyung bar ma gyur to snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de sun phyung na yang mi slob pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin sun phyung bar ma gyur to snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: If that is refuted, one thinks that the signless concentration of the non-learner is not refuted.

original: so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa ni lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir gya nom pa'i rnam par yang ma yin te /
analyzed: so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa ni lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir gya nom pa'i rnam par yang ma yin te /
translated: Non-analytical cessation is not sublime, because it is neutral.

original: gya nom pa ni dge ba yin gyi lung du ma bstan pa ni ma yin pas de'i phyir gya nom pa'i rnam par mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gya nom pa ni dge ba yin gyi lung du ma bstan pa ni ma yin pas de'i phyir gya nom pa'i rnam par mi dmigs so //
translated: Sublime is virtue, not neutral. Therefore, one does not observe the aspect of sublime in it.

original: so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa ni bral ba ma yin pa'i phyir nges par byung ba'i rnam par mi dmigs te /
analyzed: so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa ni bral ba ma yin pa'i phyir nges par byung ba'i rnam par mi dmigs te /
translated: Cessation not attained through meditation is not a clear distinction, because it is not separation.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa las nges par 'byung ba yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa las nges par 'byung ba yin par 'dod do //
translated: Clear distinction is asserted to be separation from the afflictions.

original: de lta bas na so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pas 'khor ba las nges par byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pas 'khor ba las nges par byung ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, cessation not attained through meditation is not a clear distinction from cyclic existence.

original: 'di ltar chos dge ba dang mi dge ba kha cig gi so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa yod bzhin du de dag gi thob pa ma chad pa'i phyir de dag dang ldan pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos dge ba dang mi dge ba kha cig gi so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa yod bzhin du de dag gi thob pa ma chad pa'i phyir de dag dang ldan pa kho na yin no //
translated: Because the obtainment of some virtuous and nonvirtuous phenomena is not severed even though they are stopped through non-analytical cessation, one definitely possesses them.🔽Because they are hostile to the arya path.

original: 'phags pa'i lam la sdang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ji ltar sdang zhe na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam la sdang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ji ltar sdang zhe na /
translated: How are they hostile?

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam pas de la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam pas de la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they turn their back on it through the aspects of emptiness and so on.

original: mi g-yo la zhes bya ba'i mi g-yo ba'i chos can la ste /
analyzed: mi g-yo la zhes bya ba'i mi g-yo ba'i chos can la ste /
translated: The immutable arhats are those who do not change.

original: dbang po rno ba'i phyir de skyed pa'i mthu yod kyi dgra bcom pa gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po rno ba'i phyir de skyed pa'i mthu yod kyi dgra bcom pa gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: Because they have sharp intellectual faculty, they have the power to generate it, but not other arhats.

original: de dag gi mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir kun du chags pa'i gnas su 'gyur ba mi slob pa'i stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dag la rgyab kyis phyogs par bya ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gzhan dag la snyoms par
analyzed: de dag gi mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir kun du chags pa'i gnas su 'gyur ba mi slob pa'i stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dag la rgyab kyis phyogs par bya ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gzhan dag la snyoms par
translated: They enter other concentrations that are not the concentrations of emptiness, etc. of the nonlearner, which are the basis for attachment, because they are the basis for abiding in comfort in this life.🔽The extensive explanation is from the sutra:

original: 'jug go // rgya cher 'byung zhes bya ba ni mdo las ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa kun du bsten goms par byas lan mang du byas na mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par 'gyur ba yang yod ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'jug go // rgya cher 'byung zhes bya ba ni mdo las ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa kun du bsten goms par byas lan mang du byas na mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par 'gyur ba yang yod ces bya ba nas /
translated: “If the cultivation of concentration is practiced, made a living experience, and frequently repeated, it becomes the basis for abiding in comfort in this life.

original: ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa kun du bsten goms par byas lan mang du byas na zag pa zad par 'gyur ba yang yod ces bya ba'i bar 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa kun du bsten goms par byas lan mang du byas na zag pa zad par 'gyur ba yang yod ces bya ba'i bar 'byung ba yin no //
translated: If the cultivation of concentration is practiced, made a living experience, and frequently repeated, it becomes the basis for the extinction of contaminants.”

original: de la kun du bsten pa ni bsten pa bsdoms pas so //🔽goms par byas pa ni mi mthun pa spangs @303b pas so //
analyzed: de la kun du bsten pa ni bsten pa bsdoms pas so // goms par byas pa ni mi mthun pa spangs @303b pas so //
translated: Cultivation is the repetition of that. 🔽Practice is the avoidance of what is incompatible with it.

original: lan mang du byas pa ni mi mthun pa thag bsring bas so //
analyzed: lan mang du byas pa ni mi mthun pa thag bsring bas so //
translated: Repeated practice is the distancing of what is incompatible with it. 🔽The other kinds of cultivation should be understood in the same way, because they are similar to the first.

analyzed: tshe phyi ma ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba'o // der bde bar gnas pa ste /
translated: The other kinds of cultivation should be understood in the same way, because they are similar to the first.

analyzed: 'di ni de'i ched du gdon mi za ba ma yin no // ci'i phyir zhe na smras pa /

original: bsam gtan dang po las nyams pa rnams dang / gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa rnams dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa rnams la tshe phyi ma la bde bar gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po las nyams pa rnams dang / gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa rnams dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa rnams la tshe phyi ma la bde bar gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The other kinds of cultivation should be understood in the same way, because they are similar to the first. 🔽The other kinds of cultivation should be understood in the same way

original: shes pa mthong bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni shes par 'gyur ba dang / mthong bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig bsdu'o //
analyzed: shes pa mthong bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni shes par 'gyur ba dang / mthong bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase “one will come to see” is a reference to “one will come to know” and “one will come to see.”

original: de la shes pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: de la shes pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab ste /
translated: Knowledge is the wisdom that is concomitant with mental consciousness.

original: sems can 'di dag ni lus kyi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni lus kyi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: It is the discernment that “these sentient beings possess physical misconduct” and so on.

original: mthong ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: Seeing is the nonconceptual wisdom that is concomitant with eye consciousness.

original: smras pa lha'i mig gi mngon par shes pa ni shes pa mthong bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes bshad pa lha'i mig gi mngon par shes pa ni ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: smras pa lha'i mig gi mngon par shes pa ni shes pa mthong bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes bshad pa lha'i mig gi mngon par shes pa ni ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: The phrase “one will come to see” refers to the superknowledge of divine eye, but the superknowledge of divine eye is not the cultivation of samādhi.

original: 'dir smras pa 'di ni 'bras bu la rgyu btags pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa 'di ni 'bras bu la rgyu btags pa yin te /
translated: Here it is said that the cause is designated as the result.

original: rgyu ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa gang gi 'bras bu lha'i mig gi mngon par shes pa yin pa'i 'bras bu de la shes pa mthong bar 'gyur ba'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa yin no zhes rgyu nye bar btags so //
analyzed: rgyu ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa gang gi 'bras bu lha'i mig gi mngon par shes pa yin pa'i 'bras bu de la shes pa mthong bar 'gyur ba'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa yin no zhes rgyu nye bar btags so //
translated: the superknowledge of the base of infinite consciousness,

original: gang dag gi phyogs /
analyzed: gang dag gi phyogs /
translated: the superknowledge of the base of nothingness,🔽the superknowledge of the base of neither perception nor nonperception,🔽the superknowledge of the knowledge of the extinction of contaminants,🔽and the superknowledge of the knowledge of the minds of others.🔽The first five are the result of the fourth absorption.🔽The last two are the result of the third absorption.

original: rnam grol lam blo rnam pa drug / ces bya ba 'di yin ba de dag gi ltar na ni mngon par shes pa drug yid kyi rnam par grol ba'i lam bsam gtan gyis bsdus pa kho na yin pas de ni klan kar mi rung ba nyid de /
analyzed: rnam grol lam blo rnam pa drug / ces bya ba 'di yin ba de dag gi ltar na ni mngon par shes pa drug yid kyi rnam par grol ba'i lam bsam gtan gyis bsdus pa kho na yin pas de ni klan kar mi rung ba nyid de /
translated: The first five are the result of the fourth absorption.🔽The last two are the result of the third absorption.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam de dag ni mnyam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽chos mngon pa'i mdzod sems pa rnams kyi ltar na ni phyogs gong ma kho na ltar khong du chud par bya ste /

original: lha'i mig dang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dag mngon par shes pa nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: lha'i mig dang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dag mngon par shes pa nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro /
translated: The last two are the result of the third absorption.🔽The first five are the result

original: khams gsum pa dang zag pa med pa zhes bya ba la /🔽khams gsum pa ni mi sdug pa dang dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig @304a * //
analyzed: khams gsum pa dang zag pa med pa zhes bya ba la / khams gsum pa ni mi sdug pa dang dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig @304a * //
translated: The three realms and the uncontaminated.

original: pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched la sogs pa'o //
translated: The three realms are the mindfulness of repulsiveness, inhalation and exhalation, the absence of conflict, knowledge through prayer, correct knowledge, higher perception, liberation, the bases of subjugation, and so on.

original: zag pa med pa ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo dang thod rgal gyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo dang thod rgal gyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The uncontaminated are the doors of liberation, alternating meditative attainment, the higher perception of the destruction of the contaminants, and so on.

original: 'dir ni ting nge 'dzin dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir sbyor ba las byung ba'i yon tan rnams la ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa'o zhes bya bar nye bar btags pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni ting nge 'dzin dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir sbyor ba las byung ba'i yon tan rnams la ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa'o zhes bya bar nye bar btags pa yin no //
translated: Here, the qualities derived from practice are figuratively called the cultivation of concentration because they are concomitant with concentration.

original: shes rab rab tu rnam par dbye bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi khyad par phul du phyin par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab rab tu rnam par dbye bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi khyad par phul du phyin par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The phrase “the discernment of wisdom will be thoroughly purified” means that the excellence of wisdom will be perfected.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos ston pa 'di ni bdag nyid la nye bar gtod pa yin te zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos ston pa 'di ni bdag nyid la nye bar gtod pa yin te zhes bya ba la //
translated: The Lord’s teaching of the Dharma is directed to oneself.

original: rang la nye bar gtod pa ni bdag nyid la nye bar gtod pa'o //
analyzed: rang la nye bar gtod pa ni bdag nyid la nye bar gtod pa'o //
translated: “Directed to oneself” means “directed to one’s own self.”

original: bdag nyid kyi dbang du mdzad de bshad ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi dbang du mdzad de bshad ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: It is explained from the perspective of one’s own self.

original: byang chub sems dpa' las kyi mtha' la gzigs pa'i ched du phyir byung ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' las kyi mtha' la gzigs pa'i ched du phyir byung ste /
translated: The Bodhisattva went out for the purpose of observing the work of the world.

original: shing 'dzam bu'i drung du bsam gtan dang po bskyed do //
analyzed: shing 'dzam bu'i drung du bsam gtan dang po bskyed do //
translated: He generated the first meditative absorption in the presence of the Jambu tree.

original: byang chub kyi shing drung du ni thun dang po la lha'i bu'i bdud bcom nas lha'i spyan bskyed de /
analyzed: byang chub kyi shing drung du ni thun dang po la lha'i bu'i bdud bcom nas lha'i spyan bskyed de /
translated: In the presence of the Bodhi tree, in the first watch of the night, he conquered the demon of the sons of the gods and generated the divine eye.

original: lha'i spyan des 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba'i gnas nyam nga bar sems can rnams la gzigs nas de dag yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir gung thun la bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams mngon sum du mdzad de /
analyzed: lha'i spyan des 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba'i gnas nyam nga bar sems can rnams la gzigs nas de dag yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir gung thun la bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams mngon sum du mdzad de /
translated: With that divine eye, he sees sentient beings in miserable states of death, transmigration, and rebirth. In order to protect them, he actualizes the meditative absorptions, liberations, and samādhis during the middle watch of the night.

original: 'di'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i yon tan de dag ni shes rab rab tu rnon por byed par 'gyur ba yin no //🔽de'i 'og tu thun gsum pa la bsam gtan bzhi pa la brten te /
analyzed: 'di'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i yon tan de dag ni shes rab rab tu rnon por byed par 'gyur ba yin no // de'i 'og tu thun gsum pa la bsam gtan bzhi pa la brten te /
translated: Those qualities that arise from his practice make his wisdom very sharp.

original: nges par zhugs pa nas /
analyzed: nges par zhugs pa nas /
translated: Then, during the third watch of the night, he relies on the fourth meditative absorption.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis kun du sbyor ba thams cad spangs pa'i dbang du mdzad do //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis kun du sbyor ba thams cad spangs pa'i dbang du mdzad do //
translated: From the stage of certainty up to the vajropama samādhi, he abandons all the fetters.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar chos ston pa bdag nyid la nye bar gtod pa yin pa de'i phyir bsam gtan tha ma bzhi pa kho na'i rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar chos ston pa bdag nyid la nye bar gtod pa yin pa de'i phyir bsam gtan tha ma bzhi pa kho na'i rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because he teaches the Dharma in this way, he focuses on himself. Therefore, the vajropama samādhi, which is the final fourth meditative absorption, is called the “vajropama samādhi.”

original: sems can tshad med pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni tshad med pa'i 'du shes su bya ba'i byed rgyu yin no //🔽grangs bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gnod sems mang ba rnams kyi ni de spang ba'i phyir byams pa'o //
analyzed: sems can tshad med pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni tshad med pa'i 'du shes su bya ba'i byed rgyu yin no // grangs bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gnod sems mang ba rnams kyi ni de spang ba'i phyir byams pa'o //
translated: This is the causal process for the perception of the immeasurables.🔽According to the number means that for those who have much malice, there is loving-kindness in order to abandon that.

original: rnam par 'tshe ba mang ba rnams kyi ni de spong ba'i phyir snying rje'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba mang ba rnams kyi ni de spong ba'i phyir snying rje'o //
translated: For those who have much violence, there is compassion in order to abandon that.

original: mi dga' ba mang ba rnams kyi ni de spang ba'i phyir dga' ba'o //
analyzed: mi dga' ba mang ba rnams kyi ni de spang ba'i phyir dga' ba'o //
translated: For those who have much unhappiness, there is joy in order to abandon that.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang gnod sems mang ba rnams kyi ni de dag spang ba'i phyir btang @304b snyoms so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang gnod sems mang ba rnams kyi ni de dag spang ba'i phyir btang @304b snyoms so //
translated: For those who have much desire realm attachment and malice, there is equanimity in order to abandon those.🔽What is the difference in being the antidote to desire realm attachment?

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi gnyen po nyid du khyad par ci zhig yod ce na zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags mang ba rnams kyi phyir sems pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi gnyen po nyid du khyad par ci zhig yod ce na zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags mang ba rnams kyi phyir sems pa yin no //
translated: It is the intention for those who have much desire realm attachment.

original: pha dang ma dang bu dang nye du'i 'dod chags kyi gnyen po ni zhes bya ba ni mi 'brel ba med pa dag la ji lta ba de bzhin du de dag la btang snyoms su byed do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: pha dang ma dang bu dang nye du'i 'dod chags kyi gnyen po ni zhes bya ba ni mi 'brel ba med pa dag la ji lta ba de bzhin du de dag la btang snyoms su byed do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The antidote to attachment to father, mother, children, and relatives is equanimity. The meaning is that one should be equanimous toward them just as one is toward unrelated people.

original: de ni chags pas drangs pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gnod sems chags pas drangs pa yin pa de'i phyir chags pa'i gnyen po'i ngo bo nyid ston to snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni chags pas drangs pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gnod sems chags pas drangs pa yin pa de'i phyir chags pa'i gnyen po'i ngo bo nyid ston to snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Because it is drawn by attachment. The meaning is that one should understand that it is the antidote to attachment because malice is drawn by attachment.

original: 'di ni gnyi ga'i rang bzhin yin na rung ngo zhes bya ba ni ma chags pa'i rang bzhin dang zhe sdang med pa'i rang bzhin yin na rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: 'di ni gnyi ga'i rang bzhin yin na rung ngo zhes bya ba ni ma chags pa'i rang bzhin dang zhe sdang med pa'i rang bzhin yin na rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: It is suitable that it has the nature of both. The meaning is that it is suitable that it has the nature of nonattachment and nonaversion.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag gi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag gi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the antidote to attachment and aversion.

original: 'dir chos gcig la gnyi ga'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya bar ni mi bzung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir chos gcig la gnyi ga'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya bar ni mi bzung ngo //
translated: But here one should not hold that it has the nature of both.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: ma chags pa dang zhe sdang med pa dag la btang snyoms kyi sgra 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: ma chags pa dang zhe sdang med pa dag la btang snyoms kyi sgra 'jug pa yin no //
translated: The terms equanimity are used for nonattachment and nonaversion.

original: kye ma sems can rnams bde bar gyur cig ces bya ba ni shog shig snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: kye ma sems can rnams bde bar gyur cig ces bya ba ni shog shig snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The thought “Oh, may sentient beings be happy” is the thought “May they come to be happy.”

original: kye ma sems can rnams ni sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal las grol bar gyur cig snyam du bsams pa yin te /
analyzed: kye ma sems can rnams ni sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal las grol bar gyur cig snyam du bsams pa yin te /
translated: The thought “Oh, sentient beings are suffering” is the thought “May they be freed from suffering.”

original: de skad du 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de skad du 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained.

original: bar mar gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni phyogs su ma lhung ba nyid kyis rjes su chags pa yang med /🔽zhe 'gras pa yang med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bar mar gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni phyogs su ma lhung ba nyid kyis rjes su chags pa yang med / zhe 'gras pa yang med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because they abide in the middle, they are neither attached nor averse, that is, they are impartial.🔽If one has no such equanimity, how can one not be mistaken?🔽If one has no such equanimity, how can one not be mistaken?

original: de dang mi ldan pa rnams la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni bde ba dang mi ldan pa rnams bde ba yod par mos pa'i phyir ji ltar na phyin ci log pa nyid du mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de dang mi ldan pa rnams la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni bde ba dang mi ldan pa rnams bde ba yod par mos pa'i phyir ji ltar na phyin ci log pa nyid du mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one has no such equanimity, how can one not be mistaken?

original: gyur cig snyam du sems pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bde bar gyur cig snyam du sems pa'i phyir phyin ci log ma yin no zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gyur cig snyam du sems pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bde bar gyur cig snyam du sems pa'i phyir phyin ci log ma yin no zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is applied to the context: “Because it is the thought that they should be happy, it is not erroneous.”

original: yang na bsam pa phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang na bsam pa phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Or, because the intention is not erroneous.

original: bsam pa ni dge ba'i chos te /
analyzed: bsam pa ni dge ba'i chos te /
translated: Intention is a virtuous property.

original: sems can rnams bde bar gyur cig snyam pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba 'khor dang bcas pa de dag yin te /
analyzed: sems can rnams bde bar gyur cig snyam pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba 'khor dang bcas pa de dag yin te /
translated: It is the thought and mental factors, together with their retinue, that think, “May sentient beings be happy.”

original: bsam pa de phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir phyin ci log nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: bsam pa de phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir phyin ci log nyid ma yin no //
translated: Because that intention is not erroneous, it is not erroneous.

original: ji ltar bsam pa phyin ci log nyid ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bsam pa phyin ci log nyid ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is the intention not erroneous?

original: mos par 'du shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mos par 'du shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because it is the perception of conviction.

original: mos pa'i 'du shes pa ni mos par 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa'i 'du shes pa ni mos par 'du shes pa'o //
translated: The perception of conviction is the perception of conviction.

original: de lta bas na @305a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na @305a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: ji ltar mos pa de kho na ltar 'du shes te /
analyzed: ji ltar mos pa de kho na ltar 'du shes te /
translated: one perceives exactly as one is convinced.

original: 'di ni mos pa yid la byed pa yin no zhes bya bar yongs su gcod do //
analyzed: 'di ni mos pa yid la byed pa yin no zhes bya bar yongs su gcod do //
translated: This is the ascertainment that this is the mental attention of conviction.

original: gal te mi dge ba nyid yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log tu 'dzin pas so //
analyzed: gal te mi dge ba nyid yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log tu 'dzin pas so //
translated: because it is grasped through error,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: because it is a root of virtue.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not so?

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a root of virtue.

original: yang ji ltar dge ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar dge ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it virtuous?

original: gnod sems la sogs pa'i gnyen po yin pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gnod sems la sogs pa'i gnyen po yin pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said that it is the antidote to malice and so on.

original: byams pa ni gnod sems med pa'i rang bzhin yin pas gnod sems kyi gnyen po'o //
analyzed: byams pa ni gnod sems med pa'i rang bzhin yin pas gnod sems kyi gnyen po'o //
translated: Love is the antidote to malice, because it is by nature non-malice.

original: snying rje ni sdug bsngal sel ba'i rnam pa yin pas sdug bsngal nye par bsgrub pa rnam par 'tshe ba'i gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: snying rje ni sdug bsngal sel ba'i rnam pa yin pas sdug bsngal nye par bsgrub pa rnam par 'tshe ba'i gnyen po yin no //
translated: Compassion is the antidote to violence, which is the cause of suffering, because it is the aspect of the removal of suffering.

original: dga' ba ni yid bde ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir mi dga' ba'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni yid bde ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir mi dga' ba'i gnyen po'o //
translated: Joy is the antidote to depression, because it is by nature mental satisfaction.

original: btang snyoms ni bar mar gnas pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang gnod sems dag gi gnyen po yin pas so //
analyzed: btang snyoms ni bar mar gnas pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang gnod sems dag gi gnyen po yin pas so //
translated: Equanimity is the antidote to attachment and malice, because it is the antidote to attachment and malice, since it is the state of equilibrium.

original: de la dmigs pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems can la dmigs pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems can la dmigs pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase “that focuses on it” means that they focus on sentient beings who experience desire.

original: de ni snod kyis snod na gnas pa bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni snod kyis snod can sems can gyi 'jig rten bstan to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni snod kyis snod na gnas pa bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni snod kyis snod can sems can gyi 'jig rten bstan to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that “this is the teaching of the world of sentient beings that is contained in the physical cosmos,” which means that the physical cosmos teaches the sentient beings that are contained in it.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa dang mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa dang / dngos gzhi sbyor ba smos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ci rigs par gsum char yang sa drug dang lnga dang bcu pa nyid yin pa dag gi rgyu brjod pa yin te de las mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa ni 'dod pa'i khams dang sbyor ba
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa dang mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa dang / dngos gzhi sbyor ba smos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ci rigs par gsum char yang sa drug dang lnga dang bcu pa nyid yin pa dag gi rgyu brjod pa yin te de las mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa ni 'dod pa'i khams dang sbyor ba
translated: The phrase “because it mentions the actual basis and the preparatory stage” means that the three types of meditative development are, respectively, the six stages, the five stages, and the tenth stage.

original: ni nyer bsngogs dag yin par ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: ni nyer bsngogs dag yin par ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “the preparatory stage” refers to the uninterrupted stage.

original: sa drug par rnam par gzhag pa la ni nyer bsdogs mi lcogs pa med pa yang yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: sa drug par rnam par gzhag pa la ni nyer bsdogs mi lcogs pa med pa yang yin par 'dod de /
translated: The phrase “the six stages” refers to the five actual bases and the uninterrupted stage.🔽The phrase “the five stages” refers to the five actual bases.🔽The phrase “the tenth stage” refers to the uninterrupted stage.

original: gsal ba nyid kyis dngos gzhi dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba nyid kyis dngos gzhi dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is similar to the actual basis by its clarity.

original: sa snga ma rnam par gzhag pa la la ni dngos gzhi dag kho na bzung ste /
analyzed: sa snga ma rnam par gzhag pa la la ni dngos gzhi dag kho na bzung ste /
translated: In the presentation of the former stages, only the actual bases are taken.

original: bsam gtan khyad par can ni dngos gzhi'i bsam gtan dang po'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan khyad par can ni dngos gzhi'i bsam gtan dang po'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the special meditative stabilization is a special meditative stabilization of the first actual meditative stabilization.

original: sa bcu pa rnam par gzhag pa la ni mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa 'dod pa'i khams kyang yin par 'dod la /
analyzed: sa bcu pa rnam par gzhag pa la ni mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa 'dod pa'i khams kyang yin par 'dod la /
translated: In the presentation of the ten stages, the desire realm, which is not meditative equipoise, is also asserted.

original: sbyor bar gyur pa nyer bsngogs rnams kyang yin par bzung na dngos gzhi dag lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: sbyor bar gyur pa nyer bsngogs rnams kyang yin par bzung na dngos gzhi dag lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: If the preparatory states, which are the approach to meditative equipoise, are taken, then what need is there to mention the actual bases?🔽Because they are the level of the actual bases of the meditative stabilizations.

original: bsam gtan dngos gzhi'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dngos gzhi ni bsam gtan dag pa pa'i sa pa yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dngos gzhi'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dngos gzhi ni bsam gtan dag pa pa'i sa pa yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The actual bases are the level of the pure meditative stabilizations.

original: @305b bsam gtan dag pa pa ngag gis ni nyon mongs pa mi spong ngo zhes sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: @305b bsam gtan dag pa pa ngag gis ni nyon mongs pa mi spong ngo zhes sngar bshad zin to //
translated: It has already been explained that the pure meditative stabilizations do not abandon afflictions.

original: mos pa yid la byed pa'i phyir de dag gi nyon mongs pa rnams mi spong ste /
analyzed: mos pa yid la byed pa'i phyir de dag gi nyon mongs pa rnams mi spong ste /
translated: They do not abandon the afflictions by keeping interest in mind.

original: de kho na nyid yid la byed pas ni nyon mongs pa spang na /
analyzed: de kho na nyid yid la byed pas ni nyon mongs pa spang na /
translated: If one abandons the afflictions by keeping reality in mind,

original: sems can la dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir de dag gis mi spong ste /
analyzed: sems can la dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir de dag gis mi spong ste /
translated: they do not abandon them by keeping sentient beings in mind.

original: chos kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid yid la byed pas nyon mongs pa spong ngo zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid yid la byed pas nyon mongs pa spong ngo zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' yin no //
translated: The philosophical tenet is that one abandons the afflictions by keeping the general characteristics of phenomena in mind.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de dag gi sbyor bas zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de dag gi sbyor bas zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: They are antidotes to the afflictions,

original: byams pa la sogs pa'i sbyor bas gnod sems la sogs pa rnam par gnon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa'i sbyor bas gnod sems la sogs pa rnam par gnon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the practice of love, etc., suppresses malice, etc.

original: de dag gi gnyen po nyid du bshad do zhes bya ba ni gnod sems la sogs pa'i gnyen po nyid du bshad de /
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen po nyid du bshad do zhes bya ba ni gnod sems la sogs pa'i gnyen po nyid du bshad de /
translated: They are explained as antidotes to malice, etc.

original: de dag ni rnam par gnon pa'i spong ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag ni rnam par gnon pa'i spong ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are the abandonment of suppression.🔽They are the abandonment of distancing,

original: spangs pa thag sring bar byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: spangs pa thag sring bar byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: because they distance the body from affliction.

original: 'di ltar bar chad med pa'i lam 'jig rten pa'am 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gnod sems la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa rnams de dag gis thag sring bar byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar bar chad med pa'i lam 'jig rten pa'am 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gnod sems la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa rnams de dag gis thag sring bar byed de /
translated: Thus, the uninterrupted paths that abandon the afflictions and branch afflictions such as malice, whether mundane or transcendent, distance one from those objects to be abandoned.

original: de'i phyir de dag gi gnyen po nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi gnyen po nyid du bshad do //
translated: Therefore they are explained as antidotes to those objects to be abandoned.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: ston par byed de /
analyzed: ston par byed de /
translated: They teach

original: byams pa la sogs pa gsum po dag 'dod pa'i khams kyi sa pa dang mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa pa rnams ni dngos gzhi'i tshad med pa dang 'dra ba dag yod do //
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa gsum po dag 'dod pa'i khams kyi sa pa dang mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa pa rnams ni dngos gzhi'i tshad med pa dang 'dra ba dag yod do //
translated: that the three beginning with love that exist on the level of the desire realm and the level of unrestricted access concentration are similar to the immeasurables of the actual basis.

original: sbyor ba dang dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang ngo bo nyid 'dra ba'i phyir dngos gzhi dag dang 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang ngo bo nyid 'dra ba'i phyir dngos gzhi dag dang 'dra ba yin no //
translated: They are similar to the actual basis because they are similar in preparation, focal object, aspect and nature.

original: tshad med pa gsum po de dag gis nyon mongs pa de rnams rnam par mnan nas spong ba'i lam bar chad med pa'i lam rnams kyis rab tu spong bar byed do //
analyzed: tshad med pa gsum po de dag gis nyon mongs pa de rnams rnam par mnan nas spong ba'i lam bar chad med pa'i lam rnams kyis rab tu spong bar byed do //
translated: Those three immeasurables suppress those afflictions and the uninterrupted paths that are the paths of abandoning completely abandon them.

original: rkyen stobs dang ldan pa rnyed kyang zhes bya ba ni gnod sems la sogs pa'i rkyen stobs dang ldan pa rnyed du zin kyang nyon mongs pa de dag gis mngon du 'gyur ba'i sgo nas mi brdzi ba yin no //
analyzed: rkyen stobs dang ldan pa rnyed kyang zhes bya ba ni gnod sems la sogs pa'i rkyen stobs dang ldan pa rnyed du zin kyang nyon mongs pa de dag gis mngon du 'gyur ba'i sgo nas mi brdzi ba yin no //
translated: Even when they find powerful conditions, they are not overcome by the manifest activity of those afflictions, even when they find powerful conditions such as malice.

original: chen po la zhes bya ba ni mdza' bo'i phyogs la ste /
analyzed: chen po la zhes bya ba ni mdza' bo'i phyogs la ste /
translated: In the case of the great, in the case of friends,

original: mdza' bo'i phyogs la ni byams par bya sla bas so //
analyzed: mdza' bo'i phyogs la ni byams par bya sla bas so //
translated: it is easy to be friendly toward friends.

original: rgyas par byed do zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed do //
analyzed: rgyas par byed do zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed do //
translated: It expands, it pervades.🔽Through the appearance of the results of former merit and demerit,

original: sngon gyi bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa'i 'bras bu snang ba'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni sngon bsod nams kyi 'bras bu snang ba'i sgo nas gang zag dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa la yang 'dis ni gang gis na 'di'i gzugs la sogs
analyzed: sngon gyi bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa'i 'bras bu snang ba'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni sngon bsod nams kyi 'bras bu snang ba'i sgo nas gang zag dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa la yang 'dis ni gang gis na 'di'i gzugs la sogs
translated: through the appearance of the results of former merit, one can grasp the virtues of a person whose wholesome roots have been severed, by which his form, etc.

original: pa phun sum tshogs par gyur pa'i @306a * //
analyzed: pa phun sum tshogs par gyur pa'i @306a * //
translated: became perfect.

original: bsod nams zhig byas par gyur to zhes yon tan gzung bar nus la /
analyzed: bsod nams zhig byas par gyur to zhes yon tan gzung bar nus la /
translated: “He must have done some meritorious action.”

original: rang sangs rgyas la yang 'dis ni gang gis na 'di la 'di lta bu'i gzugs la sogs pa med pa'i bsod nams ma yin pa zhig gdon mi za bar byas par gyur to zhes skyon gzung bar nus so //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas la yang 'dis ni gang gis na 'di la 'di lta bu'i gzugs la sogs pa med pa'i bsod nams ma yin pa zhig gdon mi za bar byas par gyur to zhes skyon gzung bar nus so //
translated: One can also reproach a pratyekabuddha in the same way: “You have certainly committed a great sin, since you have no such form, etc.”

original: sdug bsngal las thar kyang ci ma rung snyam du mos shing snying rje la sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal las thar kyang ci ma rung snyam du mos shing snying rje la sbyor bar byed do //
translated: One applies compassion to the thought: “How could they be liberated from suffering?”

original: mngon par dga' bar gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam du mos shing dga' ba la sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: mngon par dga' bar gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam du mos shing dga' ba la sbyor bar byed do //
translated: One applies joy to the thought: “How could they be filled with joy?”

original: dga' ba dang mi ldan no zhes bya ba ni gsum pa dang bzhi pa dag na yid bde ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' ba dang mi ldan no zhes bya ba ni gsum pa dang bzhi pa dag na yid bde ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not filled with joy, because there is no mental satisfaction in the third and fourth absorptions.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad ces bya ba ni mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad ces bya ba ni mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: The eight liberations are as they are described in the sutras.

original: ji skad du zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad du zhe na /
translated: What is said in the sutras?

original: rnam par thar pa ni rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa ni rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: The eight liberations are:

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight?

original: gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
analyzed: gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
translated: The first liberation is the internal perception of form and the external seeing of form.

original: nad gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: nad gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second liberation is the perception of the absence of form, and the seeing of external forms.

original: sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas te rdzogs par byas nas gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa gsum pa'o //🔽rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das nas thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam ste /
analyzed: sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas te rdzogs par byas nas gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa gsum pa'o // rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das nas thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam ste /
translated: The third liberation is the perception of beauty, and the attainment of the state of beauty.🔽The fourth liberation is the complete transcendence of perceptions of form, the disappearance of perceptions of obstruction, and not paying attention to perceptions of diversity, thinking, “Space is infinite.”

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byed de gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byed de gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa bzhi pa ste /

analyzed: 'di lta ste nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i lha rnams lta bu'o //
translated: This is like the gods who have gone to the sphere of infinite space.

original: gzhan yang rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so snyam nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa lnga pa ste /

analyzed: 'di lta ste rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i lha rnams lta bu'o //

analyzed: gzhan yang rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
