original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dngos gzhi dag lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dngos gzhi dag lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word also indicates that it goes without saying that the actual bases obtain the name liberation.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam rnams ni ma yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang gi phyir sa 'og ma pa la rgyab kyis phyogs par rnam par thar pa dag ces bya ba de'i phyir bar chad med pa'i lam rnams ni 'og ma la dmigs
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam rnams ni ma yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang gi phyir sa 'og ma pa la rgyab kyis phyogs par rnam par thar pa dag ces bya ba de'i phyir bar chad med pa'i lam rnams ni 'og ma la dmigs
translated: The uninterrupted paths are not called liberation because they are averse to lower levels.

original: pas rnam par thar pa zhes bya ba'i ming mi 'thob kyi rnam par grol ba'i lam dag ni gong ma la dmigs pa'i phyir ming 'thob bo //
analyzed: pas rnam par thar pa zhes bya ba'i ming mi 'thob kyi rnam par grol ba'i lam dag ni gong ma la dmigs pa'i phyir ming 'thob bo //
translated: Since the uninterrupted paths focus on lower levels, they do not obtain the name liberation, but the liberated paths obtain that name because they focus on higher levels.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa'o zhes bya ba'i tshig lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa'o zhes bya ba'i tshig lhag ma yin no //
translated: The phrase “the meditative attainment of cessation is the eighth” is a remainder.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'du shes la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir dang tshor ba la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir rnam par thar pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'du shes la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir dang tshor ba la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir rnam par thar pa'o //
translated: Liberation is so called because it is averse to discernment and feeling.

original: yang na 'du shes thams cad la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir rnam par thar pa'o //
analyzed: yang na 'du shes thams cad la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir rnam par thar pa'o //
translated: Or it is called liberation because it is averse to all discernment.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par thar pa'i phyir rnam par thar pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par thar pa'i phyir rnam par thar pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are called liberations because they liberate from the obscurations to meditative attainment.

original: de la snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa ni sgrib pa gang zhig yod na sems las su mi rung bas khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba dag gis kyang bsam gtan dang po'i dngos gzhi yang skyed par mi byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de la snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa ni sgrib pa gang zhig yod na sems las su mi rung bas khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba dag gis kyang bsam gtan dang po'i dngos gzhi yang skyed par mi byed pa yin no //
translated: The obscurations to meditative attainment are those obscurations such that even those who are free from attachment to the three realms do not generate the actual basis of the first absorption due to the unserviceability of the mind.

original: ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni gnyis kyi dmigs pa ni rnam par bsdos pa la sogs pa'i gzugs yid du mi 'ong ba 'o //
analyzed: ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni gnyis kyi dmigs pa ni rnam par bsdos pa la sogs pa'i gzugs yid du mi 'ong ba 'o //
translated: The focal object of the first two is an unpleasant form, such as a bloated corpse.

original: gsum pa'i dmigs pa ni yid du mi 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: gsum pa'i dmigs pa ni yid du mi 'ong ba'o //
translated: The focal object of the third is unpleasant.

original: de'i rgyu dang 'gog pa dag ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal de'i kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dag go //
analyzed: de'i rgyu dang 'gog pa dag ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal de'i kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dag go //
translated: The cause and cessation of that is the origin and cessation of that suffering.

original: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam thams cad ces bya ba ni gong ma dang / 'og ma dang / rang gi sa pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam thams cad ces bya ba ni gong ma dang / 'og ma dang / rang gi sa pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: All paths that are compatible with subsequent knowledge are called higher, lower, and the same level.🔽The state of nondiscernment is also an object field of the formless emancipations.🔽The formless emancipations focus on the formless realm.

original: so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa yang gzugs med pa'i rnam par thar pa rnams kyi dmigs pa yin no zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa yang gzugs med pa'i rnam par thar pa rnams kyi dmigs pa yin no zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: The formless emancipations focus on the formless realm because it is said:

original: gang dag gzugs can min de dag / spyod yul gang dang rang gi sa'i //
analyzed: gang dag gzugs can min de dag / spyod yul gang dang rang gi sa'i //
translated: Those that are formless focus on their own level,

original: sdug bsngal @307b sogs dang rjes shes phyogs //
analyzed: sdug bsngal @307b sogs dang rjes shes phyogs //
translated: the realms of suffering and so on and the aspect of subsequent knowledge.

original: zhes bya ba 'dir ma smos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dir ma smos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not mentioned in the root text.

original: smras pa so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa gang zhig de dag gis dmigs pa yin zhe na /🔽'dir smras pa /
analyzed: smras pa so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa gang zhig de dag gis dmigs pa yin zhe na / 'dir smras pa /
translated: What is the nondiscernment that is the object field of the formless emancipations?

original: mi slob pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa la dmigs te /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa la dmigs te /
translated: The formless emancipations focus on the nondiscernment of nonlearners.

original: gzugs med pa'i rnam par thar pa de dag ni mtshan ma med pa mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa srid pas so //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i rnam par thar pa de dag ni mtshan ma med pa mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa srid pas so //
translated: These formless emancipations are essentially the signless concentration of the signless, because it is possible that they are.

original: de dag kyang nyer bsdogs bdun ma gtogs pas gzhan bcu gcig po 'dod pa'i khams dang / mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang / bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa dag ni brgyad na yod do //
analyzed: de dag kyang nyer bsdogs bdun ma gtogs pas gzhan bcu gcig po 'dod pa'i khams dang / mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang / bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa dag ni brgyad na yod do //
translated: They exist in eleven stages, excluding the seven access concentrations, in the desire realm, the unrestricted access concentration, the special meditative stabilization, and the eight meditative stabilizations of the formless realm.

original: bstan bcos ni kha bskang ba dang bcas pa yin pas bstan bcos kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bstan bcos ni kha bskang ba dang bcas pa yin pas bstan bcos kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: The treatise is complete with its supplement, and so the characteristics of the treatise have been explained.

original: nam mkha' yang gcig yin no zhes bya bar brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' yang gcig yin no zhes bya bar brjod par bya ste /
translated: Space is one.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: It is the object of the base of infinite space.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa'i kha dog gi 'dod chags med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni spang bar bya ba bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa'i kha dog gi 'dod chags med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa'i kha dog gi 'dod chags med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni spang bar bya ba bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa'i kha dog gi 'dod chags med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: because there is no attachment to color belonging to the level of the second absorption that is to be abandoned.

original: de med pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That does not exist because there is no eye consciousness.

original: bde ba'i snying pos bskyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bde ba'i snying pos bskyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is generated by the essence of pleasure.

original: bde ba'i snying po ni bde ba thams cad kyi gong na 'dug pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bde ba'i snying po ni bde ba thams cad kyi gong na 'dug pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The essence of pleasure is the highest of all pleasures.

original: des bskyed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: des bskyed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is generated by that.

original: g-yo bar byas pa'i phyir bsam gtan gsum pa la rnam par thar pa rnam par mi gzhag go //
analyzed: g-yo bar byas pa'i phyir bsam gtan gsum pa la rnam par thar pa rnam par mi gzhag go //
translated: The third liberation is not posited in the third absorption because it is agitated.

original: gal te bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa'i kha dog gi 'dod chags med na /
analyzed: gal te bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa'i kha dog gi 'dod chags med na /
translated: If there is no attachment to color belonging to the level of the third absorption,🔽why does it generate the liberation of beauty?

original: ci'i phyir sdug ba'i rnam par thar pa skyed par byed ce na de'i phyir mi sdug pas rgyud zhum bar rab tu dga' bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sdug ba'i rnam par thar pa skyed par byed ce na de'i phyir mi sdug pas rgyud zhum bar rab tu dga' bar bya ba'am /
translated: In order to generate joy in the continuum that has been weakened by repulsiveness.

original: rtag pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rtag pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Because they are permanent.

original: rnam par thar pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The liberations, etc.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched la sogs pa nye bar bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched la sogs pa nye bar bsdu'o //
translated: The term “etc.” includes the spheres of mastery, etc.

original: 'phags pa'i rdzu 'phrul ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i rdzu 'phrul ci zhe na /
translated: What is the noble one’s supernatural power?

original: mngon par bsgrub pa'i ched du zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //🔽nyon mongs pa thag bsring ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par thar pa la sogs pa thag bsring ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽snyoms par 'jug pa la dbang bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa la dbang ba nyid de yang nyon mongs pa med pa la sogs @308a * //
analyzed: mngon par bsgrub pa'i ched du zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro // nyon mongs pa thag bsring ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par thar pa la sogs pa thag bsring ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro // snyoms par 'jug pa la dbang bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa la dbang ba nyid de yang nyon mongs pa med pa la sogs @308a * //
translated: The context is that it is for the sake of the accomplishment of the supernatural powers.🔽For the sake of distancing the passions means that the liberations, etc. are the counteragents that distance the passions.

original: pa'i yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa'i ched yin no //
analyzed: pa'i yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa'i ched yin no //
translated: For the sake of mastery in meditative concentration means that mastery in meditative concentration is for the sake of accomplishing the qualities such as the absence of passions, etc.

original: de yang gang gis dngos po yongs su bsgyur ba dang byin gyis rlob pa dang tshe gtong ba la sogs pa byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni de la dngos po yongs su bsgyur ba ni dngos po gang zhig la ji ltar mos pa de kho na bzhin du🔽der 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de yang gang gis dngos po yongs su bsgyur ba dang byin gyis rlob pa dang tshe gtong ba la sogs pa byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni de la dngos po yongs su bsgyur ba ni dngos po gang zhig la ji ltar mos pa de kho na bzhin du der 'gyur ba ste /
translated: With regard to that, transforming things is that by which whatever thing one aspires to becomes just that.

original: ji ltar gser la sar bya ba de ltar mos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar gser la sar bya ba de ltar mos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, it is like transforming earth into gold because of aspiration.

original: byin gyis rlob pa ni dngos po bstan pa la dus 'di srid du gnas par gyur cig snyam pa ste /
analyzed: byin gyis rlob pa ni dngos po bstan pa la dus 'di srid du gnas par gyur cig snyam pa ste /
translated: Blessing is the thought that a thing that has been revealed will remain for a certain period of time.

original: tshe gtong ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: tshe gtong ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Extending life is similar to that.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ri rab rdul phra rab kyi nang du 'dzud pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ri rab rdul phra rab kyi nang du 'dzud pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa ste /
translated: The term “and so on” indicates that one can place Mount Meru inside a particle of dust and so on.

original: gzhan yang mdo sde las blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang mdo sde las blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should view other such powers in the sutras.

original: ci'i phyir gsum pa dang brgyad pa dag kho na mngon sum du bya bar bshad la gzhan dag ni ma yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gsum pa dang brgyad pa dag kho na mngon sum du bya bar bshad la gzhan dag ni ma yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: Why are only the third and eighth explained as being directly perceived and not the others?

original: ji ltar gsum pa mngon sum du bya bar bshad ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar gsum pa mngon sum du bya bar bshad ce na /
translated: The third is said to be actualized because it is said:

original: sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas nas rdzogs par byas te gnas pa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas nas rdzogs par byas te gnas pa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: One who has actualized the liberation of beauty with his body, having completed it, dwells in it.🔽The eighth is said to be actualized because it is said:

original: brgyad pa yang 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas nas rdzogs par byas te gnas pa zhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: brgyad pa yang 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas nas rdzogs par byas te gnas pa zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: One who has actualized the cessation of ideation and sensation with his body, having completed it, dwells in it.

original: de la mngon sum du byas nas zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du byas te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la mngon sum du byas nas zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du byas te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Here, actualized means actualized.🔽Having completed it, dwelling means having entered meditative equipoise on those meditative stabilizations, dwelling.

original: rdzogs par byas te gnas pa zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de dag la snyoms par zhugs te gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to zhe na 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: rdzogs par byas te gnas pa zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de dag la snyoms par zhugs te gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to zhe na 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: rnam par thar pa dang po dang gnyis pa bas rnam par thar pa gsum pa gnas gyur pa'i sgo nas gzugs can gyi rnam par thar pa'i sgrib pa mtha' dag spangs pas gtso bo yin pa'i phyir gsum pa mngon sum du bya bar bshad do //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa dang po dang gnyis pa bas rnam par thar pa gsum pa gnas gyur pa'i sgo nas gzugs can gyi rnam par thar pa'i sgrib pa mtha' dag spangs pas gtso bo yin pa'i phyir gsum pa mngon sum du bya bar bshad do //
translated: The third liberation is explained as being directly realized because it is the most important, since it abandons all the obscurations to the liberation of form by way of transforming the first and second liberations.

original: de bzhin du brgyad pa yang gnas gyur pa'i sgo nas gzugs med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgrib pa mtha' dag spangs pa'i phyir gtso bo yin pas mngon du bya bar bshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du brgyad pa yang gnas gyur pa'i sgo nas gzugs med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgrib pa mtha' dag spangs pa'i phyir gtso bo yin pas mngon du bya bar bshad do //
translated: Similarly, the eighth liberation is explained as being directly realized because it is the most important, since it abandons all the obscurations to the formless liberations by way of transforming the formless states.

original: khams dang sa'i mtha' na gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa ni gzugs kyi khams dang sa'i mtha' na gnas pa yin la srid pa'i rtse mo yang gzugs med pa'i khams dang sa'i mtha' na gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: khams dang sa'i mtha' na gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa ni gzugs kyi khams dang sa'i mtha' na gnas pa yin la srid pa'i rtse mo yang gzugs med pa'i khams dang sa'i mtha' na gnas pa yin no //
translated: Because they are located at the end of the realms and levels. The fourth absorption is located at the end of the form realm and levels. The summit of existence is located at the end of the formless realm and levels.

original: de bzhin du chen po rnams dang zhes bya ba ni nang gzugs su 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chen po kha dog bzang po dang kha dog ngan pa rnams la lta zhing zhes bya ba nas rgyas par 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched gnyis🔽pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chen po rnams dang zhes bya ba ni nang gzugs su 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chen po kha dog bzang po dang kha dog ngan pa rnams la lta zhing zhes bya ba nas rgyas par 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched gnyis pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar 'byung ba'o //
translated: Those who possess internal form perceive external form that is great, beautiful color and ugly color.

original: de kho na bzhin @308b du nang gzugs med par 'du shes pa zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de kho na bzhin @308b du nang gzugs med par 'du shes pa zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it that “those who possess internal formlessness perceive external form that is small, beautiful color and ugly color”?🔽It is like the third base of subjugation, which is stated in the sūtras:

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chung ngu kha dog bzang po dang kha dog ngan pa rnams zhes bya ba nas 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched gsum pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chung ngu kha dog bzang po dang kha dog ngan pa rnams zhes bya ba nas 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched gsum pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Those who possess internal formlessness perceive external form that is small, beautiful color and ugly color.

original: de bzhin du nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chen po kha dog bzang po dang kha dog ngan pa rnams la lta zhing zhes bya ba nas 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched bzhi pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar snga ma bzhin te
analyzed: de bzhin du nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chen po kha dog bzang po dang kha dog ngan pa rnams la lta zhing zhes bya ba nas 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched bzhi pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar snga ma bzhin te
translated: So too, with the perception of internal non-form, one sees external forms that are large, beautiful, ugly, and so on, up to the fourth base of subjugation.

original: / de ltar bzhi po de dag dang / gzugs med par 'du shes pa kho na sngon po dang ser po dang dmar po dang dkar po rnams la lta ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: / de ltar bzhi po de dag dang / gzugs med par 'du shes pa kho na sngon po dang ser po dang dmar po dang dkar po rnams la lta ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: So too, with the perception of internal non-form, one sees external forms that are blue, yellow, red and white.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs sngon po kha dog sngon po sngon po lta bur ston pa /🔽'od sngon po 'byung ba dper na zar ma'i me tog gam /
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs sngon po kha dog sngon po sngon po lta bur ston pa / 'od sngon po 'byung ba dper na zar ma'i me tog gam /
translated: With the perception of internal non-form, one sees external forms that are blue, the color of blue, that manifest as blue,

original: yul b'a r'a na s'i'i ras phun sum tshogs pa sngon po kha dog sngon po sngon po lta bur ston pa /
analyzed: yul b'a r'a na s'i'i ras phun sum tshogs pa sngon po kha dog sngon po sngon po lta bur ston pa /
translated: like the color of flax flowers or excellent Bārāṇasī cloth that is blue, the color of blue, that manifests as blue.

original: 'od sngon po 'byung ba lta bu rnams la lta zhing gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan nas shes zil gyis mnan nas mthong ste /
analyzed: 'od sngon po 'byung ba lta bu rnams la lta zhing gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan nas shes zil gyis mnan nas mthong ste /
translated: One sees blue light and so on, and having overcome those forms, one sees them having overcome them.

original: de lta bur 'du shes par gyur pa 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched lnga pa'o //🔽nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs ser po kha dog ser po ser po lta bur ston pa 'od ser po 'byung ba dper na dong ka'i me tog gam /
analyzed: de lta bur 'du shes par gyur pa 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched lnga pa'o // nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs ser po kha dog ser po ser po lta bur ston pa 'od ser po 'byung ba dper na dong ka'i me tog gam /
translated: This is the fifth base of subjugation.🔽With the perception of no internal form, one sees external forms that are yellow, the color of yellow, the luster of yellow, the glow of yellow, for example, the flower or cloth from Vārāṇasī is yellow, the color of yellow, the luster of yellow, the glow of yellow.

original: yul b'a r'a na s'i'i ras phun sum tshogs pa ser po kha dog ser po ser po lta bur ston pa 'od ser po 'byung ba lta bu rnams la lta zhing zhes bya ba nas rgyas par 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched drug pa'o zhes bya

translated: By the power of the cause, it is from the proximity of the object and from repeated practice.

original: ji lta zhe na /🔽'ga' zhig gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la mnyam par bzhag nas de las yongs su nyams te rjes kho na la gzugs kyi @310b khams su skye na gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir🔽de la gzugs kyi khams su gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa skye'o //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / 'ga' zhig gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la mnyam par bzhag nas de las yongs su nyams te rjes kho na la gzugs kyi @310b khams su skye na gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir de la gzugs kyi khams su gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa skye'o //
translated: How is that?🔽When someone, having entered the formless meditative attainment, falls away from it and is reborn in the form realm, the formless meditative attainment arises in the form realm because the homogeneous cause of the formless meditative attainment is powerful.

original: yang dang yang du goms pa las kyang 'ga' zhig gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la yang dang yang du mnyam par bzhag nas de las yongs su nyams te /
analyzed: yang dang yang du goms pa las kyang 'ga' zhig gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la yang dang yang du mnyam par bzhag nas de las yongs su nyams te /
translated: From repeated practice, when someone repeatedly enters the formless meditative attainment and falls away from it, the formless meditative attainment arises in the form realm because the homogeneous cause is powerful.

original: gzugs kyi khams su skye na de'i gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir gzugs kyi khams su gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa skye'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su skye na de'i gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir gzugs kyi khams su gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa skye'o //
translated: If one is born in the form realm, formless meditative attainment arises in the form realm because the powerful homogeneous cause of the formless meditative attainment of the form realm is strong.

original: de bzhin du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yongs su nyams te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yongs su nyams te /
translated: Similarly, if one degenerates from the base of infinite consciousness,

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched du skyes pa la yang de kho na bzhin du de'i snyoms par 'jug pa skye ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched du skyes pa la yang de kho na bzhin du de'i snyoms par 'jug pa skye ste /
translated: the meditative attainment of the base of infinite space arises in the same way in one born in the base of infinite space.

original: de'i gong du skyes pa la yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de'i gong du skyes pa la yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same applies to one born in a higher level.

original: las kyi stobs kyis ni gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa la lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa nye bar gnas pa'i phyir de las 'dod chags dang bral ba dang mthun pa'i rgyud gnas te /
analyzed: las kyi stobs kyis ni gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa la lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa nye bar gnas pa'i phyir de las 'dod chags dang bral ba dang mthun pa'i rgyud gnas te /
translated: By the power of karma, the continuum of one born in the form realm who possesses the karmic maturation of karma to be experienced in other lives abides in a state compatible with freedom from attachment to that level.

original: 'og ma las 'dod chags dang ma bral bas ni gong ma gzugs med pa'i khams su skye bar mi nus so //🔽de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams su yang nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched du skyes pa la las kyi stobs kyis ni sa gong ma pa rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyis pa'i las lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i rnam par smin pa nye bar
analyzed: 'og ma las 'dod chags dang ma bral bas ni gong ma gzugs med pa'i khams su skye bar mi nus so // de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams su yang nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched du skyes pa la las kyi stobs kyis ni sa gong ma pa rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyis pa'i las lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i rnam par smin pa nye bar
translated: Those not free from attachment to lower levels are unable to be born in the higher formless realm.

original: gnas pa'i phyir de las 'dod chags dang bral ba dang mthun pa'i rgyud gnas te /
analyzed: gnas pa'i phyir de las 'dod chags dang bral ba dang mthun pa'i rgyud gnas te /
translated: Similarly, those born in the base of infinite space of the formless realm are able to abide in a continuum compatible with freedom from attachment to that level due to the power of karma, since karma to be experienced in other lives of the higher level, the base of infinite consciousness, is ripening.

original: 'og ma las 'dod chags dang bral bas ni gong du skye bar mi nus so //🔽rgyu dang las kyi stobs de dag gi bsam gtan dang po la sogs par /
analyzed: 'og ma las 'dod chags dang bral bas ni gong du skye bar mi nus so // rgyu dang las kyi stobs de dag gi bsam gtan dang po la sogs par /
translated: Those free from attachment to lower levels are unable to be born in higher levels.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa ji ltar skye zhe na /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa ji ltar skye zhe na /
translated: How are the second absorption and so on generated in the first absorption and so on through the power of cause and karma?

original: rgyu'i stobs kyis ni nye ba dang yang dang yang du goms pa las so //
analyzed: rgyu'i stobs kyis ni nye ba dang yang dang yang du goms pa las so //
translated: Through the power of cause, they are generated through proximity and through repeated cultivation.

original: lam gyi stobs kyis ni sa gong ma'i zhes bya ba rgyas par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: lam gyi stobs kyis ni sa gong ma'i zhes bya ba rgyas par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The power of the path is the arising of the meditative attainment of a lower level from the power of the path of a higher level.🔽The power of reality is the arising of the meditative attainment of a lower level from the power of reality.

original: chos nyid kyis kyang zhes bya ba la chos nyid ces bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
analyzed: chos nyid kyis kyang zhes bya ba la chos nyid ces bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
translated: What is the power of reality?

original: mdo sde pa kha cig na re chos 'jug pa shas chen po 'di dag nyid sngon gyi bsam gtan gyi bag chags kyi dbang gis de skyes pa'i lung med par bsam gtan skye ba dang mthun pa ni chos nyid de /
analyzed: mdo sde pa kha cig na re chos 'jug pa shas chen po 'di dag nyid sngon gyi bsam gtan gyi bag chags kyi dbang gis de skyes pa'i lung med par bsam gtan skye ba dang mthun pa ni chos nyid de /
translated: Some Sautrāntikas say: The power of reality is the arising of meditative attainment in accordance with the generation of meditative attainment due to the power of the latent tendencies of prior concentration, without the generation of this great engagement of Dharma.

original: rang bzhin dang ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes zer ro //🔽bye brag tu @311a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes zer ro // bye brag tu @311a * //
translated: This is synonymous with nature and essence.

original: smra ba kha cig na re yang /
analyzed: smra ba kha cig na re yang /
translated: Some Vaibhasikas say:

original: gzhan las de'i lung ma mnos par tshe rabs snga ma'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu las rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu bsam gtan skye ba ni chos nyid yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan las de'i lung ma mnos par tshe rabs snga ma'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu las rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu bsam gtan skye ba ni chos nyid yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The power of reality is the arising of the result of natural outflow of concentration from the cause of homogeneous cause in a former life, without being instructed by another.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams kyi 'jug pa shas che ba nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i dus de na dge ba'i las kyi lam rnams kyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams kyi 'jug pa shas che ba nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i dus de na dge ba'i las kyi lam rnams kyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: This means that at that time of destruction, the virtuous karmic paths are predominant.

original: 'jug pa ni chos de dag nyid kyi byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni chos de dag nyid kyi byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Engagement is the activity of those phenomena.

original: 'di dag la 'jug pa shas che zhing mchog tu gyur pa yod pas na 'jug pa shas che ba dag go //
analyzed: 'di dag la 'jug pa shas che zhing mchog tu gyur pa yod pas na 'jug pa shas che ba dag go //
translated: Since engagement is predominant and supreme in these, they are predominant engagement.

original: de'i ngo bo ni nyid de de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni nyid de de'i phyir ro //
translated: That is its nature, and that is why.

original: 'di skad du dge ba de dag bdag nyid mchog tu gyur pa thob pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di skad du dge ba de dag bdag nyid mchog tu gyur pa thob pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is what is meant: because those virtues obtain a supreme nature.

original: de skye ba dang mthun pa'i bdag nyid du red pa'i phyir gzhan las lung mnos pa med par sngon gyi bsam gtan gyi bag chags yod na bsam gtan skye'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de skye ba dang mthun pa'i bdag nyid du red pa'i phyir gzhan las lung mnos pa med par sngon gyi bsam gtan gyi bag chags yod na bsam gtan skye'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Since they are purified in a nature that accords with their arising, concentration arises when there is the latent tendency for prior concentration, without the need for instruction from another.

original: chos rnams kyi rnam pa 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyi rnam pa khams dang sa dang / dmigs pa dang rnam pa la sogs pa ste ci rigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rnam pa 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyi rnam pa khams dang sa dang / dmigs pa dang rnam pa la sogs pa ste ci rigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The aspects of phenomena are called the aspects of contaminated and uncontaminated phenomena, such as the realms, stages, objects, and aspects, as appropriate.

original: de 'dzin byed pa smra byed dang // sgrub par byed pa kho na yin //
analyzed: de 'dzin byed pa smra byed dang // sgrub par byed pa kho na yin //
translated: They are the holders, the expounders, and the practitioners.

original: zhes bya ba ni lung dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi dam pa'i chos de ste grangs bzhin du lung ni smra bar byed pa gang dag yin pa de dag de 'dzin par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lung dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi dam pa'i chos de ste grangs bzhin du lung ni smra bar byed pa gang dag yin pa de dag de 'dzin par byed pa yin la /
translated: The holy Dharma, which is of the nature of scripture and realization, is held by those who expound the scriptures, respectively.

original: rtogs pa ni sgrub par byed pa gang dag yin pa de dag 'dzin par byed pa yin no //🔽rtogs pa ni de lta bu yin gyi zhes bya ba ni lo stong du gnas so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni sgrub par byed pa gang dag yin pa de dag 'dzin par byed pa yin no // rtogs pa ni de lta bu yin gyi zhes bya ba ni lo stong du gnas so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is held by those who practice the realization.🔽Realization lasts for that long,🔽that is, for a thousand years.

original: lung ni yun ring du gnas so zhes bya ba ni lo stong gi 'og tu yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: lung ni yun ring du gnas so zhes bya ba ni lo stong gi 'og tu yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The scriptures last for a long time, that is, after the thousand years.

original: phyogs 'di dag nyid rigs par lta'o //
analyzed: phyogs 'di dag nyid rigs par lta'o //
translated: We should consider these points to be reasonable.

original: gang yin pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ci chos mngon pa'i mdzod kyi mtshan nyid 'di las chos mngon pa bshad pa gang yin pa 'di nyid ston pas chos mngon ba ye shes la 'jug pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du bshad dam zhe na
analyzed: gang yin pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ci chos mngon pa'i mdzod kyi mtshan nyid 'di las chos mngon pa bshad pa gang yin pa 'di nyid ston pas chos mngon ba ye shes la 'jug pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du bshad dam zhe na
translated: The Abhidharma taught in this Abhidharmakośa is the same as that taught by the Teacher in the Abhidharma of cognition entry and so on.

original: / de'i phyir /
analyzed: / de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore this is said:

original: bdag gi mngon pa'i chos 'di phal cher ni /
analyzed: bdag gi mngon pa'i chos 'di phal cher ni /
translated: This Abhidharma of mine is for the most part

original: kha che bye brag smra ba'i tshul grub bshad //
analyzed: kha che bye brag smra ba'i tshul grub bshad //
translated: an explanation of the established system of the Kashmiri Vaibhasikas.

original: ces bya ba 'di rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba 'di rgyas par smos te /
translated: This is said in detail.

original: kha che'i yul na 'khod pas na kha che'o //
analyzed: kha che'i yul na 'khod pas na kha che'o //
translated: They are called Kashmiri because they reside in the land of Kashmir.

original: bye brag tu bshad pas rtsen pas na bye brag tu smra ba'o zhes de ni rnam par bshad zin to //
analyzed: bye brag tu bshad pas rtsen pas na bye brag tu smra ba'o zhes de ni rnam par bshad zin to //
translated: They are called Vaibhasikas because they play with the Vibhasa.

original: kha che yin la bye brag tu smra ba ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: kha che yin la bye brag tu smra ba ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There are those who are Kashmiri but not Vaibhasikas.

original: 'dul ba shes pa la sogs @311b pa dang / mdo sde pa btsun pa la sogs pa gang dag yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba shes pa la sogs @311b pa dang / mdo sde pa btsun pa la sogs pa gang dag yin pa'o //
translated: They are those who know the Vinaya and so on and the Bhadanta Sautrantikas and so on.

original: bye brag tu smra ba yin la kha che ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba yin la kha che ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There are Vaibhāṣikas who are not Kāśmīris.

original: nyi 'og pa'i bye brag tu smra ba gang dag yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyi 'og pa'i bye brag tu smra ba gang dag yin pa'o //
translated: They are the Aparāntaka Vaibhāṣikas.

original: de bas na khyad par gnyi ga smos te /
analyzed: de bas na khyad par gnyi ga smos te /
translated: Therefore both are specified.

original: bdag gis ni 'dir de dag gi lugs kyi grub pa'i chos mngon ba gang yin pa de phal cher bshad do //
analyzed: bdag gis ni 'dir de dag gi lugs kyi grub pa'i chos mngon ba gang yin pa de phal cher bshad do //
translated: I have explained here for the most part the Abhidharma that is established in their system.

original: shugs kyis na gzhan gyi lugs kyis grub pa yang bstan to zhes bshad pa yin no //🔽kha che bye brag tu smra ba'i lugs sam /
analyzed: shugs kyis na gzhan gyi lugs kyis grub pa yang bstan to zhes bshad pa yin no // kha che bye brag tu smra ba'i lugs sam /
translated: By implication, I have also taught what is established in other systems.

original: gzhan gyi lugs kyang rung tshig 'di la nyes par zin pa gang yin pa de ni bdag gis nyes te bdag gi skyon yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lugs kyang rung tshig 'di la nyes par zin pa gang yin pa de ni bdag gis nyes te bdag gi skyon yin no //
translated: Whether it is the system of the Kāśmīri Vaibhāṣikas or another system, any fault in these words is my fault, it is my error.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dam chos tshul la tshad ma thub rnams yin //
analyzed: dam chos tshul la tshad ma thub rnams yin //
translated: The masters are the valid authorities for the system of the true Dharma.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says this.

original: rtogs pa dang lung gi mtshan nyid kyi dam pa'i chos kyi tshul la ste brjod pa la tshad ma ni thub pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi sras 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: rtogs pa dang lung gi mtshan nyid kyi dam pa'i chos kyi tshul la ste brjod pa la tshad ma ni thub pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi sras 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The valid cognition of the way of the holy Dharma of realization and scripture is the Muni, the Lord Buddha, and the Buddha's sons, the noble Sariputra, and so on.

original: chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du rtogs par bya ba la thugs gcugs pa dag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du rtogs par bya ba la thugs gcugs pa dag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are called those who are intent on realizing all phenomena in all ways.

original: ston pa 'jig rten mig ni zum gyur cing //
analyzed: ston pa 'jig rten mig ni zum gyur cing //
translated: The Teacher, the eye of the world, has closed.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams kyi mig tu gyur pa lam dang lam ma yin pa yang dag par ston par byed pa bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das shing ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams kyi mig tu gyur pa lam dang lam ma yin pa yang dag par ston par byed pa bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das shing ste /
translated: The Bhagavat, who is the eye of the world, who reveals what is and is not the path, has passed into parinirvana.

original: 'dis ni 'jig rten long bar gyur pa nyid ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'jig rten long bar gyur pa nyid ston to //
translated: This shows that the world has become blind.

original: dpang gyur skye bo phal cher zad pa na //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dpang gyur skye bo phal cher zad pa na // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Most of the people who were witnesses have perished.

original: dpang du gyur pa ni mngon sum du mthong ba ste /
analyzed: dpang du gyur pa ni mngon sum du mthong ba ste /
translated: Witnesses are those who have seen directly.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi dpang du gyur pa'i skye bo bcom ldan 'das ni lam dang lam ma yin pa mkhyen pa yin no zhes bya bar de kho na nyid rtogs pa grogs su gyur pa gang yin pa de zad cing yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa na🔽ma rig pa'i mun pas de kho na nyid ma mthong ba rang dgar gyur pa bcos su mi btub pa rang gi lta bas rtog ge ngan par zhugs pa khyed cag gis bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa tshig dang don gyi sgo nas dkrugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi dpang du gyur pa'i skye bo bcom ldan 'das ni lam dang lam ma yin pa mkhyen pa yin no zhes bya bar de kho na nyid rtogs pa grogs su gyur pa gang yin pa de zad cing yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa na ma rig pa'i mun pas de kho na nyid ma mthong ba rang dgar gyur pa bcos su mi btub pa rang gi lta bas rtog ge ngan par zhugs pa khyed cag gis bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa tshig dang don gyi sgo nas dkrugs so //
translated: The witnesses of the Bhagavat, the friends who understand reality, “The Bhagavat knows the path and what is not the path,” have passed away and entered complete nirvana.

original: rang byung rang byung bstan pa gces 'dzin rnams //🔽mchog tu zhir gshegs 'gro mgon med pa na //
analyzed: rang byung rang byung bstan pa gces 'dzin rnams // mchog tu zhir gshegs 'gro mgon med pa na //
translated: You who do not see reality because of the darkness of ignorance, who are self-indulgent, who cannot be corrected, who have entered into bad reasoning through your own views, have disturbed the teaching of the Bhagavat in terms of both the words and the meaning.🔽The two verses beginning with “Those who cherish the self-arisen teaching of the self-arisen”

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa 'dis ni sngar bshad pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i don gyi gtan tshigs kyi ngo bo nye bar bkod pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa 'dis ni sngar bshad pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i don gyi gtan tshigs kyi ngo bo nye bar bkod pa yin te /
translated: state the reason for the above explanation in the form of a syllogism.

original: @312a * // sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi sras rnams yongs su mya ngan las 'das te /
analyzed: @312a * // sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi sras rnams yongs su mya ngan las 'das te /
translated: The Buddhas and their Bodhisattva sons have passed into parinirvāṇa.

original: 'gro ba mgon med ba na bstan pa nub par byed pa'i rgyu lta ba la sogs pa skyon gyi dri ma rang nyams su gyur pas dga' mgur rang dgar deng sang 'jig rten 'di na spyod do //
analyzed: 'gro ba mgon med ba na bstan pa nub par byed pa'i rgyu lta ba la sogs pa skyon gyi dri ma rang nyams su gyur pas dga' mgur rang dgar deng sang 'jig rten 'di na spyod do //
translated: Now, in this world, the causes of the disappearance of the teaching, such as wrong views, are flourishing freely and without restraint, since the world is without a protector.

original: de bas na de ltar lkog mar srog phyin 'dra ste srog lkog mar phyin pa dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na de ltar lkog mar srog phyin 'dra ste srog lkog mar phyin pa dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, the life force is as if it has entered the throat, that is to say, it is as if the life force has entered the throat.

original: de yang rig la skyon rnams kyang stobs dang ldan pa'i dus su rig nas thar pa 'dod pa dag gis bag yod kyis zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang rig la skyon rnams kyang stobs dang ldan pa'i dus su rig nas thar pa 'dod pa dag gis bag yod kyis zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: And when one knows that the faults are powerful, those who desire liberation should be heedful.

original: chos mngon pa mdzod kyi 'grel bshad don gsal ba zhes bya ba slob dpon rgyal po'i sras grags pa'i bshes gnyen gyis mdzad pa las snyoms par 'jug pa bstan pa zhes bya ba ste mdzod kyi gnas brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: chos mngon pa mdzod kyi 'grel bshad don gsal ba zhes bya ba slob dpon rgyal po'i sras grags pa'i bshes gnyen gyis mdzad pa las snyoms par 'jug pa bstan pa zhes bya ba ste mdzod kyi gnas brgyad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the eighth chapter of the Abhidharmakośabhāṣya, called “The Exposition of Concentration.”

original: // / bam po drug cu pa /
analyzed: // / bam po drug cu pa /

original: yang ci 'di las gzhan la thar pa yod dam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang ci 'di las gzhan la thar pa yod dam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Now, does liberation exist elsewhere than in this?

original: thar pa 'dod pa dag gis bag yod gyis//
analyzed: thar pa 'dod pa dag gis bag yod gyis//
translated: Those who desire liberation should be diligent.

original: zhes 'byung bas don gyis ni slob dpon gyis 'di kho na thar pa'i thabs yin gyi 'di las thar pa'i thabs gzhan med de /
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas don gyis ni slob dpon gyis 'di kho na thar pa'i thabs yin gyi 'di las thar pa'i thabs gzhan med de /
translated: Since this is stated, the Master has implicitly explained that this alone is the means of liberation, there is no other means of liberation than this.

original: de lta bas na thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis 'di la bag yod par bya'o zhes bshad pas /
analyzed: de lta bas na thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis 'di la bag yod par bya'o zhes bshad pas /
translated: Therefore, those who desire liberation should be diligent in this.

original: gleng ba pos kyang ci 'di las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'dri ba la med do zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: gleng ba pos kyang ci 'di las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'dri ba la med do zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Since this is stated, the interlocutor also asks, “Does liberation exist elsewhere than in this?” and replies, “No.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bdag tu lta ba'i phyin ci log la zhen pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i phyin ci log la zhen pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because they are attached to the error of the view of self.

original: mu stegs can rnams ni bdag tu lta ba'i phyin ci log la zhen pa yin pas bdag tu lta ba phyin ci log la zhen pa'o //
analyzed: mu stegs can rnams ni bdag tu lta ba'i phyin ci log la zhen pa yin pas bdag tu lta ba phyin ci log la zhen pa'o //
translated: Since tīrthikas are attached to the error of the view of self, they are attached to the error of the view of self.

original: de'i ngo bo ni nyid de /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni nyid de /
translated: That is their nature.

original: de'i phyir gzhan la thar pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan la thar pa med do //
translated: Therefore, liberation does not exist elsewhere.

original: don 'di ni bstod pa byas bas kyang bshad de /
analyzed: don 'di ni bstod pa byas bas kyang bshad de /
translated: This point is also explained by the praise:

original: yid la nga ru 'dzin dang bcas na skye rgyun zhi ma 'gyur //
analyzed: yid la nga ru 'dzin dang bcas na skye rgyun zhi ma 'gyur //
translated: If the mind is accompanied by the apprehension of “I,” the continuum of birth is not pacified.

original: bdag tu lta ba yod na snying las ngar 'dzin mi g-yo lags //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba yod na snying las ngar 'dzin mi g-yo lags //
translated: If the view of self exists, the apprehension of “I” does not waver from the heart.

original: gad phyir 'gro la bdag med smra ba'i ston pa gzhan med pa //
analyzed: gad phyir 'gro la bdag med smra ba'i ston pa gzhan med pa //
translated: Because there is no other teacher who teaches selflessness to the world,

original: de'i phyir khyod kyi lugs las nyer zhi byed pa'i lam gzhan med//🔽ces bya ba yin no //🔽'di la sgrub pa ni ser skya dang 'ug pa pa la sogs pa la ni thar pa med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyod kyi lugs las nyer zhi byed pa'i lam gzhan med// ces bya ba yin no // 'di la sgrub pa ni ser skya dang 'ug pa pa la sogs pa la ni thar pa med de /
translated: therefore, there is no other path to peace than your system.

original: bdag tu lta ba phyin ci log la zhen pa'i phyir de kho na nyid ma mthong ba'i skyes bu bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba phyin ci log la zhen pa'i phyir de kho na nyid ma mthong ba'i skyes bu bzhin no //
translated: Here, the proof is as follows: Sāṃkhyas, Aulūkyas, and so on do not have liberation because they are attached to the wrong view of self, like a person who has not seen reality.🔽Afflictions are produced from the apprehension of self, as it is said:

original: nyon mongs pa rnams ni bdag tu 'dzin pa las rab tu skye ba yin no zhes bya ba ni ji skad du 'jig rten @312b 'di na dge sbyong dang bram ze kha cig gi lta ba tha dad par gyur pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni 'jig
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams ni bdag tu 'dzin pa las rab tu skye ba yin no zhes bya ba ni ji skad du 'jig rten @312b 'di na dge sbyong dang bram ze kha cig gi lta ba tha dad par gyur pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni 'jig
translated: “Whatever views there are in this world, they are all due to the view of self.

original: tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba can yin no zhes rgyas par 'byung ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba can yin no zhes rgyas par 'byung ba lta bu ste /
translated: The root of the view of the perishable collection is the view of a self.

original: bdag tu lta ba yod na bdag la chags pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams rab tu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba yod na bdag la chags pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams rab tu 'byung ngo //
translated: When there is the view of a self, the afflictions such as attachment to a self arise.

original: bdag tu mngon bar brjod pa 'di ni phung po'i rgyud kho na la 'jug gi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag tu mngon bar brjod pa 'di ni phung po'i rgyud kho na la 'jug gi zhes bya ba la /
translated: This designation of a self applies only to the continuum of the aggregates.

original: bdag tu mngon par brjod pa ni bdag tu 'dogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag tu mngon par brjod pa ni bdag tu 'dogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The designation of a self is a synonym for the imputation of a self.

original: brjod par bya ba gzhan la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni phung po'i rgyud las gzhan pa brtags pa la ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba gzhan la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni phung po'i rgyud las gzhan pa brtags pa la ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It does not apply to anything else, that is, to anything other than the continuum of the aggregates.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar yin zhe na /🔽mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar yin zhe na / mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Why is this so?🔽Because there is no direct perception or inference of it.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir de med pa nyid do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir de med pa nyid do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: It does not exist because there is no direct perception or inference of it.

original: lung ni rjes su dpag pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir logs shig tu ma brjod do //
analyzed: lung ni rjes su dpag pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir logs shig tu ma brjod do //
translated: Scripture is not mentioned separately because it is included in inference.🔽They are directly perceived when there is no obstruction.

original: de dag ni bar chad byed pa med na mngon sum du dmigs pa yin te zhes bya ba la bar chad byed pa med na zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i bgegs byed pa ha cang nye ba dang ha cang ring ba la sogs pa med na'o //
analyzed: de dag ni bar chad byed pa med na mngon sum du dmigs pa yin te zhes bya ba la bar chad byed pa med na zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i bgegs byed pa ha cang nye ba dang ha cang ring ba la sogs pa med na'o //
translated: When there is no obstruction means when there is no obstruction to the object, such as being too far away or too near.

original: mngon sum zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i khyad par yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i khyad par yin te /
translated: Directly perceived is a particular kind of object.

original: mngon sum nyid du dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid du dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means directly perceived as an object.

original: yang na dmigs pa ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin te 'dis dmigs par byed pas na dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na dmigs pa ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin te 'dis dmigs par byed pas na dmigs pa'o //
translated: Or, the object is a valid cognition of direct perception because it is the object that is perceived by direct perception.

original: yul drug ces bya ba ni gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya'i skye mched rnams dang chos kyi skye mched tshor ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang rnal 'byor pa'i yul lung dang rnam par rtog pa las 'das pa'o ;
analyzed: yul drug ces bya ba ni gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya'i skye mched rnams dang chos kyi skye mched tshor ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang rnal 'byor pa'i yul lung dang rnam par rtog pa las 'das pa'o ;
translated: The six objects are the sense bases of form, sound, smell, taste, and tactility, and the sense base of mental objects, which has the characteristics of feelings, etc., and is the object of the yogi that transcends scripture and imagination.

original: / yid ces bya ba ci zhe na mngon sum du dmigs pa yin te /🔽'gags ma thag pa'i yid ni mjug thogs su byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas chags pa'am sdang ba'am /🔽bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'am /
analyzed: / yid ces bya ba ci zhe na mngon sum du dmigs pa yin te / 'gags ma thag pa'i yid ni mjug thogs su byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas chags pa'am sdang ba'am / bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'am /
translated: What is the mental faculty? It is the direct perception of the mind.

original: sdug bsngal dang mtshungs par ldan pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa rnam par shes so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang mtshungs par ldan pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa rnam par shes so //
translated: The mind that has just ceased is perceived by the mental consciousness that has arisen immediately after it, as being attached, or as being hateful, or as being associated with pleasure, or as being associated with pain.🔽In this way, the mind is perceived.

original: gzhan dag na re rang rig pas dmigs su zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rang rig pas dmigs su zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that it is perceived by reflexive awareness.

original: mngon sum rnam pa gnyis po 'di ni gzung ba'i rnam pa dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum rnam pa gnyis po 'di ni gzung ba'i rnam pa dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: These two types of direct perception are the aspect of the object and the aspect of the subject.🔽Or, it is perceived by inference, etc.

original: yang na rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang du mngon sum mi 'jug pa der ni rjes @313a * //🔽su dpag pas dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang du mngon sum mi 'jug pa der ni rjes @313a * // su dpag pas dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Where direct perception does not operate, there it is perceived by inference.

original: dper na dbang po lnga lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni mig gi dbang po la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na dbang po lnga lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni mig gi dbang po la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, like the five sense faculties.

original: rgyu zhing dang chu la sogs pa yod kyang rgyu gzhan sa bon gyi mtshan nyid med na 'bras bu med par mthong la sa bon de yod na ni yang myu gu yod par mthong ngo //
analyzed: rgyu zhing dang chu la sogs pa yod kyang rgyu gzhan sa bon gyi mtshan nyid med na 'bras bu med par mthong la sa bon de yod na ni yang myu gu yod par mthong ngo //
translated: Even though the causes such as the field and water exist, the effect is not seen when the other cause, the seed, does not exist. But when that seed exists, the sprout is seen.

original: dper na myu gu lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni dpe nye bar bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na myu gu lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni dpe nye bar bkod pa yin no //
translated: For example, like a sprout. This is the example that is cited.

original: de ltar dpe nye bar bkod nas dngos bstan pa'i phyir yul snang bar gyur pa dang rgyu yid la byed pa yod kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de ltar dpe nye bar bkod nas dngos bstan pa'i phyir yul snang bar gyur pa dang rgyu yid la byed pa yod kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Having cited the example, in order to demonstrate the meaning, he says, even though the object is illuminated and the cause is mental attention, etc.

original: yul gzugs la sogs pa mngon sum du gyur pa dang / de skyed pa rgyu yid la byed pa yod du zin kyang yul 'dzin pa mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa med par mthong la yang yod par mthong ngo //
analyzed: yul gzugs la sogs pa mngon sum du gyur pa dang / de skyed pa rgyu yid la byed pa yod du zin kyang yul 'dzin pa mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa med par mthong la yang yod par mthong ngo //
translated: Even though the object such as form is present and the cause, mental attention that generates it, exists, the eye consciousness that apprehends the object, etc., is not seen to exist, but is seen to exist.

original: gang dag gi zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag gi zhe na /
translated: Whose?

original: grangs bzhin du ston te /🔽long ba dang 'on pa la sogs pa'i ni med do //
analyzed: grangs bzhin du ston te / long ba dang 'on pa la sogs pa'i ni med do //
translated: They are taught in order.🔽The blind, the deaf, etc., do not have it.

original: ma long ba dang ma 'on pa la sogs pa'i yod do //
analyzed: ma long ba dang ma 'on pa la sogs pa'i yod do //
translated: The nonblind, the nondeaf, etc., do have it.

original: stsogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sna'i dbang po la sogs pa nyams pa'i bsdu'o //
analyzed: stsogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sna'i dbang po la sogs pa nyams pa'i bsdu'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes the impairment of the nose faculty, and so on.

original: de'i phyir de la yang rgyu gzhan ma nges pa'i ngo bo ci zhig grangs bzhin du med pa dang yod pa kho nar nges so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la yang rgyu gzhan ma nges pa'i ngo bo ci zhig grangs bzhin du med pa dang yod pa kho nar nges so //
translated: Therefore, in that case, what other cause is there that is uncertain in nature, such that it is certain that it is nonexistent or existent, respectively?

original: de yang ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: smras pa ltos par bya ba'i rgyu gzhan gang yin pa de ni dbang po ste mig la sogs pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: smras pa ltos par bya ba'i rgyu gzhan gang yin pa de ni dbang po ste mig la sogs pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: It is the other cause that is relied upon, which is the faculty, such as the eye, and so on. This is what is thought.

original: 'di la sgrub pa ni rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs skyed par byed par 'dod pa yul dang yid la byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po 'di ni rgyu gzhan dang lhan cig rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di la sgrub pa ni rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs skyed par byed par 'dod pa yul dang yid la byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po 'di ni rgyu gzhan dang lhan cig rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa yin te /
translated: The proof here is as follows: This entity that is characterized as the object and mental activity that is asserted to be the producer of the five collections of consciousness is the producer of its own effect in association with another cause,

original: res 'ga' kho na rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' kho na rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the producer of its own effect only sometimes.

original: gang zhig res 'ga' kho na rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa de ni rgyu gzhan dang lhan cig rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig res 'ga' kho na rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa de ni rgyu gzhan dang lhan cig rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: That which sometimes produces its own effect produces its own effect in conjunction with other causes.

original: dper na myu gu skyed par byed pa zhing dang chu dang sa bon gyi mtshan nyid kyi rgyu gzhan dang lhan cig rang gi 'bras bu myu gu skyed par byed pa res 'ga' kho na rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na myu gu skyed par byed pa zhing dang chu dang sa bon gyi mtshan nyid kyi rgyu gzhan dang lhan cig rang gi 'bras bu myu gu skyed par byed pa res 'ga' kho na rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, a seed produces its own effect, a sprout, in conjunction with other causes, such as a field, water, and its own characteristics. Sometimes it produces its own effect,

original: sa bon yod pa'i gnas skabs na myu gu skyed par byed pa'i phyir dang / sa bon med pa'i gnas skabs na rang gi 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bon yod pa'i gnas skabs na myu gu skyed par byed pa'i phyir dang / sa bon med pa'i gnas skabs na rang gi 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it produces a sprout when the seed exists, and it does not produce its own effect when the seed does not exist.

original: yul dang yid la byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po de yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: yul dang yid la byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po de yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The thing characterized by the object and mental activity is also like that.

original: de ni ma long ba dang ma 'on pa'i @313b gnas skabs na ni rang gi 'bras bu rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs kyi mtshan nyid skyed par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: de ni ma long ba dang ma 'on pa'i @313b gnas skabs na ni rang gi 'bras bu rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs kyi mtshan nyid skyed par byed pa yin la /
translated: When the sense faculty is not impaired, it generates its own result, which is the five collections of consciousness.

original: long ba dang 'on pa'i gnas skabs na ni skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: long ba dang 'on pa'i gnas skabs na ni skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: But when the sense faculty is impaired, it does not generate its own result.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni rgyu gzhan dang lhan cig 'bras bu skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni rgyu gzhan dang lhan cig 'bras bu skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is a cause that generates its result in conjunction with other causes.

original: de ni dbang po yin no zhes bya ba ji ltar na de dbang po yin no zhes bya bar yongs su gcod de /
analyzed: de ni dbang po yin no zhes bya ba ji ltar na de dbang po yin no zhes bya bar yongs su gcod de /
translated: How is it ascertained that it is a sense faculty?🔽It is ascertained merely as a cause that exists, but it is not ascertained as a sense faculty.

original: 'di la rgyu gzhan zhig yod do zhes bya ba de kho na tsam zhig tu yongs su gcod kyi de dbang po yin no zhes bya bar ni ma yin no zhe na 'di ni drang srong chen po'i smon nas shes pa'i yongs su bcad pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: 'di la rgyu gzhan zhig yod do zhes bya ba de kho na tsam zhig tu yongs su gcod kyi de dbang po yin no zhes bya bar ni ma yin no zhe na 'di ni drang srong chen po'i smon nas shes pa'i yongs su bcad pa'i phyir dang /
translated: This is because the great sage ascertains it through inference.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu mig gi dbang po la sogs pa yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu mig gi dbang po la sogs pa yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: The cause of eye consciousness, etc., the eye faculty, etc., do exist.

original: thams cad rtsod pa med pa'i phyir grub pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: thams cad rtsod pa med pa'i phyir grub pa kho na yin no //
translated: Since there is no dispute about this, it is established.

original: bdag ni de ltar yod pa ma yin pas bdag med do zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa yin no //🔽sgrub pa ni don gyis na 'di skad du bdag ni med de /
analyzed: bdag ni de ltar yod pa ma yin pas bdag med do zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa yin no // sgrub pa ni don gyis na 'di skad du bdag ni med de /
translated: The conclusion is: “The self does not exist in that way, therefore it is selfless.”

original: tshad mas mi dmigs pa'i phyir gtan med pa lta bu'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad mas mi dmigs pa'i phyir gtan med pa lta bu'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: The proof is: “The self does not exist because it is not perceived by valid cognition, like a completely nonexistent thing.”

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa yod de de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa yod de de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that there is an inference, therefore the reason is not established, that is not so.

original: de brjod dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de brjod dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it must be stated.

original: gal te de yod na de smros shig / tshig tsam gyis ni gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa yin no zhes bzlog tu mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te de yod na de smros shig / tshig tsam gyis ni gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa yin no zhes bzlog tu mi rung ngo //
translated: If it exists, state it. It is not right to refute this reason with mere words.

original: 'o na gang gnas ma'i bu rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba gnas ma'i bu ni 'phags pa mang pos bkur ba'i sde pa dag ste /
analyzed: 'o na gang gnas ma'i bu rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba gnas ma'i bu ni 'phags pa mang pos bkur ba'i sde pa dag ste /
translated: Now, the passage beginning “Well then, what are the Vatsiputrīyas?”

original: 'dis ni bdag tu lta ba phyin ci log la zhen pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs ma nges so zhes ston par byed de /
analyzed: 'dis ni bdag tu lta ba phyin ci log la zhen pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs ma nges so zhes ston par byed de /
translated: This shows that the reason, “because of the attachment to the error of the view of self,” is not established.

original: gnas ma'i bu rnams ni sangs rgyas pa yin pa'i phyir thar pa mi 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas ma'i bu rnams ni sangs rgyas pa yin pa'i phyir thar pa mi 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: The Vatsiputrīyas are Buddhists, and they do not reject liberation.

original: yang na bdag med do zhes bya ba 'dis phyogs 'di skyon dang bcas pa yin no zhes phyogs snga ma 'gal bar ston te /
analyzed: yang na bdag med do zhes bya ba 'dis phyogs 'di skyon dang bcas pa yin no zhes phyogs snga ma 'gal bar ston te /
translated: Or, this passage shows the contradiction in the opponent’s position, “This position is faulty because of the statement ‘There is no self.’

original: gnas ma'i bu'i sde dag rang gi phyogs yin pas so //
analyzed: gnas ma'i bu'i sde dag rang gi phyogs yin pas so //
translated: ” The Vatsiputrīyas are on our side.

original: 'di ni re zhig dpyad par bya ba yin te zhes bya ba ni de'i sde'i gang zag btags par yod pa yin pas nyes pa med do snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig dpyad par bya ba yin te zhes bya ba ni de'i sde'i gang zag btags par yod pa yin pas nyes pa med do snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: This is something to be investigated.

original: rdzas su zhes bya ba ni ci zhig btags par zhes bya ba 'di yang ci zhig yin zhes glengs pa dang / slob dpon gyis gal te gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du dngos @314a * //🔽po gzhan zhig yin no zhe na ni rdzas su yod pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rdzas su zhes bya ba ni ci zhig btags par zhes bya ba 'di yang ci zhig yin zhes glengs pa dang / slob dpon gyis gal te gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du dngos @314a * // po gzhan zhig yin no zhe na ni rdzas su yod pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te /

original: gal te ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa sgra la sogs pa las dngos po tha dad pa ltar 'dod na ni gzugs ni sgra las mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bur gang zag rdzas su yod do zhes khas blangs pa🔽yin no // gal te 'o ma la sogs pa bzhin du spyi yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te ji ltar 'o ma dang khyim dang / dmag la sogs pa gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dag dang rtsva dang shing dang so bag dag dang /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa sgra la sogs pa las dngos po tha dad pa ltar 'dod na ni gzugs ni sgra las mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bur gang zag rdzas su yod do zhes khas blangs pa🔽yin no // gal te 'o ma la sogs pa bzhin du spyi yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te ji ltar 'o ma dang khyim dang / dmag la sogs pa gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dag dang rtsva dang shing dang so bag dag dang /
translated: If you assert that it is a different substance, like form and so on, then it is substantially existent.🔽If you assert that it is a different substance

original: glang po che dang / rta dang shing rta la sogs pa de dag las dngos po gzhan yin par mi 'dod kyi /
analyzed: glang po che dang / rta dang shing rta la sogs pa de dag las dngos po gzhan yin par mi 'dod kyi /
translated: We do not maintain that the person is a different thing from the elephant, horse, chariot, etc.

original: de dag nyid kyi spyi tsam du zad do zhes bya ba de ltar 'dod na ni /
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi spyi tsam du zad do zhes bya ba de ltar 'dod na ni /
translated: We maintain that the person is merely the universal of those things.

original: gang zag btags par yod do zhes khas blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zag btags par yod do zhes khas blangs pa yin te /
translated: If that is so, then you accept that the person exists as a nominal reality.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dang rtsva la sogs pa dang / glang po che la sogs pa las gzhan pa 'o ma dang / khyim dang dmag ces bya ba'i dngos po ni ci yang med do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dang rtsva la sogs pa dang / glang po che la sogs pa las gzhan pa 'o ma dang / khyim dang dmag ces bya ba'i dngos po ni ci yang med do //
translated: There is no such thing as milk, a house, or an army that is different from form, etc., or from grass, etc., or from an elephant, etc.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de las nyes pa cir 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de las nyes pa cir 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What is the problem with that?

original: re zhig gal te rdzas su yod na zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma la brten na'o //
analyzed: re zhig gal te rdzas su yod na zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma la brten na'o //
translated: If the person exists as a substance,

original: gang zag de rang bzhin tha dad pa'i phyir te mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir phung po rnams las gzhan no zhes brjod par bya'i phung po'i spyi tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zag de rang bzhin tha dad pa'i phyir te mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir phung po rnams las gzhan no zhes brjod par bya'i phung po'i spyi tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: then the person would be different in self-existence from the aggregates, because it would have a different characteristic. It could not be said to be merely the universal of the aggregates.

original: phan tshun gyi phung po bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir gzugs kyi phung po las tshor ba'i phung po gzhan yin pa ltar phung po dag las gang zag kyang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: phan tshun gyi phung po bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir gzugs kyi phung po las tshor ba'i phung po gzhan yin pa ltar phung po dag las gang zag kyang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur te /
translated: Like the other aggregates. Just as the aggregate of feeling is different from the aggregate of form because of the difference in their characteristics, so the person would be different from the aggregates.

original: gang zag ni gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag ni gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the person does not have the characteristics of the aggregate of form, etc.

original: 'di'i rgyu yang brjod dgos so zhes bya ba ni gal te 'dus byas yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i rgyu yang brjod dgos so zhes bya ba ni gal te 'dus byas yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: And its cause would have to be stated. If you think that it is conditioned, then its cause would have to be stated.

original: 'on te 'dus ma byas yin na ni de'i phyir mu stegs can gyi lta bur yang thal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas yin ba de'i phyir gnas ma'i bu rnams mu stegs can gyi lta bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te 'dus ma byas yin na ni de'i phyir mu stegs can gyi lta bur yang thal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas yin ba de'i phyir gnas ma'i bu rnams mu stegs can gyi lta bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is unconditioned, then it follows that the Vātsīputrīyas have a view that is the same as that of the tīrthikas. If it is unconditioned, then it follows that the Vātsīputrīyas have a view that is the same as that of the tīrthikas.

original: dgos pa med pa nyid du yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dgos pa med pa nyid du yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: And it would be purposeless.

original: mkha' la char nyis ci zhig bya //
analyzed: mkha' la char nyis ci zhig bya //
translated: What use is rain on the sky?

original: de gnyis 'bras bu bags pa yod //
analyzed: de gnyis 'bras bu bags pa yod //
translated: Those two have a result that is tangible.

original: gal te bags 'dra de mi rtag / gal te mkha' 'dra 'bras bu med //
analyzed: gal te bags 'dra de mi rtag / gal te mkha' 'dra 'bras bu med //
translated: If it is like a skin, it is impermanent. If it is like space, it is without effect.

original: snyam du @314b bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: snyam du @314b bsams pa yin no //
translated: This is what he thinks.

original: long ba lta bu'i tshig don mi gsal ba 'di zhes bya ba 'di long ba dang 'dra bas na long ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: long ba lta bu'i tshig don mi gsal ba 'di zhes bya ba 'di long ba dang 'dra bas na long ba lta bu'o //
translated: This is like a blind man, because it is like a blind man, it is like a blind man.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: 'di ltar don mi gsal ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar don mi gsal ba ste /
translated: Because it is like this, the meaning is unclear.

original: don mi mngon pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don mi mngon pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is not manifest, this is what it means.

original: phung po rnams la dmigs nas zhes bya ba ni bzung nas zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: phung po rnams la dmigs nas zhes bya ba ni bzung nas zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: Having observed the aggregates, means having grasped.

original: ji ltar dper na gzugs la sogs pa bzung nas 'o ma 'dogs kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar dper na gzugs la sogs pa bzung nas 'o ma 'dogs kyi /
translated: For example, just as milk is imputed having grasped form and so on,

original: gzugs la sogs pa la ma gtogs pa'i 'o ma med pa ltar gang zag kyang de dang 'dra bas gang zag btags pa'i yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la ma gtogs pa'i 'o ma med pa ltar gang zag kyang de dang 'dra bas gang zag btags pa'i yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and there is no milk apart from form and so on, the person is also like that. Therefore, the person exists as a nominal reality. This is what it means.

original: phung po rnams la brten nas zhes bya ba ni gal te phung po rnams la brten te gnas nas so //
analyzed: phung po rnams la brten nas zhes bya ba ni gal te phung po rnams la brten te gnas nas so //
translated: In dependence on the aggregates, means if the person exists having depended on the aggregates.

original: skyon de nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phung po de dag nyid la gang zag 'dogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skyon de nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phung po de dag nyid la gang zag 'dogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The error would be just that, that is, the person would be imputed in dependence on those aggregates.

original: yang na gang zag 'dogs pa'i rkyen ni phung po dag yin gyi gang zag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na gang zag 'dogs pa'i rkyen ni phung po dag yin gyi gang zag ni ma yin no //
translated: Or, the aggregates are the conditions for the imputation of the person, not the person.

original: gang zag ni de kho na bzhin du btags pa'i yod pa yin pas skyon de nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zag ni de kho na bzhin du btags pa'i yod pa yin pas skyon de nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The person is imputed to exist in the same way, so the error would be just that.

original: ji ltar bud shing rgyur byas nas me 'dogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar bud shing rgyur byas nas me 'dogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: Just as fire is imputed in dependence on fuel.

original: gnas ma'i bu rnams kyi bsam pa ni gang zag rdzas su yod pa la gzhan ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas ma'i bu rnams kyi bsam pa ni gang zag rdzas su yod pa la gzhan ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The Vātsīputrīyas think that the person is not different from the aggregates,

original: rang gi nye bar len pa rgyur byas nas gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi nye bar len pa rgyur byas nas gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is imputed in dependence on its own appropriated aggregates.

original: dngos po gzhan yang ma yin gzhan ma yin pa yang ma yin pa gang zhig rang gi nye bar len pa rgyur byas nas 'dogs pa de ni rdzas su yod de /
analyzed: dngos po gzhan yang ma yin gzhan ma yin pa yang ma yin pa gang zhig rang gi nye bar len pa rgyur byas nas 'dogs pa de ni rdzas su yod de /
translated: Whatever is not a different thing from another, but is imputed in dependence on it, exists substantially.

original: dper na me lta bu'o snyam pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na me lta bu'o snyam pa yin no //
translated: For example, like fire.
