original: de nyid kyi phyir gal te gzhan yin na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smras te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gal te gzhan yin na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smras te /
translated: Therefore, if they are different, etc.

original: 'jig rten dang 'gal ba dang rang gi grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal ba ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'gal ba dang rang gi grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal ba ston par byed do //
translated: He shows that this contradicts the world and contradicts his own tenets.

original: rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas lta bur ro //
analyzed: rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas lta bur ro //
translated: It would follow that it is permanent, like unconditioned space.

original: chad par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phung po bzhin du'o //🔽re zhig 'jig rten na ni shing la sogs pa me 'bar ba la bud shing zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba 'dis ni dpe ma grub pa nyid du ston te /
analyzed: chad par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phung po bzhin du'o // re zhig 'jig rten na ni shing la sogs pa me 'bar ba la bud shing zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba 'dis ni dpe ma grub pa nyid du ston te /
translated: It would follow that it is annihilated, like the aggregates.🔽In the world, when a tree, etc., is on fire, it is called fuel.

original: me dang bud shing dag ni gzhan pa nyid du 'dod do //🔽des de tshig pa dang sreg par byed ces bya ba ni me des bud shing de tshig par byed sreg par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: me dang bud shing dag ni gzhan pa nyid du 'dod do // des de tshig pa dang sreg par byed ces bya ba ni me des bud shing de tshig par byed sreg par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: This shows that the example is not established, because fire and fuel are asserted to be different.🔽That fire burns that fuel means that that fire burns that fuel, that is, consumes it.

original: da gzhob tu 'byin cing thal bar rlog go //
analyzed: da gzhob tu 'byin cing thal bar rlog go //
translated: It is said that it burns it and reduces it to ashes.

original: rgyur 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes @315a * //
analyzed: rgyur 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes @315a * //
translated: because it makes it a cause.

original: bya ba ni thal bar rlog go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bya ba ni thal bar rlog go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the refutation of the consequence.

original: gzhan dag na re tshig pa dang sreg par byed pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs dag yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re tshig pa dang sreg par byed pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs dag yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that “burning and being burned” are synonyms.

original: brgyad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bud shing dang me de gnyi ga 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs bzhi po gzugs nas reg bya'i bar zhes bya ba rdzas brgyad pa yin te /
analyzed: brgyad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bud shing dang me de gnyi ga 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs bzhi po gzugs nas reg bya'i bar zhes bya ba rdzas brgyad pa yin te /
translated: The fire and fuel are eight substances, because both fire and fuel are the four great elements and the four derivative forms, form, smell, taste, and tactility.

original: grub pa'i mtha' las /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' las /
translated: As the treatise Attainment of Knowledge says:

original: 'dod na dbang po med pa yi //
analyzed: 'dod na dbang po med pa yi //
translated: In the desire realm, a particle without faculties

original: sgra med rdul phran rdzas brgyad do //🔽zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra med rdul phran rdzas brgyad do // zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and without sound is eight substances.

original: dus tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bud shing ni snga la me ni 'phyi'o //
analyzed: dus tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bud shing ni snga la me ni 'phyi'o //
translated: Because they are different in time. The fuel is prior and the fire is later.

original: dus tha dad pa dag kyang gzhan pa nyid du mthong ste sa bon dang myu gu dag lta bu'o //
analyzed: dus tha dad pa dag kyang gzhan pa nyid du mthong ste sa bon dang myu gu dag lta bu'o //
translated: And those that are different in time are seen to be different, like a seed and a sprout.

original: mi rtag par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang ldan pa gzugs la sogs pa mi rtag pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang ldan pa gzugs la sogs pa mi rtag pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It would also be impermanent, because form, etc., which possesses arising is seen to be impermanent.

original: 'on te shing la sogs pa 'bar ba de nyid la zhes bya ba ni de gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid kyi spyi la'o //
analyzed: 'on te shing la sogs pa 'bar ba de nyid la zhes bya ba ni de gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid kyi spyi la'o //
translated: Or, if it is the very burning of the wood, etc., then it is a generality which has the characteristic of both.

original: de gnyis kyang mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir gzhan nyid yin par grub bo zhes bya ba ni me dang bud shing mtshan nyid de lta bu de gnyis kyang mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir gzhan nyid yin par grub ste /
analyzed: de gnyis kyang mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir gzhan nyid yin par grub bo zhes bya ba ni me dang bud shing mtshan nyid de lta bu de gnyis kyang mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir gzhan nyid yin par grub ste /
translated: And those two are established as being different because their characteristics are different, because fire and fuel are established as being different because their characteristics are different in that way.

original: sa'i khams la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa'i khams la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their characteristics are different, like the earth element, etc.

original: mtshan nyid tha dad pa rnams ni gzhan nyid yin par mthong ste ;
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad pa rnams ni gzhan nyid yin par mthong ste ;
translated: Those which have different characteristics are seen to be different,

original: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: like form, feeling, etc.

original: rgyur byas pa'i don yang brjod dgos te zhes bya ba ni gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i don yang brjod dgos te zhes bya ba ni gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of derivative should also be stated, because they are different.

original: de ni de'i rgyu yang ma yin la zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba gsum gyi mtshan nyid kyi bud shing de ni dro ba'i mtshan nyid kyi me de'i rgyur rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de'i rgyu yang ma yin la zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba gsum gyi mtshan nyid kyi bud shing de ni dro ba'i mtshan nyid kyi me de'i rgyur rung ba ma yin te /
translated: that fuel characterized by the three elements is not a suitable cause of that fire characterized by heat,

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i phyir ba lang gi rva g-yas g-yon bzhin no //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i phyir ba lang gi rva g-yas g-yon bzhin no //
translated: because they are co-originated, like the right and left horns of an ox.🔽Nor is it a cause of its designation,

original: de gdags pa'i rgyu yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni me gdags pa'i'o //🔽gal te rgyur byas pa'i don rten gyi don nam zhes bya ba ni bud shing rgyur byas nas zhes bya ba bud shing la brten nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de gdags pa'i rgyu yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni me gdags pa'i'o // gal te rgyur byas pa'i don rten gyi don nam zhes bya ba ni bud shing rgyur byas nas zhes bya ba bud shing la brten nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: that is, of the designation of fire.🔽If the meaning of derivative is the meaning of support,🔽then the meaning of “having fuel as its basis” is the meaning of “having fuel as its derivative.”🔽If the meaning of derivative is the meaning of co-originated,

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i don zhes bya ba ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i don bud shing dang lhan cig 'byung ba nyid du bzung nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i don zhes bya ba ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i don bud shing dang lhan cig 'byung ba nyid du bzung nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: then the meaning of “having fuel as its derivative” is the meaning of “having fuel as its co-originated.”

original: rten nam lhan cig 'byung ba dag yin par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rten du gyur pa dang lhan cig 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig @315b ste /
analyzed: rten nam lhan cig 'byung ba dag yin par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rten du gyur pa dang lhan cig 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig @315b ste /
translated: “They would be the basis or co-originator” means they would be the basis and co-originator.

original: gnas ma'i bu rnams gzhan nyid du gsal bar dam 'cha' ba yin no //
analyzed: gnas ma'i bu rnams gzhan nyid du gsal bar dam 'cha' ba yin no //
translated: The sons of Vṛji clearly assert that they are different.

original: da mad na zhes bya ba ni phung po med na'o //
analyzed: da mad na zhes bya ba ni phung po med na'o //
translated: “If it does not exist” means if the aggregates do not exist.

original: 'byung ba gzhan gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sa'i khams la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba gzhan gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sa'i khams la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Because it has the nature of another element” means because it has the nature of the earth element, etc.

original: gzhan pa da yang zhes bya ba ni dro ba nyid dang ldan pa 'ba' zhig dro bar ma zad kyi gzhan me 'bar ba dang 'brel pa'i sa la sogs pa de yang dro bar 'grub po //
analyzed: gzhan pa da yang zhes bya ba ni dro ba nyid dang ldan pa 'ba' zhig dro bar ma zad kyi gzhan me 'bar ba dang 'brel pa'i sa la sogs pa de yang dro bar 'grub po //
translated: “Moreover, it is also different” means that not only heat that possesses heat is established as heat, but also earth, etc., that is connected to blazing fire is established as heat.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar de gzhan nyid yin na nyes pa med pa ltar 'di yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar de gzhan nyid yin na nyes pa med pa ltar 'di yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Therefore, just as there is no fault if it is different, the same is true here.

original: des na brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs de med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs de med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the position that it is inexpressible is eliminated.

original: shing la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni shing dang rtsva dang ba lang gi lci ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shing la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni shing dang rtsva dang ba lang gi lci ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Wood, etc.” refers to wood, grass, cow-dung, etc.

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni gang zag go //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni gang zag go //
translated: “The inexpressible” refers to the person.

original: brjod par mi bya bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni shes bya ni rnam pa lnga ste zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: brjod par mi bya bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni shes bya ni rnam pa lnga ste zhes bya bar ro //
translated: “It would not be expressible” refers to “the knowable is of five types.”

original: 'o na ji skad du brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji skad du brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: “Well then, how is it to be expressed?”

original: de ni 'das pa la sogs pa las lnga pa yang ma yin la lnga pa ma yin par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de ni 'das pa la sogs pa las lnga pa yang ma yin la lnga pa ma yin par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: “It is not the fifth, i.e., past, etc., and it is not to be said that it is not the fifth.”

original: gzugs kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gzugs kyang mig la sogs pa yod na de dmigs pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa rgyur byas nas gzugs 'dogs so zhes btags pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gzugs kyang mig la sogs pa yod na de dmigs pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa rgyur byas nas gzugs 'dogs so zhes btags pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: “Form, etc.” is further explained: “Form is designated as form in dependence upon the eye, etc., because it is perceived when the eye, etc., exist.”

original: dmigs par byed na zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon par byed na ste /
analyzed: dmigs par byed na zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon par byed na ste /
translated: “If it is perceived” means if it is indicated,

original: de'i nye bar len pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i nye bar len pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the appropriator of that.

original: gzugs rnams zhes kyang brjod par mi bya gzugs rnams ma yin no zhes kyang brjod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni de'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dang brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs rnams zhes kyang brjod par mi bya gzugs rnams ma yin no zhes kyang brjod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni de'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dang brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: One should not say that they are forms, nor should one say that they are not forms.

original: chos kyi bar du yin pa dang ma yin par brjod par mi bya ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: chos kyi bar du yin pa dang ma yin par brjod par mi bya ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same applies to the other sense objects up to and including mental objects.

original: 'o ma 'am chu dmigs par byed na zhes bya ba ni dper brjod pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'o ma 'am chu dmigs par byed na zhes bya ba ni dper brjod pa gnyis so //
translated: If one perceives milk or water,

original: de lta bas na de ni 'di skad du gal te mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams la brten nas 'o ma dmigs par byed na ni 'o ma mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba yin no zhes brjod par bya ba la /🔽gzugs rnams zhes kyang brjod par mi bya /
analyzed: de lta bas na de ni 'di skad du gal te mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams la brten nas 'o ma dmigs par byed na ni 'o ma mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba yin no zhes brjod par bya ba la / gzugs rnams zhes kyang brjod par mi bya /
translated: one should say that it is like this: If one perceives milk in dependence on forms that are objects of visual consciousness, one should say that milk is an object of visual consciousness.🔽One should not say that it is forms,

original: gzugs rnams ma yin zhes kyang brjod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba thams cad brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs rnams ma yin zhes kyang brjod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba thams cad brjod par bya'o //
translated: nor should one say that it is not forms.

original: de bzhin du gal te mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams @316a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams @316a * //
translated: So too, if form is seen by the eye consciousness,🔽

original: la brten nas chu dmigs par byed na ni chu mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba yin no zhes brjod par bya la /
analyzed: la brten nas chu dmigs par byed na ni chu mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba yin no zhes brjod par bya la /
translated: Likewise, if water is observed in dependence on forms that are objects of eye consciousness, then it should be said that water is an object of eye consciousness.

original: gzugs rnams zhes kyang brjod par mi bya /
analyzed: gzugs rnams zhes kyang brjod par mi bya /
translated: But it should not be said that it is forms,🔽nor should it be said that it is not forms.

original: gzugs rnams ma yin zhes kyang brjod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba 'di thams cad kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs rnams ma yin zhes kyang brjod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba 'di thams cad kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: All of this should be said.🔽Because it would follow that milk and water would be four.

original: 'o ma dang chu gnyis bzhi nyid du thal bar 'gyur du 'ong bas so zhes bya ba ni gal te gzugs rnams zhes bya ba nas reg bya rnams zhes bya ba'i bar du brjod na ni 'o ma dang chu bzhi tshan du thal bar 'gyur te 'o ma
analyzed: 'o ma dang chu gnyis bzhi nyid du thal bar 'gyur du 'ong bas so zhes bya ba ni gal te gzugs rnams zhes bya ba nas reg bya rnams zhes bya ba'i bar du brjod na ni 'o ma dang chu bzhi tshan du thal bar 'gyur te 'o ma
translated: If it is said that it is forms up to it is tactile objects, then it would follow that milk and water would be fourfold,

original: dang chu rnam pa bzhi par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dang chu rnam pa bzhi par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: that is, it would be said that milk and water are fourfold.

original: sgra ni glo bur pa yin pas 'dir ma gtogs so //
analyzed: sgra ni glo bur pa yin pas 'dir ma gtogs so //
translated: Sound is not included here because it is adventitious.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa'i spyi kho na la 'o ma 'am chu zhes 'dogs pa de bzhin du phung po rnams kyi spyi kho na la gang zag 'dogs so zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa'i spyi kho na la 'o ma 'am chu zhes 'dogs pa de bzhin du phung po rnams kyi spyi kho na la gang zag 'dogs so zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: Therefore, just as the general characteristics of the collection of form, etc. are designated as milk or water, in the same way, the general characteristics of the aggregates are designated as a person.

original: gzugs rnams gang zag dmigs pa'i rgyu zhig yin nam zhes bya ba dang / gzugs rnams dmigs na gang zag dmigs zhes bya ba 'di gnyis la khyad par ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: gzugs rnams gang zag dmigs pa'i rgyu zhig yin nam zhes bya ba dang / gzugs rnams dmigs na gang zag dmigs zhes bya ba 'di gnyis la khyad par ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is the difference between the two statements, “Are form, etc. the cause for the perception of a person?” and “When form is perceived, is a person perceived?”

original: phyogs snga ma la ni gzugs rnams rgyu nyid kyi dbang du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs snga ma la ni gzugs rnams rgyu nyid kyi dbang du byas pa yin no //
translated: In the first case, form, etc. are considered as the cause.

original: gnyis pa la ni rgyu nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni rgyu nyid ma yin no //
translated: In the second case, they are not considered as the cause.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: gzugs rnams rgyur byas nas gang zag dmigs so zhes bya ba yin no ;
analyzed: gzugs rnams rgyur byas nas gang zag dmigs so zhes bya ba yin no ;
translated: A person is perceived in dependence on form.

original: / de la gal te gzugs rnams rgyu nyid yin par 'dod la gang zag de yang phung po de dag las gzhan du brjod par mi bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: / de la gal te gzugs rnams rgyu nyid yin par 'dod la gang zag de yang phung po de dag las gzhan du brjod par mi bya'o zhe na /
translated: If you assert that form, etc. are the cause, and that a person is not described as other than the aggregates,

original: 'o na ni khyed la gzugs kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba 'di lta bur thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni khyed la gzugs kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba 'di lta bur thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: But then it would follow that you would also say, “Form is the person,” and so on.

original: ji ltar khyed kyi gzugs rnams gang zag dmigs pa'i rgyu yin la de yang de dag las gzhan du brjod par mi bya ba ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar khyed kyi gzugs rnams gang zag dmigs pa'i rgyu yin la de yang de dag las gzhan du brjod par mi bya ba ltar /
translated: Just as you say that form is the cause for observing the person, and that the person is not described as being different from form,

original: snang ba dang mig dang yid la byed pa dag kyang gzugs dmigs pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: snang ba dang mig dang yid la byed pa dag kyang gzugs dmigs pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: in the same way, light, the eye, and attention are the causes for observing form.

original: de yang snang ba la sogs pa de dag las gzhan du brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de yang snang ba la sogs pa de dag las gzhan du brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: You cannot say that the person is different from light and so on.

original: de dag ni de dmigs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni snang ba la sogs pa de dag ni gzugs dmigs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni de dmigs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni snang ba la sogs pa de dag ni gzugs dmigs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the causes for observing form.

original: gang zag gzugs las rang bzhin tha mi dad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zag gzugs las rang bzhin tha mi dad par 'gyur te /
translated: The person would not be different in nature from form,

original: dmigs pa de kho nas dmigs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gzugs bzhin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa de kho nas dmigs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gzugs bzhin no //
translated: because it is observed by the same observation, just as form is.

original: gzugs kho na la de 'dogs par zhes bya ba ni gang zag de 'dogs @316b par te 'gyur na zhes bya bar sbyar ro ;
analyzed: gzugs kho na la de 'dogs par zhes bya ba ni gang zag de 'dogs @316b par te 'gyur na zhes bya bar sbyar ro ;
translated: then you would have to say that the person is form alone.

original: / ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: / ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rgyu de nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu de nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of that very reason.

original: 'di ni gzugs so zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dmigs pa gcig pa nyid yin na gzugs dang gang zag dag yongs su gcod par mi 'gyur ro //🔽'on te 'di ni gzugs so //
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs so zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dmigs pa gcig pa nyid yin na gzugs dang gang zag dag yongs su gcod par mi 'gyur ro // 'on te 'di ni gzugs so //
translated: If the object of the two were the same, then form and the person would not be differentiated.🔽But if they are not differentiated in this way,

original: 'di ni gang zag go zhes bya ba de ltar yongs su mi gcod na ni ji ltar gnyi ga dam bca'/
analyzed: 'di ni gang zag go zhes bya ba de ltar yongs su mi gcod na ni ji ltar gnyi ga dam bca'/
translated: how can both be asserted?

original: gzugs kho na dam bca' dgos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs kho na dam bca' dgos par 'gyur te /
translated: It would be necessary to assert only form,

original: de dmigs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dmigs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is the object of perception.🔽The same should be said of all phenomena up to and including mental objects.

original: de bzhin du chos kyi bar dag las kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos kyi bar dag las kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gang yang rna bas rnam par shes par bya ba'i sgra rnams la brten nas gang zag dmigs par byed ces smras pa'i tshig de'i don ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang yang rna bas rnam par shes par bya ba'i sgra rnams la brten nas gang zag dmigs par byed ces smras pa'i tshig de'i don ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the statement, “The person is perceived in dependence on sounds that are cognized by the ear?”

original: ci re zhig sgra rnams gang zag dmigs pa'i rgyu zhig yin nam /
analyzed: ci re zhig sgra rnams gang zag dmigs pa'i rgyu zhig yin nam /
translated: Is it that sounds are the cause of perceiving the person?

original: 'on te sgra rnams dmigs na gang zag dmigs so zhes bya ba yin /
analyzed: 'on te sgra rnams dmigs na gang zag dmigs so zhes bya ba yin /
translated: Or is it that when sounds are perceived, the person is perceived?

original: gal te sgra rnams gang zag dmigs pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: gal te sgra rnams gang zag dmigs pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: If sounds are the cause of perceiving the person,

original: de yang de dag las gzhan du brjod par mi bya'o zhe na ni /
analyzed: de yang de dag las gzhan du brjod par mi bya'o zhe na ni /
translated: and the person is not to be described as other than those sounds,

original: de lta na ni 'o na sgra yang rna ba dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa las gzhan du brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na sgra yang rna ba dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa las gzhan du brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: then sounds are not to be described as other than the ear, mental activity, and so on,

original: de dag ni de mi dmigs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni de mi dmigs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those are the causes of perceiving sounds.

original: 'on te sgra rnams dmigs na gang zag dmigs so zhe na ni /
analyzed: 'on te sgra rnams dmigs na gang zag dmigs so zhe na ni /
translated: If it is that when sounds are perceived, the person is perceived,

original: ci dmigs pa de kho nas dmigs sam 'on te gzhan gyis /
analyzed: ci dmigs pa de kho nas dmigs sam 'on te gzhan gyis /
translated: is the person perceived by that very perception or is it perceived by another?

original: gal te de kho nas so zhe na ni gang zag sgra las rang bzhin tha mi dad pa'am /
analyzed: gal te de kho nas so zhe na ni gang zag sgra las rang bzhin tha mi dad pa'am /
translated: If you say that the person is perceived by that same cognition, then the person would be perceived as not being essentially different from sound.

original: sgra kho na la de 'dogs par 'gyur na 'di ni sgra'o //🔽'di ni gang zag go zhes bya ba 'di yang ji ltar yongs su gcod 'on te de ltar yongs su mi gcod na ni gzugs kyang yod do /
analyzed: sgra kho na la de 'dogs par 'gyur na 'di ni sgra'o // 'di ni gang zag go zhes bya ba 'di yang ji ltar yongs su gcod 'on te de ltar yongs su mi gcod na ni gzugs kyang yod do /
translated: Or else, the person would be imputed in dependence on sound alone.🔽But how could you determine that this is sound and that is the person?

original: gang zag kyang yod do zhes bya ba 'di yang ji ltar dam bca' ste /
analyzed: gang zag kyang yod do zhes bya ba 'di yang ji ltar dam bca' ste /
translated: If you do not determine that, then how can you assert that form exists and the person exists?

original: dmigs pa'i dbang gis de yod par dam bca' bar zad do //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i dbang gis de yod par dam bca' bar zad do //
translated: You can only assert that the person exists on the basis of perception.

original: phyogs 'dis chos kyi bar dag las kyang sbyar bar bya'o //🔽sngon po las ser po lta bu zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe yongs su gcod pas sngon po dmigs pa de'i tshe ser po mi dmigs so //
analyzed: phyogs 'dis chos kyi bar dag las kyang sbyar bar bya'o // sngon po las ser po lta bu zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe yongs su gcod pas sngon po dmigs pa de'i tshe ser po mi dmigs so //
translated: This same approach can be applied to all phenomena up to and including mental objects.🔽The example of yellow is like the example of blue. When you determine that blue is perceived, you do not perceive yellow.

original: phyis dmigs pa ni dmigs pa gzhan gyis dmigs te ser po de yang sngon po las gzhan yin no zhes bya bar grags so //
analyzed: phyis dmigs pa ni dmigs pa gzhan gyis dmigs te ser po de yang sngon po las gzhan yin no zhes bya bar grags so //
translated: Later, when you perceive yellow, you perceive it as being different from blue.

original: de lta na gang zag kyang dmigs pa gzhan gyis dmigs pas gzugs las gzhan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na gang zag kyang dmigs pa gzhan gyis dmigs pas gzugs las gzhan par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, since the person is perceived by another perception, it would be different from form.

original: de bzhin du skad cig ma las skad cig ma gzhan gzhan yin pa bzhin no zhes @317a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du skad cig ma las skad cig ma gzhan gzhan yin pa bzhin no zhes @317a * //
translated: In the same way, one moment would be different from another moment.

original: dper brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dper brjod par bya'o //
translated: This is how the example should be formulated.

original: de bzhin du chos kyi bar dag las kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos kyi bar dag las kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ji lta zhe na /
translated: How should it be said that the same is true of phenomena up to and including consciousness?

original: 'on te gzhan gyis so zhe na ni /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyis so zhe na ni /
translated: If it is by another,

original: dus tha dad par dmigs pa'i phyir gzhan yin par 'gyur te /🔽dper na rdza bo che'i sgra las rdza rnga'i sgra dang / skad cig ma las skad cig ma gzhan bzhin te /
analyzed: dus tha dad par dmigs pa'i phyir gzhan yin par 'gyur te / dper na rdza bo che'i sgra las rdza rnga'i sgra dang / skad cig ma las skad cig ma gzhan bzhin te /
translated: it would be different because it is perceived at a different time.🔽For example, the sound of a large clay drum is different from the sound of a clay drum, and one moment is different from another moment.

original: ji skad du gong du sngon po las ser po lta bu dang / skad cig ma las skad cig ma gzhan bzhin no zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du gong du sngon po las ser po lta bu dang / skad cig ma las skad cig ma gzhan bzhin no zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it was said above, “like blue from yellow, and like one moment from another.”

original: 'on te gzhan gyis so zhe na ni zhes bya ba nas rgyas par chos kyi bar dag las kyang brjod par bya bas na yul mtshan nyid tha dad pa dang mtshan nyid tha dad ma yin pa dus tha dad par dmigs pas gzhan pa nyid du bstan pa🔽kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyis so zhe na ni zhes bya ba nas rgyas par chos kyi bar dag las kyang brjod par bya bas na yul mtshan nyid tha dad pa dang mtshan nyid tha dad ma yin pa dus tha dad par dmigs pas gzhan pa nyid du bstan pa kho na yin no //
translated: But if you say that it is both other and not other, then it is taught that it is both other and not other than those phenomena, because it is observed as a different object or as a different characteristic, or as a different time.🔽But if you say that it is neither other nor not other, then it is taught that it is neither other nor not other than those phenomena, because it is observed as a different object or as a different characteristic, or as a different time.

original: 'o na gzugs dang gang zag bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te ji ltar gzugs dang gang zag dag gzhan dang gzhan ma yin par brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'o na gzugs dang gang zag bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te ji ltar gzugs dang gang zag dag gzhan dang gzhan ma yin par brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: But if you say that it is not other than those, then it is taught that it is not other than those phenomena, because it is observed as a different object or as a different characteristic, or as a different time.🔽But if you say that it is both other and not other, then it is taught that it is both other and not other than those phenomena, because it is observed as a different object or as a different characteristic, or as a different time.🔽But if you say that it is neither other nor not other, then it is taught that it is neither other nor not other than those phenomena, because it is observed as a different object or as a different characteristic, or as a different time.

original: de dag dmigs pa dag kyang gzhan dang gzhan ma yin par brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes de skad du smra na 'o na ni des na 'dus byas kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽de dag dmigs pa 'dus byas de yang brjod par bya ba ma yin pas grub pa'i mtha' nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag dmigs pa dag kyang gzhan dang gzhan ma yin par brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes de skad du smra na 'o na ni des na 'dus byas kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽de dag dmigs pa 'dus byas de yang brjod par bya ba ma yin pas grub pa'i mtha' nyams pa yin no //
translated: But if you say that it is not other than those, then it is taught that it is not other than those phenomena, because it is observed as a different object or as a different characteristic, or as a different time.🔽But if you say that it is both other and not other, then it is taught that it is both other and not other than those phenomena, because it is observed as a different object or as a different characteristic, or as a different time.🔽But if you say that it is neither other nor not other, then it is taught that it is neither other nor not other than those phenomena, because it is observed as a different object or as a different characteristic, or as a different time.🔽But if you say that it is not other than those, then it is taught that it is not

original: grub pa'i mtha' gang zag kho na brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' gang zag kho na brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: then the tenet that only the person is inexpressible would be undermined,

original: 'dus byas kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because conditioned phenomena would also be inexpressible.

original: gal te yang 'di yod la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te 'di gzugs rnams sam ma yin no zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te yang 'di yod la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te 'di gzugs rnams sam ma yin no zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin na /
translated: If you say that the person exists,

original: 'o na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gzugs bdag ma yin pa nas rnam par shes pa bdag ma yin zhes bya ba'i bar 'di gsungs te /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gzugs bdag ma yin pa nas rnam par shes pa bdag ma yin zhes bya ba'i bar 'di gsungs te /
translated: then why did the Bhagavån say that form is not the self, and so on up to: consciousness is not the self?

original: de skad du gsungs pas gang zag ni brjod par bya ba kho na yin gyi brjod par bya ba ma yin pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //🔽sgra la sogs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni gang zag ni gzugs kyi rnam par shes pas mi dmigs te /
analyzed: de skad du gsungs pas gang zag ni brjod par bya ba kho na yin gyi brjod par bya ba ma yin pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no // sgra la sogs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni gang zag ni gzugs kyi rnam par shes pas mi dmigs te /
translated: By saying this, he taught that the person is indeed expressible, and not inexpressible.🔽Like sound, etc.

original: de'i dmigs pa'i rkyen du ma gyur pa'i phyir sgra bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa'i rkyen du ma gyur pa'i phyir sgra bzhin no //
translated: The person is not perceived by the visual consciousness, because it is not the objective condition of that consciousness, like sound.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'dir dri bzhin no //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'dir dri bzhin no //
translated: The phrase “and so on” indicates that smell, etc.

original: ro bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar te /
analyzed: ro bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar te /
translated: are like taste.

original: de bzhin du 'di rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa mi @317b dmigs pa nyid du brjod par bya ste 'di ni phyogs yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa mi @317b dmigs pa nyid du brjod par bya ste 'di ni phyogs yin no //
translated: In the same way, it should be said that auditory consciousness, etc. are not perceived. This is the position.

original: nye bar dgod pa 'dis ni dam bcas pa chos can gyi khyad par las bzlog pa'i skyon brjod do zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: nye bar dgod pa 'dis ni dam bcas pa chos can gyi khyad par las bzlog pa'i skyon brjod do zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: By this example, it should be understood that the fault of contradicting the thesis is stated because of the qualification of the subject.

original: gnyis la brten nas zhes bya ba ni gnyis la brten nas zhes gsungs kyi gsum la brten nas skye'o zhes ni ma gsungs pas 'dis ni mdo dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: gnyis la brten nas zhes bya ba ni gnyis la brten nas zhes gsungs kyi gsum la brten nas skye'o zhes ni ma gsungs pas 'dis ni mdo dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: The statement “arising in dependence on two” means that consciousness arises in dependence on two, not that it arises in dependence on three. Therefore, this contradicts the sutra.🔽The sutra states: “Monks, the eye is the cause for the arising of eye consciousness. ”

original: dge slong mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa la rgyu ni mig yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la nye ba'i rkyen ni rgyu yin no //
analyzed: dge slong mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa la rgyu ni mig yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la nye ba'i rkyen ni rgyu yin no //
translated: The proximate condition is the cause.

original: ring ba ni rkyen kho na yin no //
analyzed: ring ba ni rkyen kho na yin no //
translated: The distant is the condition.

original: gzhan dag na re skyed par byed pa ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re skyed par byed pa ni rgyu'o //
translated: Others say: The cause is that which generates.🔽

original: rkyen ni dmigs pa tsam du zad do zhes zer ro ;
analyzed: rkyen ni dmigs pa tsam du zad do zhes zer ro ;
translated: According to another opinion, the cause is that which generates; the condition is that which merely assists the arising of the effect.

original: / gzhan dag na re 'di gnyis ni rnam grangs yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: / gzhan dag na re 'di gnyis ni rnam grangs yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: According to another opinion, these two terms are synonymous.

original: gang zag gzugs las gzhan yin zhes bya ba'i phyogs su thal bar 'gyur te /🔽rna ba'i rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir sgra bzhin no //
analyzed: gang zag gzugs las gzhan yin zhes bya ba'i phyogs su thal bar 'gyur te / rna ba'i rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir sgra bzhin no //
translated: The thesis that the person is other than form leads to the conclusion that the person is perceived by the visual consciousness, as is the case for form.

original: de bzhin du gang zag sgra las gzhan yin zhes bya ba'i phyogs su thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang zag sgra las gzhan yin zhes bya ba'i phyogs su thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: The thesis that the person is other than sound leads to the conclusion that the person is perceived by the auditory consciousness, as is the case for sound.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir gzugs bzhin no //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir gzugs bzhin no //
translated: The thesis that the person is other than form leads to the conclusion that the person is the object of the visual consciousness, as is the case for form.🔽The thesis that the person is other than sound leads to the conclusion that the person is the object of the auditory consciousness, as is the case for sound.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag las kyang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang zag gzugs dang sgra dag las gzhan yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs su thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag las kyang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang zag gzugs dang sgra dag las gzhan yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs su thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: The thesis that the person is other than form and sound leads to the conclusion that the person is the object of the visual and auditory consciousnesses, as is the case for form and sound.

original: sna'i rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dri bzhin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sna'i rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dri bzhin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: because they are objects of olfactory consciousness, like odors.

original: 'di ni sbyor ba'i phyir phyogs yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sbyor ba'i phyir phyogs yin no //
translated: This is the position that is to be proven.

original: rang rang gi spyod yul dang yul nyams su myong ba yin gyi zhes 'byung ba'i phyir gang zag nyams su myong ba ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rang rang gi spyod yul dang yul nyams su myong ba yin gyi zhes 'byung ba'i phyir gang zag nyams su myong ba ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: The person is not the experiencer, because it is said that the object and the sense faculty are experienced.

original: yid kyi dbang po ni 'di dag gi rten yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni zhar la bshad par zad kyi 'di dper brjod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po ni 'di dag gi rten yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni zhar la bshad par zad kyi 'di dper brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The mental faculty is the support of these, this is a mere aside, not an example.

original: de lta mod kyi yid ni dbang po 'di dag gi rten yin no zhes bya ba ni de la ltos pa'i dbang po rnams rnam par shes pa skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi yid ni dbang po 'di dag gi rten yin no zhes bya ba ni de la ltos pa'i dbang po rnams rnam par shes pa skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: However, the mental faculty is the support of these sense faculties, which means that the sense faculties that depend on it are the cause of the arising of consciousness.

original: yang na gang zag yul ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gal te mdo sde tshad mar bya na'o //
analyzed: yang na gang zag yul ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gal te mdo sde tshad mar bya na'o //
translated: Or else, the person would not be the object of the sense faculties, if you accept the sutra as valid.

original: des na cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des na cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What would follow from that?

original: gal te yul ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gal te yul ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If you say that it is not the object, then it would not be an object of consciousness.

original: gal te gang gi yul yang ma yin na 'o na ni rnam par shes par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gang gi yul yang ma yin na 'o na ni rnam par shes par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not the object of any consciousness, then it would not be an object of consciousness.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam pa lnga ste zhes bya ba rang gi grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam pa lnga ste zhes bya ba rang gi grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would contradict your own tenet that consciousness has five modes of activity.

original: gal te de ltar mdo las gzhan gyis gzhan gyi spyod @318a * //🔽yul dang yul nyams su myong ba ni ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir mig la sogs pa lnga'i tshad mar byas na rang gi yul 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: gal te de ltar mdo las gzhan gyis gzhan gyi spyod @318a * // yul dang yul nyams su myong ba ni ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir mig la sogs pa lnga'i tshad mar byas na rang gi yul 'khrul pa med do //
translated: If you say that the five sense consciousnesses are valid cognitions because a sutra says,🔽“The object field of one does not experience the object field of another,” then the five sense consciousnesses are not mistaken with regard to their objects.

original: rang gi yul la 'khrul pa med na yang gang zag mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pas rnam par shes par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi yul la 'khrul pa med na yang gang zag mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pas rnam par shes par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: If they are not mistaken with regard to their objects, then the person is not an object of eye consciousness and so on.

original: de ltar na ni yid kyi dbang po yang 'khrul pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na ni yid kyi dbang po yang 'khrul pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, the mental faculty would also be nonmistaken.

original: mdo las dbang po drug po 'di dag ni spyod yul tha dad pa can yin zhing zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo las dbang po drug po 'di dag ni spyod yul tha dad pa can yin zhing zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: These six faculties have distinct objects.

original: 'ga' zhig gis srog chags drug po khyi dang bya dang wa dang chu srin byis pa gsod dang sbrul dang spre'u rnams sprel nas bar du mdud pa bor te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis srog chags drug po khyi dang bya dang wa dang chu srin byis pa gsod dang sbrul dang spre'u rnams sprel nas bar du mdud pa bor te /
translated: Some people tie six animals—a dog, a bird, a fox, a crocodile, a snake, and a monkey—together with a rope,🔽and when they are released, they go to their respective domains and objects, such as a village, the sky, a charnel ground, water, an anthill, and a forest.

original: bor ba de dag grong dang nam mkha' dang / dur khrod dang / chu'i nang dang grog mkhar dang / nags tshal gyi nang 'dod pa'i phyir rang rang gi spyod yul dang yul 'dod pa de bzhin du dbang po drug po 'di dag kyang rang rang gi spyod yul dang yul 'dod pa yin no zhes de ltar 'dir dpe tsam du bya'o //
analyzed: bor ba de dag grong dang nam mkha' dang / dur khrod dang / chu'i nang dang grog mkhar dang / nags tshal gyi nang 'dod pa'i phyir rang rang gi spyod yul dang yul 'dod pa de bzhin du dbang po drug po 'di dag kyang rang rang gi spyod yul dang yul 'dod pa yin no zhes de ltar 'dir dpe tsam du bya'o //
translated: Similarly, these six faculties have distinct objects and domains.

original: gal te mdo'i tshig yod bzhin du yang yid kyi dbang po 'khrul pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te mdo'i tshig yod bzhin du yang yid kyi dbang po 'khrul pa yin na ni /
translated: If the mental faculty is mistaken, even though the words of the sutra exist,

original: de lta na mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyang 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyang 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the faculties such as the eye would be mistaken.

original: 'khrul na ni gang zag mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pas rnam par shes par bya ba yin par 'gyur ro zhe na //
analyzed: 'khrul na ni gang zag mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pas rnam par shes par bya ba yin par 'gyur ro zhe na //
translated: If they are mistaken, then the person would be cognized by eye consciousness, etc.

original: 'dir de ni dbang po kho na la dbang po yin par ma gsungs kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: 'dir de ni dbang po kho na la dbang po yin par ma gsungs kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Here, he says in detail, “It is not said that the person is a faculty in regard to the faculties themselves.”

original: srog chags drug pa lta bu'i mdo de las ni /
analyzed: srog chags drug pa lta bu'i mdo de las ni /
translated: In the Sutra on the Six Existents,

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po kho na la dbang po yin par ma gsungs so //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po kho na la dbang po yin par ma gsungs so //
translated: it is not said that the faculties such as the eye are faculties.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mig la sogs pa dbang po lnga la mthong ba la sogs par 'dod par mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dbang po lnga la mthong ba la sogs par 'dod par mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is impossible to maintain that the five faculties such as the eye see, etc.

original: 'di ltar 'di dag la mthong ba dang thos pa la sogs par 'dod pa mi srid de /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di dag la mthong ba dang thos pa la sogs par 'dod pa mi srid de /
translated: Thus, it is impossible to maintain that they see, hear, etc.

original: gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the entities of form.

original: de dag ni rnam par shes pa zhes mig gi rnam par shes pa la yang mthong ba la sogs par 'dod pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni rnam par shes pa zhes mig gi rnam par shes pa la yang mthong ba la sogs par 'dod pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible to maintain that visual consciousness and so on are seeing and so forth.

original: ci'i phyir 'di dag la mthong ba dang thos pa la sogs pa 'dod pa mi srid ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di dag la mthong ba dang thos pa la sogs pa 'dod pa mi srid ce na /
translated: Why is it impossible to maintain that seeing and so on are seeing and so forth?

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are devoid of conceptualization.

original: de dag gi dbang gis drangs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni dbang po yin par gsungs te dbang po dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi dbang gis drangs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni dbang po yin par gsungs te dbang po dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Mental consciousness, which is attracted by the power of those, is called a sense faculty because it is similar to a sense faculty.

original: de ni de dag gi dbang gis drangs pa yin no zhes bya bar ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: de ni de dag gi dbang gis drangs pa yin no zhes bya bar ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do you know that it is attracted by the power of those?

original: gal te mig gi sgo dang rna ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas mig gi rnam par shes pa @318b la sogs pa skyes par ma gyur na gzhan du na ji ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnam par rtog pa can de skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te mig gi sgo dang rna ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas mig gi rnam par shes pa @318b la sogs pa skyes par ma gyur na gzhan du na ji ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnam par rtog pa can de skye bar 'gyur /
translated: If visual consciousness and so on were not generated from the eye and so on as doors, then how could the conceptual mental consciousness arise in any other way?

original: de'i phyir de dag gi dbang gis drangs pa yin no zhes bya bar shes pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa mig gi dbang po la sogs pa lta bu de rang rang gi spyod yul dang yul nyams su myong zhing gzugs la sogs pa 'dod pa yin no
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi dbang gis drangs pa yin no zhes bya bar shes pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa mig gi dbang po la sogs pa lta bu de rang rang gi spyod yul dang yul nyams su myong zhing gzugs la sogs pa 'dod pa yin no
translated: Therefore, since it is known that they are drawn by the power of those, mental consciousness experiences its own domain and object field, such as form and so on.

original: // yid kyi dbang 'ba' zhig gis drangs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni yid kyi dbang gis drangs pa gang yin pa de ni de las gzhan pa mig la sogs pa'i yul la mi 'dod pa nyid do
analyzed: // yid kyi dbang 'ba' zhig gis drangs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni yid kyi dbang gis drangs pa gang yin pa de ni de las gzhan pa mig la sogs pa'i yul la mi 'dod pa nyid do
translated: That which is drawn by the power of the mental faculty alone is not drawn to objects of the eye faculty and so on.

original: // 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: // 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: rang gi yul chos kyi skye mched kho na la dmigs te /
analyzed: rang gi yul chos kyi skye mched kho na la dmigs te /
translated: It focuses on its own object field, the phenomena base alone.

original: de'i phyir gal te de lta na yid kyi dbang po yang 'khrul pa med par 'gyur te zhes smras pa gang yin pa de nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te de lta na yid kyi dbang po yang 'khrul pa med par 'gyur te zhes smras pa gang yin pa de nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore, if that is so, there is no fault in stating that the mental faculty is also undeluded.

original: gang zag ni ma yin pas zhes bya ba ci zhe na mngon par shes par bya ba dang yongs su shes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zag ni ma yin pas zhes bya ba ci zhe na mngon par shes par bya ba dang yongs su shes par bya ba'o //
translated: What is meant by “it is not a person”? It is that which is to be directly perceived and fully understood.

original: de lta bas na gang zag 'di rnam par shes par bya ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na gang zag 'di rnam par shes par bya ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the person is not an object of perception,

original: don gyis na 'di mngon bar shes par bya ba dang yongs su shes par bya ba ma yin no zhes bshad kyi don gyi rnam par shes par bya ba ma yin no zhes ni ma bshad pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: don gyis na 'di mngon bar shes par bya ba dang yongs su shes par bya ba ma yin no zhes bshad kyi don gyi rnam par shes par bya ba ma yin no zhes ni ma bshad pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: but it is not said that it is not an object of consciousness.

original: de'i phyir shes rab dang rnam par shes pa gnyis ni yul 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab dang rnam par shes pa gnyis ni yul 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, “because the objects of wisdom and consciousness are similar.”

original: mig la sogs pa ni rnam par shes par bya ba yang yin gyi mngon par shes par bya ba 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad do //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni rnam par shes par bya ba yang yin gyi mngon par shes par bya ba 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad do //
translated: The eye, etc. are objects of consciousness, not just objects of direct perception.

original: bdag med bas zhes bya ba ni mig gis te /
analyzed: bdag med bas zhes bya ba ni mig gis te /
translated: Because of selflessness, i.e., because of the eye,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because of visual consciousness, etc.

original: nges pa'i don gyi mdo la brten par gsungs zhes bya ba ni dge slong dag bzhi po 'di dag ni brten pa yin no //
analyzed: nges pa'i don gyi mdo la brten par gsungs zhes bya ba ni dge slong dag bzhi po 'di dag ni brten pa yin no //
translated: The statement one should rely on the sutras of definitive meaning is found in the sutras, for example: Monks, there are four reliances.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: chos la brten gyi gang zag la ma yin pa dang / don la brten gyi tshig 'bru la ma yin pa dang / nges pa'i don gyi mdo la brten gyi drang ba'i don la ma yin pa dang / ye shes la brten gyi rnam par shes pa la ma yin pa'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: chos la brten gyi gang zag la ma yin pa dang / don la brten gyi tshig 'bru la ma yin pa dang / nges pa'i don gyi mdo la brten gyi drang ba'i don la ma yin pa dang / ye shes la brten gyi rnam par shes pa la ma yin pa'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Rely on the teaching, not on the person; rely on the meaning, not on the words; rely on the sutras of definitive meaning, not on those of provisional meaning; rely on wisdom, not on consciousness.

original: btags pa la lhung bar zad ces bya ba ni gang kho na la tha snyad gdags pa'i don du bdag go zhes gdags par bya ba de kho na la bdag tu mngon par zhen par zad do //
analyzed: btags pa la lhung bar zad ces bya ba ni gang kho na la tha snyad gdags pa'i don du bdag go zhes gdags par bya ba de kho na la bdag tu mngon par zhen par zad do //
translated: One is simply attached to the nominal self that is the basis of the designation of the term self.

original: 'dir dper brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir dper brjod pa ni /
translated: An example of this is the following:

original: 'di la bdag gam sems can med //
analyzed: 'di la bdag gam sems can med //
translated: There is no self or sentient being here.

original: ces bya ba 'di dang / @319a * //
analyzed: ces bya ba 'di dang / @319a * //
translated: And:

original: gang zag dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zag dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: The person is not perceived.

original: zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: And:

original: de yang 'ga' yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de yang 'ga' yang mi dmigs so //
translated: One does not perceive anything at all.

original: zhes bya ba 'di yang dper brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di yang dper brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is also an example.

original: gang zhig stong pa nyid goms par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa yang med do //
analyzed: gang zhig stong pa nyid goms par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa yang med do //
translated: There is no yogi who cultivates emptiness.

original: bdag tu lta ba dang zhes bya ba nas srog tu lta bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar ni nyes dmigs dang po'o //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba dang zhes bya ba nas srog tu lta bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar ni nyes dmigs dang po'o //
translated: The first disadvantage is that one will have the view of self, etc.

original: mu stegs can rnams dang khyad par med par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: mu stegs can rnams dang khyad par med par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is that one will be no different from the tīrthikas.

original: lam gol bar zhugs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: lam gol bar zhugs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is that one will enter a wrong path.

original: 'di'i sems stong pa nyid la mi 'jug cing zhes bya ba nas rnam par grol bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i sems stong pa nyid la mi 'jug cing zhes bya ba nas rnam par grol bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth is that one’s mind will not enter emptiness, etc.

original: 'di'i 'phags pa'i chos rnams rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i 'phags pa'i chos rnams rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni lnga pa'o //
translated: The fifth is that one’s ārya dharmas will not be purified.

original: 'o na ni de dag gi ston pa yang sangs rgyas ma yin zhes bya ba ni de dag la sangs rgyas kyi bka' tshad ma ma yin pas so snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na ni de dag gi ston pa yang sangs rgyas ma yin zhes bya ba ni de dag la sangs rgyas kyi bka' tshad ma ma yin pas so snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: If that is so, then their teacher is not the Buddha, because their scriptures are not valid.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di 'ga' zhig gis mdo sde rnams sgro btags so snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di 'ga' zhig gis mdo sde rnams sgro btags so snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: This is what he thinks when he says, “This is not the word of the Buddha.”

original: sde pa gzhan thams cad las zhes bya ba ni gos dmar ba'i sde pa la sogs pa las so //
analyzed: sde pa gzhan thams cad las zhes bya ba ni gos dmar ba'i sde pa la sogs pa las so //
translated: “In all the other schools” means in the schools of the Mahāsāṃghikas, etc.

original: mdo dang mi 'gal ba ni mdo sde dang 'gal ba med pa'o //
analyzed: mdo dang mi 'gal ba ni mdo sde dang 'gal ba med pa'o //
translated: “Not in conflict with the sūtras” means not in conflict with the scriptural texts.

original: chos nyid dang yang mi 'gal ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid dang ngo //🔽chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba ni de dag ni bdag gi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: chos nyid dang yang mi 'gal ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid dang ngo // chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba ni de dag ni bdag gi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin la /
translated: “Not in conflict with reality” means not in conflict with the reality of dependent origination.🔽“All things are without self” means that they are not the nature of a self,

original: de dag la yang bdag med pas chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la yang bdag med pas chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o //
translated: and that they are without a self.

original: gnyis la brten nas zhes bya ba ni mig dang gzugs rnams nas /
analyzed: gnyis la brten nas zhes bya ba ni mig dang gzugs rnams nas /
translated: “In dependence on a pair” means in dependence on the eye and form,

original: yid dang chos rnams kyi bar la'o //
analyzed: yid dang chos rnams kyi bar la'o //
translated: up to the mind and mental objects.

original: bdag med pa ni phung po dang / skye mched dang khams rnams yin no zhes smras na re zhig sngar gzugs rnams zhes kyang brjod par mi bya /
analyzed: bdag med pa ni phung po dang / skye mched dang khams rnams yin no zhes smras na re zhig sngar gzugs rnams zhes kyang brjod par mi bya /
translated: but you also say that the self is the aggregates, bases, and elements.🔽Therefore, all instances of grasping the self are with regard to selflessness.🔽If you say that the self is the aggregates, bases, and elements, then the earlier statement that the self is not the aggregates, bases, and elements is refuted.🔽For you say that the self is not the aggregates, bases, and elements,

original: gzugs rnams ma yin zhes kyang brjod par mi bya'o zhes smras pa gang yin pa de ni bsal te /
analyzed: gzugs rnams ma yin zhes kyang brjod par mi bya'o zhes smras pa gang yin pa de ni bsal te /
translated: but you also say that the self is the aggregates, bases, and elements.

original: bdag gzhan yin pa'i phyir de ni bor bar 'gyur ro//
analyzed: bdag gzhan yin pa'i phyir de ni bor bar 'gyur ro//
translated: Therefore, all instances of grasping the self are with regard to selflessness.🔽If you say that the self is the aggregates, bases, and elements, then the earlier statement that the self is not the aggregates, bases, and elements is refuted.🔽For you say that the self is not the aggregates, bases, and elements,🔽but you also say that the self is the aggregates, bases, and elements.🔽Therefore, all instances of grasping the self are with regard to selflessness.🔽If you say that the self is the aggregates, bases, and elements, then the earlier statement that the self is not the aggregates, bases, and elements is refuted.

original: de lta bas na bdag tu 'dzin pa thams cad ni bdag med pa kho na la yin no zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan med pas so //
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag tu 'dzin pa thams cad ni bdag med pa kho na la yin no zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan med pas so //
translated: For you say that the self is not the aggregates, bases, and elements,🔽but you also say that the self is the aggregates, bases, and elements.🔽Therefore, all instances of grasping the self are with regard to selflessness.🔽If you say that the self is the aggregates, bases, and elements, then the earlier statement that the self is not the aggregates, bases, and elements is refuted.🔽For you say that the self is not the aggregates, bases, and elements,

original: gal te de lta na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te rjes su dran pa na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di dag kho na rjes su dran par gyur tam /
analyzed: gal te de lta na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te rjes su dran pa na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di dag kho na rjes su dran par gyur tam /
translated: but you also say that the self is the aggregates, bases, and elements.🔽Therefore, all instances of grasping the self are with regard to selflessness.🔽If you say that the self is the aggregates, bases, and elements, then the earlier statement that the self is not the aggregates, bases, and elements is refuted.🔽For you say that the self is not the aggregates, bases, and elements,

original: rjes su dran nam rjes su dran par 'gyur gyi gang @319b zag ni ma yin nam /
analyzed: rjes su dran nam rjes su dran par 'gyur gyi gang @319b zag ni ma yin nam /
translated: but you also say that the self is the aggregates, bases, and elements.🔽Therefore

original: ci'i phyir bdag ni 'das pa'i dus na gzugs 'di lta bu dang ldan par gyur to zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bdag ni 'das pa'i dus na gzugs 'di lta bu dang ldan par gyur to zhes gsungs te /
translated: Why did he say, “I had such and such a form in the past”?

original: bdag ces gsungs pa'i phyir gang zag la bya bar ston to //
analyzed: bdag ces gsungs pa'i phyir gang zag la bya bar ston to //
translated: He said “I,” so he is teaching that the person is the object.🔽“Those who remember in this way remember in this way in many ways.”

original: gang zag de ltar rnam pa du mas rjes su dran pa de dag de ltar rjes su dran no zhes bya bar tshig khong nas drang ngo //
analyzed: gang zag de ltar rnam pa du mas rjes su dran pa de dag de ltar rjes su dran no zhes bya bar tshig khong nas drang ngo //
translated: The meaning is that the person is the object.

original: 'di la ni ma bton pa kho na skabs yin no zhes bya ba ni bdag med ces 'don pa yin na 'jig tshogs la lta ba yongs su 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di la ni ma bton pa kho na skabs yin no zhes bya ba ni bdag med ces 'don pa yin na 'jig tshogs la lta ba yongs su 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that if one were to recite “selflessness,” it would follow, absurdly, that one would be grasping at the view of the perishing aggregates.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i mu ni nyi shu 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i mu ni nyi shu 'byung ste /
translated: Twenty views of the perishing aggregates arise.

original: bdag gzugs yin no zhes yang dag par rjes su lta ba dang / bdag gzugs dang ldan pa dang / gzugs bdag gi yin pa dang / gzugs la bdag gnas pa zhes bya ba nas de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i bar du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gzugs yin no zhes yang dag par rjes su lta ba dang / bdag gzugs dang ldan pa dang / gzugs bdag gi yin pa dang / gzugs la bdag gnas pa zhes bya ba nas de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i bar du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The self is form, the self possesses form, form belongs to the self, the self dwells in form. The same is to be said up to consciousness.

original: phung po dang rgyun la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni phung po bzhin dang rgyun bzhin no //
analyzed: phung po dang rgyun la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni phung po bzhin dang rgyun bzhin no //
translated: Like the aggregates, a continuum, etc. means like the aggregates and like a continuum.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni btung ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //🔽skad cig ma gcig la mang po rnams 'dus pa ni phung po'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni btung ba la sogs pa bsdu'o // skad cig ma gcig la mang po rnams 'dus pa ni phung po'o //
translated: The word etc. includes a row, a series, a clan, a troop, an army, a rosary, a sheaf, a bundle, a forest, a collection, and so on.🔽A heap is a collection of many things in one place.

original: skad cig ma mang po la 'dus pa dag ni rgyun no //
analyzed: skad cig ma mang po la 'dus pa dag ni rgyun no //
translated: A continuum is a collection of many things in many places.

original: phung po'i dpe ni chos mang po dag la gang zag 'dogs par ston to //
analyzed: phung po'i dpe ni chos mang po dag la gang zag 'dogs par ston to //
translated: The example of the aggregates shows that the person is designated in dependence on many things.

original: rgyun gyi dpe ni gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i phung po dag ni rgyun mang po nyid yod na gang zag 'dogs par ston to //
analyzed: rgyun gyi dpe ni gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i phung po dag ni rgyun mang po nyid yod na gang zag 'dogs par ston to //
translated: The example of the continuum shows that the person is designated in dependence on the existence of many continua of aggregates, such as form, feeling, and so on.

original: 'di ji ltar khong du chud ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i rgyud la gang du bzhed par gtad pa tsam gyis phyin ci ma log pa'i mkhyen pa skye ba gang yin pa'i mthu 'di yod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar khong du chud ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i rgyud la gang du bzhed par gtad pa tsam gyis phyin ci ma log pa'i mkhyen pa skye ba gang yin pa'i mthu 'di yod kyi /
translated: The power of unmistaken knowledge arises in the continuum of the aggregates called a buddha, merely by the intention to understand.

original: gang zag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is not the case for an individual.

original: smras pa / 'das pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: smras pa / 'das pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is said that the past, etc., exist.

original: rdzogs sangs rgyas 'das gang dag dang // zhes bya ba rgyas par brjod nas /
analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas 'das gang dag dang // zhes bya ba rgyas par brjod nas /
translated: The past perfect buddhas,🔽etc.,

original: de lta bas na phung po'i rgyun kho na la sangs rgyas zhes bya'i gang zag la ni ma yin no zhes mjug bsdu'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na phung po'i rgyun kho na la sangs rgyas zhes bya'i gang zag la ni ma yin no zhes mjug bsdu'o //
translated: Therefore, only the continuum of aggregates is called a buddha, not an individual.🔽Monks, I have taught you the burden,

original: dge slong dag khyed la khur yang bstan to zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dge slong dag khyed la khur len pa dang khur 'dor ba dang khur khyer ba yang bstan gyi de'i phyir legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zung shig dang bshad do
analyzed: dge slong dag khyed la khur yang bstan to zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dge slong dag khyed la khur len pa dang khur 'dor ba dang khur khyer ba yang bstan gyi de'i phyir legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zung shig dang bshad do
translated: the one who takes up the burden, the one who lays down the burden, and the one who carries the burden. Therefore, listen well and keep it in mind. I will teach.

original: // khur gang zhe na /
analyzed: // khur gang zhe na /
translated: What is a burden?

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o //
translated: It is the five aggregates of attachment.

original: khur len pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: khur len pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the taking up of a burden?

original: yang srid pa'i sred pa dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa de dang der mngon par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: yang srid pa'i sred pa dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa de dang der mngon par dga' ba'o //
translated: It is the craving for existence associated with delight and attraction, rejoicing in this and that existence.

original: khur 'dor ba gang zhe na /🔽yang na @320a * //🔽srid pa pa'i sred pa dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa de dang der mngon par dga' ba de nyid ma lus par spangs pa dang / so sor nges par 'byung ba dang / byang bar gyur pa dang / zad pa dang / 'gog pa dang /
analyzed: khur 'dor ba gang zhe na / yang na @320a * // srid pa pa'i sred pa dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa de dang der mngon par dga' ba de nyid ma lus par spangs pa dang / so sor nges par 'byung ba dang / byang bar gyur pa dang / zad pa dang / 'gog pa dang /
translated: What is the laying down of a burden?🔽It is the absence of craving for existence associated with delight and attraction, rejoicing in this and that existence.

original: nye bar zhi ba dang / nub pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba dang / nub pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the complete abandonment of it, its renuncia­tion, its being emptied, its being exhausted, its being freed, its being destroyed.

original: khur khyer pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: khur khyer pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the one who takes up the burden?

original: gang zag yin no zhes brjod par bya ste /🔽tshe dang ldan pa de ming ni 'di zhes bya /🔽rigs ni 'di zhes bya /🔽zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za /
analyzed: gang zag yin no zhes brjod par bya ste / tshe dang ldan pa de ming ni 'di zhes bya / rigs ni 'di zhes bya / zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za /
translated: It is the person.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu zhig myong /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu zhig myong /
translated: One should say that the venerable one is such and such a name, of such and such a family, eating such and such food, experiencing such and such pleasant and painful things, having such and such an existence.

original: tshe ni 'di tsam zhig thub /
analyzed: tshe ni 'di tsam zhig thub /
translated: Life is this much.

original: yun ni 'di srid cig gnas gnas /
analyzed: yun ni 'di srid cig gnas gnas /
translated: It endures for this long.

original: tshe'i mtha' ni 'di tsam zhig go zhes bya ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: tshe'i mtha' ni 'di tsam zhig go zhes bya ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The limit of life is just this much.

original: khur khyer bar byed pas na khur khyer ba ste dper brjod pa ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: khur khyer bar byed pas na khur khyer ba ste dper brjod pa ni 'di yin no //
translated: It is a burden-bearer because it carries a burden. This is the example.

original: de nyid kyi phyir khur nyid khur khyer ba yin par ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir khur nyid khur khyer ba yin par ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is not logical that the burden itself is the burden-bearer.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi phung po len pa yang phung pos ma bsdus par thal bar yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gang zag bzhin du phung pos ma bsdus par thal bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi phung po len pa yang phung pos ma bsdus par thal bar yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gang zag bzhin du phung pos ma bsdus par thal bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: It would also follow that the appropriator of the aggregates, which has the characteristics explained above, would not be included in the aggregates.

original: de ltar yang mi 'dod de de lta bas na phung po len pa bzhin gang zag phung po dag las don gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang mi 'dod de de lta bas na phung po len pa bzhin gang zag phung po dag las don gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: But that is unacceptable, so the appropriator of the aggregates is not a different object from the aggregates, just like the person.

original: khur khyer ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis ci nas kyang zhes bya ba thams cad rgyas par brjod nas /
analyzed: khur khyer ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis ci nas kyang zhes bya ba thams cad rgyas par brjod nas /
translated: The Buddha said that the burden-bearer is the one who puts down the burden.

original: gzhan du shes par mi 'gyur bar zhes bya ba brjod par bya'o //🔽gal te gang zag rdzas su yod par 'gyur na mdo de las khur khyer ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan du shes par mi 'gyur bar zhes bya ba brjod par bya'o // gal te gang zag rdzas su yod par 'gyur na mdo de las khur khyer ba gang zhe na /
translated: It should be said that it is not understood in any other way.🔽If the person were substantially existent, then the sutra would have said only this:🔽“What is the one who carries the burden?

original: gang zag yin no zhes brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba de kho na tsam zhig gsungs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang zag yin no zhes brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba de kho na tsam zhig gsungs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: It is the person.”

original: yang tshe dang ldan pa ming ni 'di zhes bya zhes bya ba nas rgyas par tshe'i mtha' ni 'di tsam zhig go zhes bya ba'i bar rnam par ma phye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang tshe dang ldan pa ming ni 'di zhes bya zhes bya ba nas rgyas par tshe'i mtha' ni 'di tsam zhig go zhes bya ba'i bar rnam par ma phye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But it would not have distinguished it by saying, “The venerable one is named so-and-so,” and so on, up to “his life span is so long.”

original: yang khyad par du mdzad pa 'di ni gang zag btags par yod pa yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa yin te /🔽ci nas kyang de nyid btags pa'i yod pa yin par shes par bya'i /
analyzed: yang khyad par du mdzad pa 'di ni gang zag btags par yod pa yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa yin te /🔽ci nas kyang de nyid btags pa'i yod pa yin par shes par bya'i /
translated: The intention is that this distinction is made in order to understand that the person exists as a nominal reality.🔽It is thought that the person is a nominal reality, not a substantial reality.

original: gang zag rdzas su yod pa la rtag pa dang brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes gzhan du ni shes par ma byed cig ces bya ba yin no //🔽phung po snga ma rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba de la phung po gang dag gnod pa byed cing sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur pa de @320b dag ni khur zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gang zag rdzas su yod pa la rtag pa dang brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes gzhan du ni shes par ma byed cig ces bya ba yin no // phung po snga ma rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba de la phung po gang dag gnod pa byed cing sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur pa de @320b dag ni khur zhes bshad do //
translated: Do not understand that the substantially existent person is permanent and inexpressible.🔽The former aggregates are called the burden, because they are the cause of harm and suffering.

original: phyi ma gnod par 'gyur ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni khur khyer ba zhes bshad do //🔽sems can skye ba pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba la mdzes par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi ma gnod par 'gyur ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni khur khyer ba zhes bshad do // sems can skye ba pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba la mdzes par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The latter aggregates are called the bearer of the burden, because they are harmed.🔽The term “living being” is used because it is beautiful when applied to a living being.

original: gang zag bden pa rnams kyi khongs su ma gtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ji ltar kun brtags pa'i gang zag ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i khongs su ma gtogs te /
analyzed: gang zag bden pa rnams kyi khongs su ma gtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ji ltar kun brtags pa'i gang zag ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i khongs su ma gtogs te /
translated: Because the person is not included among the truths,

original: gang zag ni sdug bsngal nas lam gyi bar ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zag ni sdug bsngal nas lam gyi bar ma yin no //
translated: the person is not suffering, up to it is not the path.

original: de'i gang zag la skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba 'di ni bden pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i gang zag la skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba 'di ni bden pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba yang ma yin te /
translated: This wrong view that deprecates the person is not to be abandoned by seeing the truths.

original: bden pa gang la log par zhugs pa de ni bden ba de mthong bas spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bden pa gang la log par zhugs pa de ni bden ba de mthong bas spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For if one engages in error with regard to a truth, then it is abandoned by seeing that truth.

original: de bzhin du gang zag sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i khongs su ma gtogs pa'i phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang zag sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i khongs su ma gtogs pa'i phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, it is not to be abandoned by the path of meditation because the person is not included in the categories of suffering and origin.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i dngos po kho na la dmigs so //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i dngos po kho na la dmigs so //
translated: For afflictions to be abandoned by the path of meditation focus on the things that are suffering and origin and are to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: de ltar na de ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
