analyzed: de ltar na de ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus it follows that the person is not to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: gang zag de gnyis kyi khongs su ma gtogs pas de'i phyir de bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zag de gnyis kyi khongs su ma gtogs pas de'i phyir de bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the person is not included in those two categories, it is not to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: yang na lta ba ni nam yang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma yin pas de bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma yin no //🔽til gcig dang 'bras thug po che gcig ces bya ba lta bu dang / phung po gcig dang tshig gcig ces bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rdzas brgyad pa yin yang til gcig dang 'bras thug po gcig ces bya ba dang /
analyzed: yang na lta ba ni nam yang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma yin pas de bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma yin no // til gcig dang 'bras thug po che gcig ces bya ba lta bu dang / phung po gcig dang tshig gcig ces bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rdzas brgyad pa yin yang til gcig dang 'bras thug po gcig ces bya ba dang /
translated: Or else, the view is never to be abandoned by the path of meditation, so it is not to be abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽Just as one sesame seed and one grain of rice are said to be one measure and one word,

original: de bzhin du phung po gcig dang tshig gcig ces bya ba ltar gang zag gcig ces bya ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phung po gcig dang tshig gcig ces bya ba ltar gang zag gcig ces bya ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: so it is with one person.🔽Because you accept that it possesses arising.

original: skye ba dang ldan pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni skye'o zhes smras pas de skye ba dang ldan pa nyid du khas blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: skye ba dang ldan pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni skye'o zhes smras pas de skye ba dang ldan pa nyid du khas blangs pa yin te /
translated: Since you say that it arises, you accept that it possesses arising.

original: de'i phyir khyed kyis 'dus byas yin no zhes brjod dgos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyed kyis 'dus byas yin no zhes brjod dgos so //
translated: Therefore, you must say that it is a conditioned phenomenon.

original: phung po gzhan len pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de 'dus byas nyid du mi 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: phung po gzhan len pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de 'dus byas nyid du mi 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Because it takes up another set of aggregates, it is not a conditioned phenomenon.

original: dper na rig pa blangs pa'i phyir mchod sbyin pa skyes so zhes bya ba 'di 'byung ba'i don du skyes pa ma yin pa de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: dper na rig pa blangs pa'i phyir mchod sbyin pa skyes so zhes bya ba 'di 'byung ba'i don du skyes pa ma yin pa de dang 'dra ste /
translated: For example, it is said that a sacrificer is born in order to take up the knowledge of the Vedas, but he is not born for the purpose of arising.

original: thams cad sbyar bar bya'o //🔽chos su brdar btags pa ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par @321a * //
analyzed: thams cad sbyar bar bya'o // chos su brdar btags pa ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par @321a * //
translated: This should be applied in all cases.

original: 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid la ma gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid la ma gtogs pa ste /
translated: Except for the conventional designation of phenomena, means except for the characteristic of dependent origination.

original: de yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de yang 'di lta ste /
translated: That is to say,

original: 'di yod pas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di yod pas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: it is said, “Because this exists, that occurs.”

original: byed pa po ni mi dmigs so zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni las ni byed pa po mi dmigs so //
analyzed: byed pa po ni mi dmigs so zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni las ni byed pa po mi dmigs so //
translated: The agent is not observed, etc. means that the action is not observed in the agent.

original: de yang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na smras pa /
analyzed: de yang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na smras pa /
translated: What is it like?

original: gang zhig tshe 'di'i phung po rnams 'dor zhing gtong la tshe phyi ma'i phung po gzhan dag nyid mtshams sbyor zhing nye bar len par byed pa rdzas su yod par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig tshe 'di'i phung po rnams 'dor zhing gtong la tshe phyi ma'i phung po gzhan dag nyid mtshams sbyor zhing nye bar len par byed pa rdzas su yod par gnas pa'o //
translated: The person who abandons and gives up the aggregates of this life and connects with and takes up the aggregates of the next life exists substantially.

original: dbo las skyes len ces mi smra'o zhes bya ba ni gal te ngas 'di skad du 'di len to smras na /
analyzed: dbo las skyes len ces mi smra'o zhes bya ba ni gal te ngas 'di skad du 'di len to smras na /
translated: “I do not say that Udayin takes up.”

original: tshig de khyod la legs par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: tshig de khyod la legs par 'gyur ram /
translated: “Would those words be appropriate for you?”

original: btsun pa ma lags so //
analyzed: btsun pa ma lags so //
translated: “No, Venerable Sir.”

original: de lta bas na phung po rnams len par byed pa dang 'dor bar byed pa ni 'ga' yang med do zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na phung po rnams len par byed pa dang 'dor bar byed pa ni 'ga' yang med do zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: “Therefore, there is no one at all who takes up or abandons the aggregates.”

original: de yang de dang 'dra la zhes bya ba ni skad cig re re la sngon med pa kho na las skye ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de yang de dang 'dra la zhes bya ba ni skad cig re re la sngon med pa kho na las skye ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: “That is also like that” means that it is only produced from what did not exist previously, in every moment.

original: gal te gang zag yin no zhe na ni de ma grub po zhes bya ba la sogs pa nye bar dgod pas ni dpe ma grub pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: gal te gang zag yin no zhe na ni de ma grub po zhes bya ba la sogs pa nye bar dgod pas ni dpe ma grub pa nyid du ston to //
translated: If you say that it is the person, then that is not established, etc. This is the argument that shows that the example is not established.

original: lus dang rig pa dang rtags bzhin du zhes bya ba la rig pa dang rtags ni rig pa dang rtags so //
analyzed: lus dang rig pa dang rtags bzhin du zhes bya ba la rig pa dang rtags ni rig pa dang rtags so //
translated: Like body, knowledge, and sign. Knowledge and sign are knowledge and sign.

original: lus dang rig pa dang rtags ni lus dang rig pa dang rtags dag go //
analyzed: lus dang rig pa dang rtags ni lus dang rig pa dang rtags dag go //
translated: Body, knowledge, and sign are body, knowledge, and sign.

original: de dag dang 'dra bar te lus dang rig pa dang rtags bzhin du phung po dang gang zag dag gzhan nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag dang 'dra bar te lus dang rig pa dang rtags bzhin du phung po dang gang zag dag gzhan nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Like them, the aggregates and the person would be different.

original: ji ltar blang bar bya ba'i rig pa dang rtags las lus gzhan nyid yin pa de bzhin du blang bar bya ba phung po las kyang gang zag gzhan nyid yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar blang bar bya ba'i rig pa dang rtags las lus gzhan nyid yin pa de bzhin du blang bar bya ba phung po las kyang gang zag gzhan nyid yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Just as the body is different from the knowledge and sign that are to be grasped, so the person would be different from the aggregates that are to be grasped.

original: rga ba dang na ba yang lus gzhan kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs rnams skad cig re re la gzhan nyid yin par bsams pa ste de la rga ba skyes so //
analyzed: rga ba dang na ba yang lus gzhan kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs rnams skad cig re re la gzhan nyid yin par bsams pa ste de la rga ba skyes so //
translated: Aging and sickness are also different bodies. This means that the states are different in each moment. In that case, the example that was given, “Aging has arisen, sickness has arisen,” is not established.

original: na ba skyes so zhes gang smras pa'i dpe ma grub po zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: na ba skyes so zhes gang smras pa'i dpe ma grub po zhes ston par byed do //
translated: This is what is being shown.

original: 'on te yang lus gnas pa la gnas skabs gzhan log na gnas skabs gzhan 'byung ngo snyam du sems na grangs can pa'i 'gyur bar smra ba de ni mdzod gyi gnas gong mar bkag zin to //
analyzed: 'on te yang lus gnas pa la gnas skabs gzhan log na gnas skabs gzhan 'byung ngo snyam du sems na grangs can pa'i 'gyur bar smra ba de ni mdzod gyi gnas gong mar bkag zin to //
translated: But if you think that when the state of abiding of the body is destroyed, another state arises, then this is the Sāṃkhya theory of transformation, which has already been refuted in the previous chapter of the Treasury of Abhidharma.

original: ji skad du zhe na gnas pa gang la chos gzhan gyi khyad par du yongs su brtag par bya ba'i chos can de nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhe na gnas pa gang la chos gzhan gyi khyad par du yongs su brtag par bya ba'i chos can de nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: How is it refuted? The entity that is imagined to be the special quality of abiding does not exist.

original: de nyid 'di yin la de lta na yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi rigs pa 'di ni sngon @321b ma byung ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'di yin la de lta na yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi rigs pa 'di ni sngon @321b ma byung ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is because it is said, “This is just that, but it is not like that,” and this type of statement is unprecedented.

original: 'byung ba dag ni ba zhi yin /
analyzed: 'byung ba dag ni ba zhi yin /
translated: The elements are the primary.🔽Form is one.

original: gzugs ni gcig yin zhes bya ba ni gzugs gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs ni gcig yin zhes bya ba ni gzugs gang zhe na /
translated: What is form?

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The four great elements and that which is derived from the four great elements.

original: smra ba 'di ni phyogs la yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni smra ba 'di phyogs 'ga' zhig la yod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: smra ba 'di ni phyogs la yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni smra ba 'di phyogs 'ga' zhig la yod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This statement exists in some quarters.

original: 'byung ba tsam gyi phyogs la 'o zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan sangs rgyas lha'i phyogs la yod kyi /
analyzed: 'byung ba tsam gyi phyogs la 'o zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan sangs rgyas lha'i phyogs la yod kyi /
translated: The phrase in the position that it is merely an element refers to the position of the elder Buddhadeva.

original: kho bo cag gi phyogs la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi phyogs la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not our position.

original: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba tsam gyi phyogs la 'byung ba dag las gzugs gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du phung po dag las gang zag gzhan ma yin no zhes khas blangs pa yin pas rang gi grub pa'i mtha' yongs su bor bar
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba tsam gyi phyogs la 'byung ba dag las gzugs gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du phung po dag las gang zag gzhan ma yin no zhes khas blangs pa yin pas rang gi grub pa'i mtha' yongs su bor bar
translated: The phrase even so means that, in the position that it is merely an element, form is not different from the elements. In the same way, the person is not different from the aggregates. Thus, you have abandoned your own doctrine.

original: 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The meaning is that you have thought this through.

original: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis srog de nyid lus yin pa'am gzhan yin no zhes lung ma bstan zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis srog de nyid lus yin pa'am gzhan yin no zhes lung ma bstan zhes bya ba la /
translated: Why did the Lord not answer the question, Is the life force the same as the body or different?

original: de la de dag gi bsam pa ni gal te phung po dag kho na la gang zag nye bar 'dogs na ci'i phyir lus kho na srog yin no zhes ma bshad snyam pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: de la de dag gi bsam pa ni gal te phung po dag kho na la gang zag nye bar 'dogs na ci'i phyir lus kho na srog yin no zhes ma bshad snyam pa 'di yin no //
translated: The thought of those who ask this question is, If the person is a designation applied to the aggregates alone, why did he not answer, 'The life force is the body'?

original: snga ma dag kho nas zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan klu sde la sogs pas so //
analyzed: snga ma dag kho nas zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan klu sde la sogs pas so //
translated: The former ones are the Sthavira Nāgasena and so on.

original: smra ba mang ba zhes bya ba ni gcor pa'o //
analyzed: smra ba mang ba zhes bya ba ni gcor pa'o //
translated: The many speakers are the Lokottaravādins.

original: pha rol pos gal te gang zag brjod par bya ba ma yin na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang med pa kho na'o zhes ma gsungs zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: pha rol pos gal te gang zag brjod par bya ba ma yin na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang med pa kho na'o zhes ma gsungs zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The opponent says, “If the person is not to be described, why did the Bhagavān not say that it is nonexistent?”

original: de ni de bstan pa yang mi bzod do zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa bstan du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni de bstan pa yang mi bzod do zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa bstan du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “It is not able to bear that teaching” means that it is not suitable to teach selflessness.

original: snga nas kun du rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang ldan pa'i rmongs pas so //
analyzed: snga nas kun du rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang ldan pa'i rmongs pas so //
translated: “Delusion from the beginning” is delusion through possessing the view of the transitory collection.

original: phyir zhing ches rgyas par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni chad par lta ba dang ldan pa'i lta ba gzhan skyed par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: phyir zhing ches rgyas par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni chad par lta ba dang ldan pa'i lta ba gzhan skyed par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: “It would increase more and more” means that another view possessing the view of annihilation would be generated.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bdag gi bdag sngon yod par 'gyur ba las da ni bdag gi de yang med do zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bdag gi bdag sngon yod par 'gyur ba las da ni bdag gi de yang med do zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “Previously, the self of the self existed, but now it does not exist.”

original: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba ni btsun pa gzhon nu len gyis so //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba ni btsun pa gzhon nu len gyis so //
translated: Here, “it is said” refers to the Venerable Kumāralāta.

original: lta ba'i mche bas smos pa dang zhes bya ba ni lta ba nyid mche ba yin te /
analyzed: lta ba'i mche bas smos pa dang zhes bya ba ni lta ba nyid mche ba yin te /
translated: “Chewed by the fangs of views” means that views themselves are the fangs.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni des smas pa la ltos nas gnyen po chos bdag med pa yang ston par mdzad do //🔽las rnams 'jig pa la ltos nas te byas pa chud za ba la ltos nas gang zag yod pa nyid lta bur ston pa rnams gzhan du yang ston @322a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni des smas pa la ltos nas gnyen po chos bdag med pa yang ston par mdzad do // las rnams 'jig pa la ltos nas te byas pa chud za ba la ltos nas gang zag yod pa nyid lta bur ston pa rnams gzhan du yang ston @322a * //
translated: The Lord Buddhas, in dependence on those who are chewed by that, also teach the antidote, the selflessness of phenomena.

original: par mdzad do //
analyzed: par mdzad do //
translated: In dependence on the destruction of karma, in dependence on the loss of what was done, the Lord Buddhas also teach in other ways, as if the person itself exists.

original: stag mos phru gu khyer ba ltar //
analyzed: stag mos phru gu khyer ba ltar //
translated: Like a tigress carrying her cubs,

original: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar stag mos 'di'i lus mche bas smos par 'gyur na mi rung de snyam nas sos ha cang bag med par bzung ste yang phru gu mi khyer mi khrid la 'dis 'di la lhung ste snad par gyur du 'ong ngo snyam nas sos
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar stag mos 'di'i lus mche bas smos par 'gyur na mi rung de snyam nas sos ha cang bag med par bzung ste yang phru gu mi khyer mi khrid la 'dis 'di la lhung ste snad par gyur du 'ong ngo snyam nas sos
translated: This is like a tigress who thinks, “It is not right for me to tear this body with my claws,” and so she holds the cub with her mouth, but she does not carry it off or lead it away, thinking, “It might fall down and get hurt.”

original: ha cang lhad lhod du bzung ste /
analyzed: ha cang lhad lhod du bzung ste /
translated: She holds it too loosely,

original: yang de mi khyer gyi ran par bzung ste khyer ba lta bur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang de mi khyer gyi ran par bzung ste khyer ba lta bur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: but she carries it off properly, holding it just right.

original: gzhan dag ni khrid pa zhes 'don te gnas gzhan nas khrid cing spog par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni khrid pa zhes 'don te gnas gzhan nas khrid cing spog par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Others read “leads” instead of “holds,” and the meaning is that she leads it away from one place and carries it to another.

original: de bzhin du don ston pa la rgyu bstan pa'i phyir bdag yod nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du don ston pa la rgyu bstan pa'i phyir bdag yod nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par smos te /
translated: Similarly, in order to show the reason for teaching the meaning, he says, “If one engages with the belief in the self,” and so on at length.

original: gal te bdag yod pa nyid du zhugs par gyur na 'dul ba'i skye bo ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i mtshan nyid kyi lta ba'i mche bas zhes smos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bdag yod pa nyid du zhugs par gyur na 'dul ba'i skye bo ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i mtshan nyid kyi lta ba'i mche bas zhes smos par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one engages with the belief in the self, then the person who is being disciplined would be said to be “torn by the fangs of views,” which are characterized by the afflicted view of the self.

original: kun rdzob rtogs par ma gyur nas zhes bya ba ni chos kyi brda mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob rtogs par ma gyur nas zhes bya ba ni chos kyi brda mi shes pa ste /
translated: If one does not understand the conventional, one does not understand the symbols of the Dharma.

original: las kyi 'bras bu med do snyam nas dge ba'i chos stag gi phru gu lta bu nyams par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu med do snyam nas dge ba'i chos stag gi phru gu lta bu nyams par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thinking that the effect of action does not exist, one destroys the good Dharma, like a tiger destroys her cubs.

original: btags pa la yod pa ni btags pa ste la la gang zag kun rdzob tu yod pa yang med do snyam du 'dzin par 'gyur bas de'i phyir med do zhes kyang ma gsungs so //
analyzed: btags pa la yod pa ni btags pa ste la la gang zag kun rdzob tu yod pa yang med do snyam du 'dzin par 'gyur bas de'i phyir med do zhes kyang ma gsungs so //
translated: The existence of the nominal is nominal. Some think that the person does not exist even conventionally. Therefore, the Buddha did not say that it does not exist.

original: yod na ci'i phyir yod mi gsung //
analyzed: yod na ci'i phyir yod mi gsung //
translated: If it exists, why did he not say that it exists?

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te gang zag yang dag pa'i don du yod na bcom ldan 'das ci'i phyir gang zag yod do zhes mi gsung /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te gang zag yang dag pa'i don du yod na bcom ldan 'das ci'i phyir gang zag yod do zhes mi gsung /
translated: If the person exists in an ultimate sense, why did the Lord not say that the person exists?

original: gzugs yod do zhes smras pa la ni nyes par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs yod do zhes smras pa la ni nyes par mi 'gyur te /
translated: There is no fault in saying that form exists.

original: de yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it exists.

original: gcer bu pa'i nyan thos kyi bye'u bzung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gcer bu pa'i nyan thos shig gis bye'u gson po zhig bzung nas bcom ldan 'das la byi'u 'di gson na ma mi gson zhes dris so //
analyzed: gcer bu pa'i nyan thos kyi bye'u bzung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gcer bu pa'i nyan thos shig gis bye'u gson po zhig bzung nas bcom ldan 'das la byi'u 'di gson na ma mi gson zhes dris so //
translated: A disciple of the Ājīvikas caught a live bird and asked the Fortunate One, “Is this bird alive or dead?”

original: de'i bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: His idea was this:

original: gal te dge sbyong goo ta ma gson no zhes gsungs na ni des de btsir nas bsad de ston par byed do //
analyzed: gal te dge sbyong goo ta ma gson no zhes gsungs na ni des de btsir nas bsad de ston par byed do //
translated: If the Fortunate One says, “It is alive,” he will squeeze it and kill it to prove him wrong.

original: gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du shi'o zhes gsungs na ni des de gson po kho nar ston par byed do//
analyzed: gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du shi'o zhes gsungs na ni des de gson po kho nar ston par byed do//
translated: If the Fortunate One says, “It is dead,” he will prove him wrong by showing that it is alive.

original: de ni ji ltar na 'jig rten gyi thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par shes par 'gyur snyam du mngon bar zhen to //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar na 'jig rten gyi thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par shes par 'gyur snyam du mngon bar zhen to //
translated: How can I know that he is not omniscient in the world?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni de'i bsam pa mkhyen nas lung ma bstan gyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni de'i bsam pa mkhyen nas lung ma bstan gyi /
translated: The Fortunate One, knowing his thoughts, did not answer.

original: 'di gson nam mi gson pa ni khyod kyi sems kyi kho na las so zhes bya ba kho na gsungs pa de dang 'dra bar 'di yang lung ma @322b bstan to //
analyzed: 'di gson nam mi gson pa ni khyod kyi sems kyi kho na las so zhes bya ba kho na gsungs pa de dang 'dra bar 'di yang lung ma @322b bstan to //
translated: This is an indeterminate question.

original: bzhi tshan 'di ni don mthun no //
analyzed: bzhi tshan 'di ni don mthun no //
translated: This tetralemma is similar to the one that has the same meaning.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten rtag go 'jig rten mi rtag go zhes bya ba'i bzhi tshan 'di dang 'jig rten mtha' dang ldan no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten rtag go 'jig rten mi rtag go zhes bya ba'i bzhi tshan 'di dang 'jig rten mtha' dang ldan no //
translated: The tetralemma “The world is eternal,” “The world is not eternal,” etc., and the tetralemma “The world is finite,” “The world is infinite,” etc.,
